title: At DistribuTECH, West Monroe Survey Reveals Disconnects Between U.S. Utility Executives and Managers That Could Slow Process of Grid Modernization
name: At DistribuTECH, West Monroe Survey Reveals Disconnects Between U.S. Utility Executives and Managers That Could Slow Process of Grid Modernization

summary_info.summary_title: At DistribuTECH, West Monroe Survey Reveals Disconnects Between U.S. Utility Executives and Managers That Could Slow Process of Grid Modernization

global_field.meta_title: At DistribuTECH, West Monroe Survey Reveals Disconnects Between U.S. Utility Executives and Managers That Could Slow Process of Grid Modernization
global_field.meta_description: Cybersecurity tops list of concerns utilities must address to advance the integration of information technology and operational technology

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Jan. 24, 2018 (SAN ANTONIO) – Differences between U.S. utility executives and managers may be creating a cultural rift that could impede utilities’ ability to integrate information technology (IT) and operational technology (OT) – a critical step in many utilities’ path to grid modernization. And, cybersecurity is the top concern on everyone’s minds – both around the risk associated with integrated systems and insufficient expertise within the utility work force. These are among the key findings from new research released today at DistribuTECH by West Monroe Partners, a national business and technology consultancy.

Industry survey results highlight challenges utilities face as they modernize. The findings provide valuable insight into how utilities are managing the integration of IT and OT, and where they should focus to advance their strategies. More than 140 U.S. utility professionals, representing a range of utility types, services, and sizes, completed the survey in late 2017. 

The full research paper, “Managing Grid Modernization: Integrating IT and Operations at U.S. Utilities,” is being shared at DistribuTECH, the leading annual electric power transmission and distribution conference, Jan. 23-25, 2018. It is also available for free download on West Monroe’s website.

Successful grid modernization requires strengthened organizational structures and change management – yet the survey results point to gaps in culture, priorities, and expectations between C-suite executives motivated to move their organizations into the future and managers focused on current operations. 

“It is not unusual for large organizations to experience a disconnect between the C-suite and managers. This is especially true for large investor-owned utilities that are grappling with distinct organizations spread across a large geographical area or even across multiple states,” said Daniel Belmont, senior director in West Monroe's Energy & Utilities practice. “To make meaningful progress with grid modernization, utility executives must be aware of this gap and, more importantly, understand how to close it.”

The survey also explored concerns that may be limiting progress around IT/OT integration. Among the various issues studied – which ranged from governance of devices and systems to retraining staff – cybersecurity was far and away the leading concern and a key reason utilities are moving cautiously on technology integration. Two-thirds of respondents cited cybersecurity systems and devices as a top concern for managing converged IT/OT systems. Moreover, a majority (55 percent) said cybersecurity/NERC-CIP was the top skill or certification lacking in their workforce. 

“In addition to the usual headaches accompanying a service disruption, a cyber-attack carries significant reputational risks, which may prompt heightened caution from leadership at investor-owned utilities,” said Jodi Bednar, senior principal in the Energy & Utilities practice. “From our perspective, utilities are working on this issue, and the survey shows that they are acutely aware of the importance – but also the challenge – of bolstering cybersecurity skills.”

The survey report also allows utility executives to compare their own progress in other areas critical to advancing grid modernization, including: 

  • The degree to which IT and operational teams share asset management, knowledge management, and ticketing systems 

  • Current use of IT frameworks (including ITIL, COBIT, FCAPS, or eTOM) for managing the complexity associated with coordinating IT and OT operations 

  • Prevalence of a “single pane of glass” to monitor and manage grid health

Survey author Daniel Belmont is on-site at DistribuTECH discussing the survey results with utility executives and other attendees. Visit West Monroe at booth #2761. 

About West Monroe Partners

West Monroe is a progressive business and technology consulting firm that partners with dynamic organizations to reimagine, build, and operate their businesses at peak performance. Our team of more than 950 professionals is comprised of an uncommon blend of business consultants and deep technologists. This unique combination of expertise enables us to design, develop, implement, and run strategic business and technology solutions that yield a dramatic commercial impact on our clients’ profitability and performance.

title: BearingPoint a challenger in Gartnerâ€™s 2014 â€˜Magic Quadrant for Business Operations Consulting Services, Worldwideâ€™
name: BearingPoint a challenger in Gartnerâ€™s 2014 â€˜Magic Quadrant for Business Operations Consulting Services, Worldwideâ€™

summary_info.summary_title: BearingPoint a challenger in Gartnerâ€™s 2014 â€˜Magic Quadrant for Business Operations Consulting Services, Worldwideâ€™

global_field.meta_title: BearingPoint a challenger in Gartnerâ€™s 2014 â€˜Magic Quadrant for Business Operations Consulting Services, Worldwideâ€™
global_field.meta_description: BearingPoint alliance partners ABeam and West Monroe Partners also cited in the report

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Leading industry analysis firm Gartner recognizes BearingPoint in its latest report on business operations consulting. In the 2014 ‘Magic Quadrant for Business Operations Consulting Services, Worldwide’ report, Gartner positioned BearingPoint as a challenger for its completeness of vision and ability to execute.

The firm is well known for its operational change management, leadership in end-to-end supply chain management and innovative enablement capabilities as well as smart analytics tools HyperCube, the emissions calculator LogEC and the Supply Chain Navigator, a methodology to drive strategy down to operational results. Most recently, LogEC was - as first emissions calculator in the market - certified to major European regulation standards, enabling clients to calculate their emissions in a transparent, standardized and accepted way across Europe. With its global alliance network partners ABeam and West Monroe Partners, BearingPoint helps clients worldwide to design and optimize their supply chain, reduce risk and control operational costs.

“We believe this industry recognition demonstrates the leadership of BearingPoint, ABeam and West Monroe in delivering innovative solutions to our clients in the supply chain management and operations space. I feel that with this recognition Gartner acknowledges our way of working together with our clients for measurable results,” said Matthias Loebich, partner at BearingPoint and firm-wide leader for Discrete Industries.

“We believe our business operations core competencies allow us to help clients improve efficiency, labour productivity and market position,” said Sean Adkins, Managing Director and leader of West Monroe’s operations excellence practice. “We are thrilled that Gartner has recognized for the third year in a row. We feel it is because of the unique ability of our alliance to deliver workforce optimization services to the retail and distribution industries.”

“We are proud to be named a challenger in the Garter Magic Quadrant for Business Operation Consulting Services, Worldwide, for three years,” said Yuichi Yamada, managing director at ABeam Consulting (Europe) B.V. “We believe this continued recognition as a challenger highlights our commitment to driving innovation into the markets so that our clients are able to achieve their business and performance goals. We will continue to partner with the clients to help them achieve their business goals through our innovative solutions and industry expertise.”

Source

  • Gartner; Magic Quadrant for Business Operations Consulting Services, Worldwide; 2014, published December 3, 2014 (ID: G00263297). Gartner analysts Michael Dominy and Dana Stiffler

  • The “Magic Quadrant for Business Operations Consulting Services, Worldwide” report evaluates 9 business consulting service providers for their global business operations consulting capabilities, including Supply Chain Management.

About BearingPoint

BearingPoint consultants understand that the world of business changes constantly and that the resulting complexities demand intelligent and adaptive solutions. Our clients, whether in commercial or financial industries or in government, experience real results when they work with us. We combine industry, operational and technology skills with relevant proprietary and other assets in order to tailor solutions for each client’s individual challenges. This adaptive approach is at the heart of our culture and has led to long-standing relationships with many of the world’s leading companies and organizations. Our global consulting network of 9200 people serves clients in more than 70 countries and engages with them for measurable results and long-lasting success. For more information, please visit www.bearingpoint.com.

title: BearingPoint and West Monroe announce new book, "Darwinism in a Consumer Driven World"
name: BearingPoint and West Monroe announce new book, "Darwinism in a Consumer Driven World"

summary_info.summary_title: BearingPoint and West Monroe announce new book, "Darwinism in a Consumer Driven World"

global_field.meta_title: BearingPoint and West Monroe announce new book, "Darwinism in a Consumer Driven World"
global_field.meta_description: Customer Experience experts discuss how evolutionary thinking is driving the digital revolution

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Management and technology consulting firms West Monroe Partners and BearingPoint today announced publication of their book, Darwinism in a Consumer Driven World. The book, co-authored by Kyle Hutchins, director of Customer Experience at West Monroe, and Erik Campanini, Digital Marketing, Sales & Customer Management leader at BearingPoint, uses various nature-driven models to decode modern consumerism and the challenges it poses to today’s businesses.

Darwinism analyzes the disruption of traditional business models and specific brands through the lens of Darwin’s evolutionary theory, and provides strategies firms can employ to thrive in today’s multiplatform, data-driven age. The authors draw on principles from sociology, anthropology and biology to provide business leaders with a practical guide for adapting their organizations to succeed in a changing world.

“Companies should stop thinking of the ever-changing technology and consumer landscape as a threat but rather as an opportunity,” said Kyle Hutchins. “Today, it’s not necessarily the largest or oldest organizations that survive, it’s the ones that are most agile.”

“We’re seeing a move away from the traditional transactional model of consumerism toward one that’s more relationship-based,” said Erik Campanini. “Given this shift, along with the unprecedented amount of customer data available today, organizations must think strategically about how to rebuild consumer trust on a new level and how to improvise.”

Darwinism was published by Pearson, and is available for digital purchase on Amazon.com.

About the Authors

Erik Campanini has almost 20 years of experience in the Digital Marketing, Sales & Customer Management and is leading the Digital offering of BearingPoint. Erik serves Internet Pure players as well as global firms in their digital transformation around three major focuses: top line development, digital KPIs, and the digital innovation. Erik facilitates a Global Digital Center of Excellence within BearingPoint, a leading edge incubator to share with its clients the next digital emerging trends and challenges. You can find Erik on Twitter @erikcampanini.

Kyle Hutchins is the Director of Customer Experience at West Monroe. He believes a well-executed customer experience strategy is paramount to market differentiation – ultimately leading to higher customer loyalty and profitability. He has spent 15 years advising clients in both a management consulting, and a digital agency capacity. Kyle’s core experience and skills include customer experience strategy, facilitation and customer experience governance, web content management design and implementation, and multi-channel marketing strategy. You can find Kyle on Twitter @kylehutchins.

About West Monroe

West Monroe is a North American, business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 450 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US. For more information, visit our website at www.westmonroe.com.

About BearingPoint

BearingPoint consultants understand that the world of business changes constantly and that the resulting complexities demand intelligent and adaptive solutions. Our clients, whether in commercial or financial industries or in government, experience real results when they work with us. We combine industry, operational and technology skills with relevant proprietary and other assets in order to tailor solutions for each client’s individual challenges. This adaptive approach is at the heart of our culture and has led to long-standing relationships with many of the world’s leading companies and organizations. Our global consulting network of 9200 people serves clients in more than 70 countries and engages with them for measurable results and long-lasting success.   • “It’s an honour for our partnership to be included in the Challenger quadrant of Gartner’s Magic Quadrant for Business Operation consulting services.”

Yvon Donval, Partner at BearingPoint and Supply Chain Service Line lead said:

  • “We believe this industry recognition demonstrates the leadership of BearingPoint, ABeam and West Monroe in delivering innovative solutions to our clients in the SCM and operations space.”
  • “Our clients select BearingPoint and our partners for our innovative approach, deep industry expertise and unmatched capabilities to deliver end-to-end projects, from strategy all the way to implementation.”

Josh Sandstrom, a director with West Monroe added:

title: West Monroe Enters Strategic Partnership with Beezy to Deliver Engaging Employee Experiences
name: West Monroe Enters Strategic Partnership with Beezy to Deliver Engaging Employee Experiences

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Enters Strategic Partnership with Beezy to Deliver Engaging Employee Experiences

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Partnership begins with successful relaunch of Horizon Therapeutics’ Intranet, The Pulse

CHICAGO – West Monroe Partners, a national business and technology consulting firm, today announced a partnership with Beezy Inc., the all-in-one Intelligent Workplace for Microsoft Office 365, to address growing demand from enterprises in North America for an engaging and collaborative digital workplace.

Leading organizations today face enormous pressure to engage employees and stay ahead of the competition to thrive in the digital economy. An empowered workforce underpins any effort to improve customer experience, boosting profitability, productivity, and agility. A modern digital workplace helps accelerate innovation, strengthen customer experience, unlock productivity, and drive competitive advantage in the digital economy.

Recently, West Monroe brought a multi-disciplinary team of deep technologists, healthcare and life sciences industry expertise, human-centered design specialists, and change management knowledge to Horizon Therapeutics, where it implemented Beezy to create a more social and community-centric employee experience at their organization.

“Relaunching our intranet, The Pulse, on the Beezy platform and partnering with West Monroe for the implementation was a success for our organization, creating a more engaging experience for all employees, as well as allowing us the ability to share company news and information in a socially focused environment,” said Paul Robbins, associate director of digital workplace at Horizon Therapeutics.

With this new partnership, West Monroe and Beezy offer clients in North America an Intelligent Workplace solution with valuable strategic advisory and professional support during the stages of strategy, implementation, execution, and adoption. The combination will enable and accelerate clients’ ability to mobilize a digital workplace strategy that will deliver immediate business value while maximizing their existing investment in Microsoft and Office 365 technologies.

“Our intent is to partner with innovative companies that can accelerate how we bring value to our clients across all industries,” said Tyson Hartman, senior director of strategic partners and innovation at West Monroe. “And Beezy is a perfect example of that kind of partner.

Together, West Monroe and Beezy will focus on the rollout of Beezy´s Intelligent Workplace solution at large enterprise clients in North America. As a Solution Partner, West Monroe can assist clients looking to dramatically improve their employee experience with everything from strategy to adoption. Additionally, Beezy and West Monroe have developed an Envisioning Workshop offering for organizations interested in understanding how they can transform their digital workplace experience.

“We are excited to partner with West Monroe, one of the leading, high-quality business and technology consulting firms in North America. Their expertise in transforming business cultures will have a significant impact on the success of our Intelligent Workplace platform in large enterprises,” said Jordi Plana, CEO of Beezy.

West Monroe is a leading partner for organizations looking to establish, enhance, or overhaul their digital workplace strategy. It has partnered with leading organizations on their digital workplace journeys, helping two major clients win Nielsen Norman Group awards for the “World’s 10 Best Intranets.

“Beezy provides a great all-in-one solution for an engaging intelligent workplace. Their approach in building a great user experience that fosters collaboration and engagement aligns with our perspective that the employee is at the center of digital transformation within a company,” said Kaumil Dalal, director in West Monroe’s Technology practice.

About West Monroe Partners
West Monroe is a national business and technology consulting firm that partners with dynamic organizations to reimagine, build, and operate their businesses at peak performance. Our team of more than 1,400 professionals is comprised of an uncommon blend of business consultants and deep technologists. This unique combination of expertise enables us to design, develop, implement, and run strategic business and technology solutions that yield a dramatic commercial impact on our clients’ profitability and performance. For more information, visit www.wmp.com.

About Beezy
Beezy is the all-in-one Intelligent Workplace for Microsoft Office 365. We make collaboration within your organization easy and relevant. By extending the Microsoft productivity stack, we unify the digital workplace and empower users to communicate, share and collaborate better, whether on-premises, in the cloud or in hybrid environments.
Large customers such as Monster, Bank of England, ZF and many more can now benefit from the full functionality of an intelligent, modern digital workplace that brings together Collaboration, Communication, Knowledge and Processes.

Media Contact
Christina Galoozis
Media Relations Manager
cgaloozis@wmp.com
312.447.6623

title: Brad Haller Announced as Winner of the 7th Annual Emerging Leaders Awards
name: Brad Haller Announced as Winner of the 7th Annual Emerging Leaders Awards

summary_info.summary_title: Brad Haller Announced as Winner of the 7th Annual Emerging Leaders Awards

global_field.meta_title: Brad Haller Announced as Winner of the 7th Annual Emerging Leaders Awards

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Brad Haller, Senior Manager in West Monroe Partners’ Chicago Mergers & Acquisitions practice, was named an Emerging Leader by The M&A Advisor in the Service Area category. The M&A Advisor, renowned globally for its recognition of leading M&A, financing and turnaround professionals, created this event to promote mentorship and professional development amongst the emerging business leaders. Brad Haller has been chosen for his accomplishments and expertise from a pool of nominees by an independent judging panel of distinguished business leaders. 

“Brad can be best described as one of our most committed and professional individuals at our firm. Brad does an excellent job leading by example so that those that follow in his footsteps have a strong foundation to lead strong projects,” said John Stiffler, senior director and the leader of West Monroe's Mergers and Acquisitions practice in Chicago. “Brad is the fourth team member in four consecutive years to gain this honor from our M&A team – which comes as no surprise based on Brad’s strong work ethic and client satisfaction scores.”

Brad manages strategic projects advising C-level executives and private equity professionals on a variety of topics such as due diligence, post-merger integration, divestiture analysis, cost takeout opportunities, program management, process improvement, technology modernization, organizational transformation, target operating models, and governance model design. Brad has advised buyers on more than 100 transactions focusing on key risks, scalability, and synergy identification across strategy, people, process, and technology.

“The Annual M&A Advisor Emerging Leaders Awards was born as the 40 Under 40 Awards in the United States in 2010 to recognize and celebrate the achievements of young M&A, Financing and Turnaround professionals who had reached a significant level of success and made a notable contribution to their industry and community. With the expansion of the Emerging Leaders program to the United Kingdom, and Europe earlier this year, the 2016 US award winners join a truly global network of young leaders,” said David Fergusson, President and Co-CEO of The M&A Advisor. 

On Friday, June 10th, The M&A Advisor will host a black tie Awards Gala at the New York Athletic Club in Manhattan to introduce the Emerging Leaders Award Winners to the business community and celebrate their achievements.

THE M&A ADVISOR

The M&A Advisor was founded in 1998 to offer insights and intelligence on M&A activities. Over the past eighteen years we have established the premier global network of M&A, Turnaround and Finance professionals. Today, we have the privilege of presenting, recognizing the achievements of, and facilitating connections between the industry’s top performers throughout the world with a comprehensive range of services. To learn more visit www.maadvisor.com

title: Brian Paulen to Assume Leadership for West Monroeâ€™s Seattle Office
name: Brian Paulen to Assume Leadership for West Monroeâ€™s Seattle Office

summary_info.summary_title: Brian Paulen to assume leadership for West Monroeâ€™s Seattle Office

global_field.meta_title: Brian Paulen to assume leadership for West Monroeâ€™s Seattle Office
global_field.meta_description: Effective January 1, 2015 Brian Paulen will step in as leader of West Monroe Partnersâ€™ Seattle office operations.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Effective January 1, 2015, Brian Paulen will step in as leader of West Monroe Partners’ Seattle office operations. Paulen, who joined the firm in January 2014, has brought tremendous operating experience and a strong set of local relationships to further propel the growth of the office. Brian is an established relationship builder, business developer, and people focused leader.  

The firm’s shift in office leadership will allow its founder Tom Bolger, to focus time and energy on the firm’s strategic growth initiatives and accelerate the growth of existing offices and expansion of West Monroe’s geographic footprint. Bolger will remain in the Seattle office and continue to oversee the firm’s West Coast operations. The Seattle office, now in its 9th year, ended 2014 with more than 60 consultants.

“I’m thrilled that I have the opportunity to hand over the reins to one of the best leaders I’ve known,” said Tom Bolger, manager director of strategic growth.  “I have no doubt that Brian is going to lead the office to new heights and believe that we have never been better positioned for growth and continued development.”

“I feel very privileged to have the amazing opportunity to lead our thriving team in Seattle,” shared Paulen. “We are experiencing growth, both in headcount and revenue, unlike any other time in our firm’s history. I’m very much looking forward to the challenge of continuing to build a unique culture and foundation that Tom Bolger established. I’m eager to elevate the firm’s momentum in the Seattle marketplace.”

Paulen joined West Monroe with its acquisition of Madrona Solutions Group, a Seattle-based consultancy he co-founded and ran as CEO in July 2005. The firm helped mid-market and enterprise-sized clients build customer relationship management solutions on the Dynamics CRM and Salesforce.com platforms. Under Paulen’s leadership, Madrona Solutions Group was a very successful CRM and Analytics business which grew to approximately 35 employees over seven years. The firm repeatedly was recognized as one of the fastest growing private companies in Washington and received various “Best Company to Work For” awards.

Moving forward, the Seattle office has plans to expand its team and capabilities into the next year and beyond.  In 2015, the Seattle team is expecting to grow by more than 20 consultants and is focused on adding a Security and Compliance service line as well as Organizational Change Management services, both of which are existing overall firm focus areas. Additionally, to build on the firm’s national strength in the retail sector, under Paulen’s leadership the office will look to develop relationships with many of the Pacific Northwest’s successful retailers.  Beyond 2015, the office is expected to continue its aggressive growth by offering other strategic, efficiency driving solutions to customers.

title: Carl Monje Announced as Winner of the 6th Annual 40 Under 40 Emerging Leaders Awards
name: Carl Monje Announced as Winner of the 6th Annual 40 Under 40 Emerging Leaders Awards

summary_info.summary_title: Carl Monje Announced as Winner of the 6th Annual 40 Under 40 Emerging Leaders Awards

global_field.meta_title: Carl Monje Announced as Winner of the 6th Annual 40 Under 40 Emerging Leaders Awards

richtext.rich_text_editor:
The M&A Advisor announced the winners of the 40 Under 40 Emerging Leaders Awards on Monday, May 18th. Carl Monje, Director of West Monroe Partners’ Los Angeles Mergers & Acquisitions practice was named a winner for the Service Area Category. He has been chosen for his accomplishments and expertise from a pool of nominees by an independent judging panel of distinguished business leaders.

The M&A Advisor, renowned globally for its recognition of leading M&A, financing and turnaround professionals, created this event to promote mentorship and professional development amongst the emerging business leaders.

Monje serves as a strategic advisor to middle-market corporate executives and leading private equity investors in the healthcare, consumer goods, multi-channel retail, manufacturing, distribution, food and beverage, and financial services industries. His areas of expertise span the transaction lifecycle and include merger & acquisition strategy, transaction due diligence, corporate divestitures, post-merger integration, and IT assessment & strategy.

In his current role, Carl leads West Monroe’s West Coast M&A practice working with private equity and strategic buyers to perform pre-transaction IT and operational due diligence which focuses on transaction risks, synergies, integration, or divestiture costs. He also performs post-transaction integration and carve-out execution activities. To date, Carl has served as an advisor on more than 175 merger, acquisition, and carve-out transactions.

“Over the course of Carl’s tenure are West Monore he has proven to be a compelling and impactful leader in the M&A space,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe’s President and CEO. “Carl has been instrumental in West Monroe’s growth as a trusted advisor to our clients – through pre-close and post- close valuation creation, Carl helps executives achieve their investment thesis.”

“In 2010 we initiated the 40 UNDER 40 Awards to recognize the emerging leaders of the M&A, Financing and Turnaround industries” said David Fergusson, President and Co-CEO of The M&A Advisor. “It is our belief that this group of accomplished women and men will have a significant effect on the advancement of our industry. And it is our great pleasure to recognize them and provide a forum for them to meet and engage with one another”.

On Monday, June 29th, The M&A Advisor will host a black tie Awards Gala at the Roosevelt Hotel in Manhattan to introduce the 40 Under 40 Emerging Leaders Award Winners to the business community and celebrate their achievements. The Awards Gala is a feature of the 2015 Emerging Leaders Summit – an exclusive event pairing current and past 40 Under 40 winners together with their peers and industry stalwarts.

The M&A Advisor

Since 1998, The M&A Advisor has been presenting, recognizing the achievement of and facilitating connections between the world’s leading mergers and acquisitions, financing and turnaround professionals with a comprehensive range of services including M&A SUMMITS; M&A AWARDS; M&A CONNECTS™; M&A ALERTS™, M&A LINKS™, M&A DEALS, MandA.TV and M&A MARKET INTEL™. Visit www.maadvisor.com to learn more.

global_field.meta_description: Los Angeles-based director adds over 17 years of global digital strategy experience

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, announced that Chris Hodges has joined the Customer Experience Practice as a director in the Los Angeles office. Hodges has more than 17 years of information technology leadership and management consulting experience, working with an array of Fortune 500 enterprises in retail and other industries.

Chris Hodges has a strong track record for leading complex, large-scale, omni-channel initiatives integrating eCommerce, marketing, branding, social media, mobile, digital, and other strategies to elevate customer experience and enable business strategies. He will be focused on strengthening West Monroe’s Customer Experience practice and digital strategy capabilities to better serve clients in Southern California.

As an accomplished problem solver, project manager, and change enabler, Chris works with executive-level leaders across multiple channels and business units to align technology strategies and solutions with business goals. His well-honed skills in training, coaching, and motivating diverse resources, including international team members, have been instrumental in creating pragmatic, fiscally responsible, and sustainable solutions.

“The realm of customer experience and digital strategy is becoming increasingly sophisticated, and our clients are grappling with how to create a seamless experience through the many touchpoints along the customer journey,” said Ken Siegman, senior director of the Los Angeles office. “Chris’s in-depth knowledge of omni-channel marketing and digital solutions will greatly benefit our clients, and his experience as a leader and mentor will be instrumental to growing our LA-based customer experience practice.”

Hodges joined West Monroe from Curvature, a Santa Barbara, California-based provider of enterprise infrastructure solutions and services for which he was global vice president of strategic alliances. He established go-to-market relationships with several of the largest global technology organizations who in turn offered Curvature services as part of their portfolio of services. Hodges began his career at Accenture, specializing in customer relationship management (CRM) and eCommerce strategy and platforms; and also served as a senior principal in the Retail and Digital Transformation practices of Infosys Consulting, Inc.

"West Monroe is known for developing innovative customer experience initiatives that blend business acumen and technology expertise to put human-centered design thinking first. I am excited to join the firm’s Los Angeles office as it expands its presence on the West Coast and look forward to building upon its strong reputation to grow the customer experience practice,” said Hodges.

Hodges earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Management Information Systems from Florida State University.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Chicago-based Senior Principal Adds More Than 20 Years of Healthcare and Telecommunications ExperienceWest Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that Cindy Thomas has joined the firm as a senior principal in the Customer Experience Practice. She has more than 20 years of experience in the healthcare and telecommunications industries and has held executive positions in administration, operations, and customer experience.

Thomas’s professional achievements include leading large business and IT transformation efforts, developing and executing call center strategy, driving successful organizational change, developing competitive differentiation, and implementing cost-effective solutions while enhancing customer experience.

“Cindy Thomas is an innovative, customer-focused executive with an outstanding track record for directing large-scale business operations and key strategic initiatives,” said Doug Armstrong, West Monroe Partners’ Customer Experience practice leader. “Her expertise will be invaluable to our clients, across industries, which are looking at customer experience as a way to distinguish themselves in the marketplace and strengthen competitive position.”

Thomas joined West Monroe Partners from CIGNA Healthcare, where she was vice president for national service operations and customer experience. In this role, she directed a 1,300-employee service organization and received recognition for successfully migrating customers to a new core administration system and seamlessly consolidating work from nine centers to six centers. 

“Delivering a differentiated customer experience is a big change for most organizations, requiring shifts in both operations and culture,” said Thomas. “West Monroe Partners has demonstrated distinctive capabilities and impressive results in this area, and I’m pleased to have this opportunity to apply my experience and insights across a broad spectrum of enterprises.”

Previously, Thomas was vice president for national service center operations for Great-West Life and Annuity, which was acquired by CIGNA Healthcare. She also served in several other management and executive roles related to telecommunications, field operations, and administration for Great-West Life and Annuity during her more than 22 years with the company.

Thomas earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Business Administration from Colorado State University and a Masters of Telecommunications degree from the University of Denver. She completed the American Health Insurance Plan’s Executive Leadership Program and earned the distinction of Certified Health Insurance Executive.


About West Monroe Partners
West Monroe Partners is a North American business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 350 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada.

CommunityHealth, Illinois’ largest free clinic, will add Will Hinde to its board of directors. Hinde is a Director in West Monroe’s healthcare practice, which focuses on managed care and health insurance organizations. With more than 15 years of consulting experience, Will has extensive experience across multiple IT disciplines including business and IT strategy formation, systems integration and consolidation, and enterprise architecture.  He has been active with a variety of non-profit organizations including Autism Speaks, Big Brothers and Chicago Cares.  

“CommunityHealth has an excellent and impressive track record of making a real difference here in Chicago. The current era of reform introduces many impacts to the care and delivery model, and hopefully my experience with reform guidelines in addition to technology implications will be put to good use as CommunityHealth navigates these complex challenges,” says Hinde.  

Will joins other business leaders supporting CommunityHealth on the board including; James M. Durkin, President, The Martec Group, Inc., and Joseph B. O’Malley, Managing Director, JP Morgan Chase.   For a full list of Board members visit www.communityhealth.org/leadership-team/.

“We are thrilled to welcome Will to our board of directors and to engage him in our discussions as we carefully think through our plans for the future.  Will brings great enthusiasm and an additional perspective with his IT background that will lend tremendous value to the leadership team at CommunityHealth,” says Judith Haasis, Executive Director of CommunityHealth. 

About CommunityHealth

Founded in 1993, CommunityHealth is dedicated to serving the uninsured and underserved in Chicago and surrounding communities. In 2013, CommunityHealth will provide more than 30,000 medical and dental visits for 11,000 patients. This level of care is made possible thanks to the time and talent of more than 1,400 volunteers, including 500+ providers (physicians, nurses, nurse practitioners, dentists, pharmacists, counselors, etc.) who in 2012 donated more than 58,000 hours of their time. CommunityHealth’s main facility, The Lederman Family Health Center, is located in Chicago’s West Town – 2611 W. Chicago Ave, and the Englewood site at 641 W. 63rd Street. For more information or to provide support please visit www.communityhealth.org.

title: Companies and Consumersâ€™ Digital Priorities Arenâ€™t Aligned, West Monroeâ€™s 2022 Be Digital Research Finds
name: Companies and Consumersâ€™ Digital Priorities Arenâ€™t Aligned, West Monroeâ€™s 2022 Be Digital Research Finds

summary_info.summary_title: Companies and Consumersâ€™ Digital Priorities Arenâ€™t Aligned, West Monroeâ€™s 2022 Be Digital Research Finds
summary_info.summary_description: Survey of 700 C-suite execs and 5,000 consumers reveals digital progress, priorities

global_field.meta_title: Companies and Consumersâ€™ Digital Priorities Arenâ€™t Aligned, West Monroeâ€™s 2022 Be Digital Research Finds
global_field.meta_description: Survey of 700 C-suite execs and 5,000 consumers reveals digital progress, priorities

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Survey of 700 C-suite execs and 5,000 consumers reveals digital progress, priorities

CHICAGO, August 9, 2022—West Monroe, one of the fastest-growing digital services firms, today announces the results of their inaugural survey of companies across seven industries and 5,000 of their customers. The survey finds that organizations are well on their way to realizing their digital future, but still have opportunities to further enhance and align their vision, products, customer engagement, data, and people strategies—as well as the operational processes that connect them.

While a majority of the C-suite believes they’ve built a compelling vision for a digital agility model, the stakes are high for companies amid a challenging economy and high customer expectations. To realize their digital vision, companies are focused on three major priorities: improving the customer experience (37%), enhancing their data capabilities (35%) and improving scalability through process improvement (32%).

“It’s time to say goodbye to the idea of digital transformation as a box to check. Clark Kent can walk into a phone booth and come out as Superman – but unless you’re a superhero, that kind of transformation is unrealistic,” says Matt Johnson, Managing Director in West Monroe’s Product, Experience & Engineering Lab. “Organizations don’t need superpowers to evolve. They just need agility. It starts with a digital mindset and translates across every decision and department within the organization.”

Additional Key Findings Include:

  • Vision: Digital isn’t something you do, it’s something you are – a mindset – and companies are in the early stages of this transition. Nearly all (95%) report they have a clear sense of how digital fuels growth, but only 47% say they are very effective at having a digital mindset.
  • Products & Experiences: Almost a majority organizations (49%) say they’re very effecting at putting the consumer at the center of everything, but consumers reveal some misaligned priorities. For example, consumers care much more about simplicity and much less about personalization, access to guidance, and new digital products and services than companies think they do.
  • Data & Technology: All organizations give themselves a passing grade for data maturity, but only 43% grade themselves an A, and others may be grading on a curve. For example, just over half have cloud-based data, IP and infrastructure, and only 50% use data as a catalyst for change. A vast majority of companies are investing to close both of those gaps.
  • Customer Engagement: Only 37% of companies grade their customer experience as an A, and consumers have made it clear that anything less than an A is a failure. Nearly two thirds of consumers (63%) say they will switch to another company if their experience is lacking.
  • Business Operations: With data capabilities a key goal, 47% of companies are also investing significantly to enable algorithmic decision-making, which can enable agility across the organization and allow for flexibility and speed in meeting consumer needs. Organizations are evolving quickly to a more iterative model, with 48% reporting they are very effective at prioritizing fast over perfect.
  • Organization & People: Digital must be a team sport, but only 25% say their full C-suite is responsible for digital transformation. However, nearly half are investing significantly to help with employee enablement and to move to a more decentralized organizational design.

“It’s encouraging to see companies recognize the importance of enabling data-driven decision-making and agile thinking. But there’s more work ahead,” says Casey Foss, Chief Commercial Officer at West Monroe. “With consumer expectations and preferences constantly changing, the key is access to real-time data and insights.”

For more findings and to learn more about West Monroe’s digital agility model, view the full Be Digital research here.

Be Digital Signature Research
Be Digital, West Monroe’s signature research initiative, polled 700 C-Suite executives across seven industries (financial services, healthcare providers, healthcare insurers, manufacturing, retail, technology and utilities) and more than 5,000 of their representative consumers. The survey was conducted by Rabin Research Company, an independent marketing research firm, using Op4G’s panel of executives.

About West Monroe
West Monroe is a digital services firm that was born in technology but built for business—partnering with companies in transformative industries to deliver quantifiable financial value. We believe that digital is a mindset—not a project, a team, or a destination—and it’s something companies become, not something they do. That’s why we work in diverse, multidisciplinary teams that blend management consulting, digital design, and product engineering to move companies from traditional ways of working to digital operating models—and create experiences that transcend the digital and physical worlds. Connected by the 13 founding values that drive our culture, our 2,000 employees work collaboratively across the firm with the belief that our clients’ success is our success. Visit WestMonroe.com to learn more.

title: Dan Rosanova achieves 2012 Microsoft MVP Award
name: Dan Rosanova achieves 2012 Microsoft MVP Award

summary_info.summary_title: Dan Rosanova achieves 2012 Microsoft MVP Award

global_field.meta_title: Dan Rosanova achieves 2012 Microsoft MVP Award
global_field.meta_description: Rosanova, a senior architect in the Technology Integration practice, was granted the MicrosoftÂ® MVP Award for BizTalk Server for the third time.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
The Microsoft MVP Award in the BizTalk category is given to exceptional technical leaders in the community who actively share their high quality, real world expertise with others. Dan is 1 of only 34 in the world recognized by Microsoft as one of the best and brightest in the BizTalk category.

West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced Dan Rosanova, a senior architect in the Technology Integration practice, was granted the Microsoft® MVP Award for BizTalk Server for the third time.

To receive the Microsoft MVP Award, nominees undergo a formal review process. A panel that includes members of the MVP team and Microsoft product groups evaluates each nominee's technical expertise and voluntary community contributions for the past 12 months. Dan provided many answers in community forums, ran a monthly Chicago BizTalk User Group (CBUG), contributed content to Microsoft’s MSDN site, wrote a BizTalk book and blogged dozens of times over 2011 to receive the accolade.

Dan published BizTalk Server 2010 Patterns recently in October 2011. The book provides a thorough introduction to BizTalk Server 2010 as a platform and guides readers through real world lessons and examples that will help them build an advanced unified solution that can be used as reference architecture.

Dan has over twelve years of experience delivering solutions on Microsoft platforms in the financial services, insurance, banking, telecommunications, and logistics industries, where he has specialized in high volume and low latency distributed applications. Dan has extensive experience with .NET, XML, services, and queuing.

West Monroe Partners

Our more than 300 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced Dan Rosanova, a senior architect in the Technology practice, was granted the Microsoft® MVP Award for Microsoft Integration for the fifth consecutive year.

The Microsoft MVP Award in the Microsoft Integration category is given to exceptional technical leaders in the community who actively share their high quality, real world expertise with others. Dan is 1 of only 34 in the world recognized by Microsoft as one of the best and brightest in the Microsoft Integration category. To receive the Microsoft MVP Award, nominees undergo a formal review process.

A panel that includes members of the MVP team and Microsoft product groups evaluates each nominee's technical expertise and voluntary community contributions for the past 12 months. Dan provided many answers in community forums, ran a monthly Chicago BizTalk User Group (CBUG), contributed content to Microsoft’s MSDN site, and spoke at multiple conferences about BizTalk, Big Data, and Cloud Computing to receive the accolade.

In 2013 Dan spoke at NVIDIA’s GPU Technology Conference, Hadoop Summit Amsterdam, Great Lakes Symposium on Smart Grid and the New Energy Economy, and Big Data TechCon. He was also interviewed by Computer World, Baseline and Forrester Research. Additionally, Dan is speaking in March at BizTalk Summit in London and in April at Big Data Tech Con in Cambridge, MA as he continues to explore techniques for integrating advanced technologies into today’s businesses.

Dan has over fifteen years of experience delivering solutions on Microsoft platforms in the financial services, insurance, banking, utilities, telecommunications, and logistics industries, where he has specialized in high volume and low latency distributed applications and machine learning.

title: Dan Rosanova publishes BizTalk Server 2010 Patterns
name: Dan Rosanova publishes BizTalk Server 2010 Patterns

summary_info.summary_title: Dan Rosanova publishes BizTalk Server 2010 Patterns

global_field.meta_title: Dan Rosanova publishes BizTalk Server 2010 Patterns

richtext.rich_text_editor:
The book provides a thorough introduction to BizTalk Server 2010 as a platform and guides readers through real world lessons and examples that will help them build an advanced unified solution that can be used as reference architecture.

West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced the worldwide book release of BizTalk Server 2010 Patterns authored by Dan Rosanova, a senior architect in the Technology Integration practice.

BizTalk Server 2010 Patterns goes beyond the basics of BizTalk Server 2010 development and provides relevant background, theory, and techniques necessary to create successful solutions. You will learn how the BizTalk Server 2010 platform works internally and how to plan for the necessary infrastructure needed for an installation. It explores how to build messaging-based solutions, including content-based routing, that are easy to manage and change. Rosanova explains further how users can solve common integration and middleware challenges by leveraging the strengths of BizTalk Server 2010.

Targeted at the professional developer or architect tasked with creating solutions that leverage BizTalk Server 2011 and associated tools, this book serves as a critical reference for creating middleware and integration solutions with established patterns and practices that increase the effectiveness and impact of your solutions. Advanced BizTalk developers will learn many tips and techniques to improve the solutions they develop on the BizTalk 2010 platform.

Dan Rosanova is a two-time Microsoft BizTalk MVP with over twelve years of experience delivering solutions on Microsoft platforms in the financial services, insurance, banking, telecommunications, and logistics industries, where he has specialized in high volume and low latency distributed applications. Dan has extensive experience with .NET, XML, services, and queuing.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a progressive business and technology consultancy, today announced that Daniel Brousseau has joined the firm as a director in its Customer Experience practice. Brousseau has 25 years of management consulting and industry experience, and most recently was a Vice President and Consulting Director at Forrester Research, where he launched and led the led customer experience and digital strategy consulting practice.

Brousseau brings deep expertise in a range of areas related to customer experience and digital transformation, including strategy development, governance, experience design, customer insights and measurement, and organizational change. During his career, Brousseau has led hundreds of customer experience strategy, technology, and innovation engagements and major transformation initiatives across Fortune 500, mid-market and start-up firms. His industry expertise includes banking, healthcare, and energy and utilities.

“Dan Brousseau is an accomplished business leader and consultant, with an enviable track record for transforming large organizations at the intersection of customers, innovation, technology, and strategy,” said Will Wu, director in West Monroe’s customer experience practice and head of its San Francisco office. “Dan’s unique blend of technology and business consulting acumen will be a valuable addition to our arsenal for helping clients to develop insights and build effective customer strategies. We are fortunate to have someone with his caliber of experience as part of our team.”

Brousseau’s professional experience includes founding a successful boutique customer experience consultancy; launching and leading the US subsidiary of Genuine Health, a top Canadian consumer products brand; establishing a strategic partners function at Fair Issac Corporation (FICO); and holding leadership positions at Bridge Strategy Group, Renaissance Strategy, and SRI International.

The addition of Brousseau to the San Francisco team is part of a multi-year strategy for West Monroe to expand its capabilities, particularly in the Bay Area. The firm recently moved to a new location at 100 First Street to accommodate its rapid growth in the area. 

“Planning and executing a differentiated customer experience represents a big shift and a major effort for most organizations, requiring significant changes across strategy, operations, digital technology and culture,” Brousseau said. “West Monroe has built out deep capabilities and has earned a strong reputation for innovation and impressive results driving measurable outcomes across customer experience and digital business. I am excited to join the San Francisco office and look forward to helping strengthen the people-first culture of our growing team, while building upon the firm’s strong reputation nationally to help clients create advantage through customer experience.”

title: Dave Galatte Joins West Monroeâ€™s Technology Services and Advanced Analytics practices
name: Dave Galatte Joins West Monroeâ€™s Technology Services and Advanced Analytics practices

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that Dave Galatte has joined the firm as a director in the Technology Services and Advanced Analytics practices. Galatte has more than 20 years of experience leading IT and service organizations at the executive level, building effective teams and business relationships to drive success. He is based in the firm’s Chicago office.

“Given the significant changes in today’s marketplace, business and IT functions need to work together more effectively than they have in the past. This requires IT organizations to evolve their operating models to help drive business performance, scale, and market impact,” said Doug Armstrong, managing director and leader of West Monroe’s Chicago office. “Dave Galatte is a highly respected technology consultant and trusted advisor to CIOs and business executives alike. He has skills and experience uniquely suited for helping our client’s master shift, fundamentally changing the way they do business.”

Galatte has an accomplished track record for delivering complex, transformational IT strategies and solutions that deliver insight necessary for effective business decisions. He combines strong strategic planning and program management experience with deep technology skills in IT governance and portfolio management, enterprise portfolio design and management, enterprise and solution architecture, ITIL service methodology, IT organization design and management, IT process design and improvement, cloud services, web application development, web content management systems, and enterprise resource planning (ERP) implementation. In addition to insurance and systems expertise gained during his tenure as a corporate IT leader, Galatte also has diverse industry experience spanning professional services, retail, manufacturing, non-profit, and other sectors.

Galatte joins West Monroe from Florida Family Insurance, where he was director of IT service delivery and the enterprise transformational program director. He led a multi-year strategic program focused on upgrading and re-developing mission-critical applications and improving IT processes. He also led the application development, business analysis, quality assurance, project management, and IT relationship management functions.
Previously, Galatte held various roles within NTT Data Inc./The Revere Group for nearly 17 years, including vice president of managed IT services. In that capacity, he launched and managed the day-to-day operations of the Managed IT Services organization. He also served as an executive-level IT strategy consultant for numerous IT strategy projects for an array of clients. His previous experience includes IT portfolio director with Sears Roebuck & Co.

“I am impressed by West Monroe’s understanding of how diverse technology disciplines must come together to enable a fundamental shift in business and how the firm has built its Technology Services team to enable that,” said Galatte. “I look forward to contributing my own experience and helping clients drive value through technology.”

Galatte earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Industrial Technology and a Master of Business Administration degree with emphasis on finance and IT from Northern Illinois University.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced that Dave Nash has joined the firm as a director in its Customer Experience practice.

“Dave Nash brings a highly strategic perspective, but one grounded in the practical application of customer intelligence, marketing, and financial skills, along with a strong orientation for quality execution,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe’s managing director and head of the Chicago office. “His combination of skills has produced an exemplary track record for delivering measurable operational and financial results and will be vital to our clients across industries going forward.”

Nash joins West Monroe from CSC Global Business Services-Americas, where he was a principal and practice lead for Customer Analytics in both the Strategic Services and Analytic Insights & Information Management (AIIM) practices. During his tenure at CSC, he crafted and implemented customer strategy, experience, and intelligence strategies that incorporated customer insights, data, technology, process, and organizational change to drive customer loyalty, maximize customer value, and improve overall financial results.

Previously, Nash was a director of marketing strategy with CIGNA, where he led the client value management initiative. Earlier in his career he was also a consultant with Peppers & Rogers Group, a 1-to-1 marketing strategy firm; a manager with Ernst & Young’s Customer Connections practice; and an internal marketing consultant with Citibank. He began his career as a corporate banking officer and financial analyst with Key Bank’s Healthcare Finance group.

Nash has authored numerous whitepapers and published articles on customer experience, customer analytics, marketing, and economics, including “Applying Ecology to Maximize Customer Value” and “Behavioral Economics and Marketing: Structuring Choices and Accounting for Biases in Customer Behavior” (Journal of Integrated Marketing Communications, 2005 and 2011, respectively). He earned an MBA with high honors from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business, a Master of Science degree in Integrated Marketing Communications from Northwestern University, and a Bachelor of Science degree in Finance, summa cum laude, from Case Western Reserve University.

“I look forward to helping West Monroe build strength and credentials in customer experience by applying my data, analytics, and technology experience to maximize customer lifetime value for our clients and deliver a seamless, multi-channel experience for their customers,” said Nash. “I am impressed with the quality of West Monroe’s consultants and its successful track record in delivering measurable operational and financial results for its clients.”

About West Monroe

West Monroe is a North American, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 300 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada.

title: David Babicz Joins West Monroe's Technology Enablement Practice
name: David Babicz Joins West Monroe's Technology Enablement Practice

summary_info.summary_title: David Babicz Joins West Monroe's Technology Enablement Practice

global_field.meta_title: David Babicz Joins West Monroe's Technology Enablement Practice
global_field.meta_description: Agile Transformation Specialist Adds 20+ Years of Culture Change, Solution Development Experience

richtext.rich_text_editor:
August 29, 2012 (CHICAGO) – West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that David Babicz has joined the firm as a senior manager in the Technology Enablement Practice. An Agile transformation specialist and Certified Scrum Master, Babicz has more than 20 years of experience in project leadership across an array of industries.

Babicz works with teams and enterprises to make the transition to Agile culture and practices through a variety of offerings, including training, coaching, and assessments. His experience as a software development manager, Agile team leader, and database developer spans the areas of content and digital rights management, digital print publishing, financial services analysis and reporting, customer account management, investment research, and consumer and industrial mobile applications.

 “Agile approaches that enable iterative creation are vital to the types of transformational solutions we are developing for our clients in today’s complex and rapidly evolving environment,” said Greg Layok, who leads West Monroe’s Technology Integration solutions. “Dave Babicz’s experience and strong track record for transitioning teams and enterprises to Agile culture will be very valuable to our clients faced with responding fast and effectively to change.”

Babicz joined West Monroe from Solstice Consulting, where he was an Agile transformation practice leader and delivery manager. He created and grew the firm’s Agile transformation practice and led client transformation efforts ranging from enterprise-wide strategic and cultural efforts to single teams and targeted training offerings. Previously, he was a software development manager and team lead for Riverside Publishing Company for more than a decade and began his career as an operations manager for The Arts Matter Foundation in Chicago. Babicz earned a Bachelor of Arts degree in Communication from the University of Colorado. In addition to being a Certified Scrum Master, he holds several Microsoft certifications.

“West Monroe’s focus on helping clients navigate rapid change, combined with a focus on “people first”, offers an excellent fit with my background and interests,” said Babicz. “I am pleased to have this opportunity to join a talented and growing team.”

Babicz is active in the Chicago Agile community, serving as a board member of the Chicago Agile Professional Learning Network and a host for the Chicago Agile Methodology Group. He is a regular public speaker for a variety of associations and non-profit organizations.

Agile is a project management and development approach often used for software development. It emphasizes collaboration, transparency, and incremental, iterative steps that enable teams and customers to assess and refine a solution over the course of development. Scrum is an iterative and incremental Agile development method.

title: David Hurst joins West Monroeâ€™s Insurance practice
