global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Once Again Named a Finalist for Best Workplaces in Washington
global_field.meta_description: Puget Sound Business Journal Recognizes Fast-growing Consultancy among Top 80 Workplaces

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named one of Washington’s “2016 Best Workplaces” by Puget Sound Business Journal for the fourth time. 

The publication surveyed nearly 300 nominated businesses in the region, ultimately honoring 80 finalists—20 each in four size categories: 10-49 full time employees, 50 to 99 full time employees, 100-249 full time employees and more than 250 full time employees in Washington state.

West Monroe’s Seattle office has more than 70 employees and serves more than 40 clients across the Pacific Northwest in key industries, including banking, insurance, telecommunications, healthcare, and retail. To meet continued strong growth projections, the firm plans to hire up to five additional consultants by the end of 2016, and further diversification of its industry capabilities and credentials.

“We are honored to once again be included among the most respected companies in the region as one of Washington’s Best Workplaces” said Brian Paulen, senior director and head of the firm’s Seattle office. “As a consulting firm, our ‘product’ and our most valuable assets are our people. This award validates our position that investing in developing the next generation of leaders is critical to retaining our extraordinary people and helping them excel.”

Like all West Monroe Partners offices, the Seattle practice maintains a highly participatory and collaborative culture marked by an open work environment; frequent employee meetings and gatherings, including an annual strategic planning retreat; a strong commitment to serving the local community through its 1+1+1 social responsibility program; and regular recognition awards. The company has rigorously maintained this culture as it has grown to 11 offices across North America and a team of more than 850 consultants—in part by remaining 100-percent employee owned. Its innovative human resources practices enable people at all levels contribute to the company’s direction, and through its December 2012 conversion to an employee stock ownership plan (ESOP), to share in its results.

West Monroe Partners’ Seattle office was previously a finalist in the Puget Sound Business Journal’s ranking of “Best Workplaces” in Washington in 2012, 2014 and 2015. In addition, it has received workplace accolades from Seattle Business magazine. Nationally, the firm has been listed as a top company to work for by Consulting Magazine and Vault Inc., and has been named by Great Place to Work® Institute and FORTUNE as one of the best workplaces in the United States on its Best Small & Medium Workplaces list 2013-2016, as well as a top workplace for millennials in 2015 and a top workplace for giving back in 2016.

The publication celebrated all 2016 honorees at an event at Safeco Field on August 11.

title: West Monroe Named Chicago Tribune Top Workplace 2017
name: West Monroe Named Chicago Tribune Top Workplace 2017

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named Chicago Tribune Top Workplace 2017

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named Chicago Tribune Top Workplace 2017
global_field.meta_description: The Chicago-based consulting firm is one of only 10 companies to make list eight years in a row

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a progressive business and technology consulting firm, announced today that it has been named one of Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces 2017. The report ranked West Monroe 2nd among 45 mid-sized companies. West Monroe was one of 125 employers recognized in the annual workplace report, released Nov. 10, a combined effort between the Chicago Tribune and its partner, Energage, that identifies the Chicago area’s best places to work.

“We’re proud to make the Chicago Tribune’s Top Workplaces list for the eighth year in a row,” said Doug Armstrong, West Monroe’s Senior Managing Director and Chicago office lead. Winners were honored at an awards ceremony at Soldier Field’s United Club on Nov. 9, and The Chicago Tribune published the complete list of Top Workplaces on Nov. 10 in a special edition. A group of 20 West Monroe employees attended the event.

The theme of this year’s awards was “meaningfulness,” and how employees can find meaning in their daily work and careers. “At West Monroe, we not only strive to provide meaningful careers, as many companies do, but have policies and a culture in place to actually drive this. That's why it works for us,” Armstrong said.

Since opening its doors in 2002, West Monroe has grown to almost 1,000 employees nationally, with more than 650 employees based in the Chicago area. It serves more than 100 local clients in financial services, private equity, insurance, energy and utilities, healthcare, and life sciences. The Chicago office continues to grow rapidly, experiencing a 60 percent increase in revenue over the past two years. To meet continued growth projections, the firm plans on doubling its Chicago workforce over the next five years, with about 35 to 40 percent of those jobs in technology fields.

Part of the firm’s purpose is developing professionals that strike this uncommon blend into the next generation of leaders. Through mentorship and learning, West Monroe invests significantly in talent to develop the business skills of technologists, and the technology skills of business professionals.

The firm’s Chicago office is located in The Franklin, at 222 W. Adams St., where it plans an expansion in early 2018 to accommodate growth.

West Monroe is a progressive business and technology consulting firm that partners with dynamic organizations to reimagine, build, and operate their businesses at peak performance. This unique combination of expertise enables us to design, develop, implement, and run strategic business and technology solutions that yield a dramatic commercial impact on our clients’ profitability and performance. global_field.meta_description: West Monroe Partners was one of 35 Columbus-area employers recognized overall, and it ranked sixth among 10 companies named in the small business (25 to 99 local employees) category.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced that it has been named one of Columbus Business First’s 2011 Best Places to Work.

“West Monroe Partners is built on a foundation of people-centered core values,” said Sean Adkins, who has led West Monroe Partners’ Columbus office since its inception. “We believe that focusing on the type of environment and experiences we offer our people translates directly into the quality of service we deliver to our clients. That philosophy is responsible for the growth and reputation we have earned in Columbus.”

Established in 2005, West Monroe Partners’ Columbus office today comprises a team of 40 consultants who provide business and technology solutions for clients locally and across North America. The Columbus office also is the center of excellence for West Monroe Partners’ Workforce Optimization practice.

“Our Columbus team exemplifies West Monroe Partners’ focus on people, innovation, and distinctive service,” said Dean Fischer, the firm’s president and CEO. “Not only has this team become better known locally as it has grown; it has established a strong reputation across the continent—and that means exceptional opportunities and experience for our people in Columbus.”

The Best Places to Work program, launched in 2005, is open to any company or organization with a Central Ohio office with at least 10 full-time employees. Applications are handled through Omaha, Neb.-based Quantum, which administers a survey to employees with about 30 questions regarding their work environments.

Business First named Best Places to Work finalists in four categories: large companies with more than 500 local employees; medium companies with 100 to 499 local employees; small companies with between 25 and 99 workers; and micro companies with 10 to 24 employees.

Business First recognized the finalists during a November 9 luncheon and in a supplement published in its November 11 issue.

West Monroe Partners is an international, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 300 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada.

title: West Monroe Named one of Chicago Tribune Top Workplaces 2011
name: West Monroe Named one of Chicago Tribune Top Workplaces 2011

global_field.meta_description: West Monroe was one of 100 employers recognized in the November 15 special report to identify the areaâ€™s best places to work.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe, with 235 people in Chicago and more than 329 continent-wide, was one of 100 employers recognized in the November 15 special report, a collaborative effort between the Chicago Tribune and its partner, Workplace Dynamics LLC, to identify the area’s best places to work.

West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced that it has been named one of the Chicago Tribune’s Top Work Places 2011.

The report ranked West Monroe Partners among 101 small companies evaluated. Furthermore, it ranked West Monroe 9th among small firms in terms of quality of execution and 12th in terms of employee confidence in the firm’s direction. Workplace Dynamics determined overall and specific attribute rankings by surveying employees of nominated organizations.

“West Monroe Partners is honored to be recognized among Chicago’s top workplaces again this year,” said President and CEO Dean Fischer. “In our profession, the firm with the best people delivers the best service and wins in the marketplace over time. Since our inception, we have steadfastly maintained our focus on the environment and opportunities that we offer to our people. This recognition not only validates our strategy but indicates we are executing it well.”

Inclusion on the Tribune’s Top Work Places 2011 is the latest in a long list of employer accolades for West Monroe Partners, founded in Chicago in 2002 and now with offices in seven locations across North America. Over the past year, West Monroe Partners has received national recognition as an employer from Vault.com, as well as from leading business publications in three of its primary markets: Chicago, Seattle, and Columbus, Ohio.

To develop the Chicago Tribune’s ranking of Top Work Places 2011, Workplace Dynamics evaluated companies nominated by employees or customers, ultimately selecting 45 small, 35 medium and 20 large companies to be recognized as Top Work Places. The evaluation process a comprehensive employee survey of nominated companies, covering areas such as direction, execution, conditions, career, managers, and pay and benefits. Nominations, which were due by July 30, 2011, were open to all employers, including nonprofit organizations, with at least 100 workers in the greater Chicago area. More than 190 companies participated in the 2011 evaluation process.

About West Monroe Partners
West Monroe Partners is an international, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. title: West Monroe Named one of Chicago Tribune Top Workplaces 2012
name: West Monroe Named one of Chicago Tribune Top Workplaces 2012

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named one of Chicago Tribune Top Workplaces 2012

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named one of Chicago Tribune Top Workplaces 2012
global_field.meta_description: For the third consecutive year, the firm has been ranked as one of Chicago's best places to work

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced that it has been named one of the Chicago Tribune “Top Workplaces” in 2012. West Monroe was one of 100 employers recognized in the November 13th special report, a collaborative effort between the Chicago Tribune and its partner, Workplace Dynamics LLC, to identify the area’s best places to work.

The report ranked West Monroe Partners 11th among 40 small companies evaluated. The Top Workplaces are determined based solely on employee feedback. The survey is conducted by WorkplaceDynamics, a leading research firm on organizational health and employee engagement. Workplace Dynamics determined overall and specific attribute rankings by surveying employees of nominated organizations.

“This recognition is particularly gratifying in that it is based exclusively on the voices of our people,” said West Monroe Partners’ President Kevin McCarty, one of the firm’s founders and head of the Chicago office. “In 10 years, our firm has grown and evolved and is a much different enterprise today in terms of our scope and capabilities. But we have never allowed ourselves to grow in a way that compromised the key principle upon which we founded the firm—being a people-first organization.”

Inclusion on the Tribune’s Top Work Places 2012 is the latest in a long list of employer accolades for West Monroe Partners, founded in Chicago in 2002 and now with offices in eight locations across North America. Over the past year, West Monroe Partners has received national recognition as an employer from Vault.com and Consulting Magazine as well as from leading business publications in two of its primary markets: Chicago and Seattle.

The Chicago Tribune published the complete list of Top Workplaces on Tuesday, November 13th. For more information about the Top Workplaces lists and WorkplaceDynamics, please visit www.topworkplaces.com and www.workplacedynamics.com.

About West Monroe Partners

West Monroe Partners is a North American, business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 350 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada. For more information, visit our website at www.westmonroe.com.

title: West Monroe Named One of Chicago's "101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For"
name: West Monroe Named One of Chicago's "101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For"

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named One of Chicago's "101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For"

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named One of Chicago's "101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For"
global_field.meta_description: Firm Recognized for the 5th Time in 10 Years

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Chicago, Illinois- July 25, 2012 - West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named one of “Chicago’s 101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For™” by the National Association for Business Resources (NABR). This recognition marks the 5th time in the past 10 years that NABR has included West Monroe Partners on its annual list of Chicago-area employers that deliver exceptional human resources practices and an impressive commitment to their employees.

“We are extremely honored and proud to be included in this list of Chicago’s premier workplaces,” said Kevin McCarty, Co-Founder and Chicago Office Managing Director. “Although West Monroe Partners has grown by many times since our first appearance on this list in 2006, we still take our commitment to providing a people-first workplace extremely seriously. It is a commitment upon which we will not yield.”

The NABR selected 101 companies that best represent the most innovative human resource programs to date. An independent research firm evaluated each company’s entry based on key measures in various categories, including compensation, benefits, and employee solutions; employee enrichment, engagement, and retention; employee education and development; recruitment, selection, and orientation; employee achievement and recognition; communication and shared vision; diversity and inclusion; work-life balance; community initiatives; and strategic company performance.

The NABR previously recognized West Monroe Partners as one of Chicago’s 101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For™ in 2006, 2007, 2008, 2009 and 2012.

This year’s winning companies will be honored at a symposium and awards luncheon on Monday, August 20, 2012, at the Double Tree Hotel in Oak Brook. Additionally, winners will be featured in Crain’s Chicago Business on August 6 and in Corp Magazine’s e-publication.

101 Best and Brightest Companies to Work For™ is sponsored by ABC 7 Chicago, Assurance, CORP! magazine, FONA International, Harrah's Joliet, IIT's Center for Research and Service, The Management Association of Illinois, Verizon Wireless and VW Credit, Inc.

The Best and Brightest Companies to Work For™ is a program of the National Association for Business Resources and is presented annually in several markets including Detroit, Chicago, Atlanta, Houston, Grand Rapids and now Nationally.

About West Monroe Partners

West Monroe Partners is a North American, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 300 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada. For more information, visit our website at www.westmonroe.com.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named one of Consulting® magazine’s 2017 “Best Firms to Work For.” This is the sixth time Consulting® has recognized West Monroe Partners in its annual workplace ranking, a comprehensive look at the quality of life within the consulting profession’s top firms based on responses to an independent survey of nearly 9,000 consultants representing more than 300 firms. West Monroe Partners ranked third overall – matching its highest ranking ever.

West Monroe Partners also ranked among the top 10 firms in six out of six employee satisfaction categories: firm culture, work/life balance, compensation and benefits, client engagement, career development and leadership. West Monroe Partners, along with all recognized consultancies, is profiled in the “Best Firms to Work For” special section of the Consulting® September issue.

“It is always an honor to be recognized among the elite firms in our profession – and particularly to receive this recognition year after year. It means we are doing what we have always intended to do, and that is to distinguish our firm based on our culture, workplace, and career experience and to deliver on our promise to develop the next generation of leaders,” said Kevin McCarty, President and CEO of West Monroe Partners.
 
West Monroe Partners' people-focused culture and policies consistently rank the firm as one of the best places to work in the consulting industry and in major metropolitan areas such as Seattle, Los Angeles, New York, Chicago, and Minneapolis.  The firm plans to double its workforce over the next five years and is on target to have hired more than 300 professionals by the end of 2017.
 
“Recognition as a “best workplace” continues to position us well in the war for top talent. It attracts interest from top college recruits to seasoned consultants and executives with decades of experience. That talent is critical to our ability to grow as a firm. It is important to our clients who put their confidence in our people to deliver value and innovation, and it is important to our own people who have told us they value working with and learning from some of the best minds in the business.”

About West Monroe Partners 

West Monroe Partners is a progressive business and technology consulting firm that partners with dynamic organizations to reimagine, build, and operate their businesses at peak performance. Our team of more than 850 professionals is comprised of an uncommon blend of business consultants and deep technologists. This unique combination of expertise enables us to design, develop, implement, and run strategic business and technology solutions that yield a dramatic commercial impact on our clients' profitability and performance.

global_field.meta_description: Ranked 3rd Overall; Cited for Excellence in Work/Life Balance and Compensation & Benefits

richtext.rich_text_editor:
This is the sixth time Consulting has recognized West Monroe Partners in its annual workplace ranking.West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named one of Consulting® magazine’s 2015 “Best Firms to Work For.” This is the sixth time Consulting® has recognized West Monroe Partners in its annual workplace ranking, a comprehensive look at the quality of life within the consulting profession’s top firms based on responses to an independent survey of nearly 9,000 consultants representing more than 300 firms. West Monroe Partners ranked third overall, jumping four spots from seventh overall in 2014.

West Monroe Partners also ranked among the top 10 firms in six out of six employee satisfaction categories: firm culture, work/life balance, compensation and benefits, client engagement, career development and leadership. West Monroe Partners, along with all recognized consultancies, is profiled in the “Best Firms to Work For” special section of the Consulting® September issue.

“To receive recognition as a top workplace is always gratifying; it validates the diligence we put into building and nurturing our culture and 100-percent employee ownership model,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe Partners’ president and CEO. “When you have a true culture of empowerment, it translates to high engagement and stewardship. Everyone here feels it’s his or her job to nurture and preserve our culture—and that manifests itself in everything from our workplace to the quality of the work we deliver.”

West Monroe Partners’ innovative “people-first” culture and practices include a highly collaborative and participatory environment in which people at all levels contribute to the company’s direction and share in its results. Because of its size and predominantly middle-market client base, consultants have opportunities to assume significant client service and internal team responsibilities early in their careers. Reflective of its commitment to 100-percent employee ownership, the firm converted to an ESOP at the end of 2012. All employees participate in the plan, which rewards loyalty, professional growth, and company performance.

“We are particularly pleased to be recognized in the area of compensation and benefits for the first time,” said McCarty. “That reflects years of strategically building a very compelling total reward package that exemplifies our employee-owned culture. Market-competitive salary and benefits are of course a foundation. But when you add to those our profit-sharing bonus and ESOP contribution, both of which have been very healthy the past two years, it’s really not surprising to me that we are now receiving recognition in this area.”

West Monroe Partners has received numerous accolades for its workplace and human resource practices. In addition to recognition from Consulting® magazine, the firm has been recognized nationally by Great Place To Work® and Vault.com and regionally in several key markets, including Chicago, Seattle, Minneapolis, and Columbus, Ohio.

title: West Monroe named one of Food Logistics magazineâ€™s 2013 FL100
name: West Monroe named one of Food Logistics magazineâ€™s 2013 FL100

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe named one of Food Logistics magazineâ€™s 2013 FL100

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe named one of Food Logistics magazineâ€™s 2013 FL100
global_field.meta_description: Annual list ranks West Monroe and its FLEXdls labor management software among its top 100 providers to the food and beverage industry

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has made Food Logistics magazine’s FL100 list. For the past decade, the editors of Food Logistics have identified software and technology providers that help food and beverage manufacturers, food service distributors, and grocery retailers attain their business goals.

“Food and beverage distributors face enormous pressure to be efficient and keep costs down,” says Sean Adkins, managing director at West Monroe Partners. “We partner with these companies to implement engineered labor standards that are fair, accurate and consistent across all of their distribution centers while equipping them with our labor management software FLEXdls to ensure they are able to consistently improve efficiency by 25%.”

The FL100 is comprised of software providers as well as equipment and technology companies whose products and services play a significant role in food and beverage supply chains.

“The groundswell of interest in software and technology tools affirms the value associated with investing in solutions that boost visibility in the food and beverage supply chain, enhance collaboration, improve regulatory compliance and support sustainability goals,” remarks Lara L. Sowinski, Editor-in-Chief of Food Logistics. “New technology-related products and services combined with better affordability are leveling the playing field for a variety of food related companies, while supporting expansion of the cold chain into developed and emerging markets alike.”

The tenth annual FL100 list appears in the November/December 2013 issue of Food Logistics.

About Food Logistics

Food Logistics is published by Cygnus Business Media, a leading diversified business-to-business media company. The publication serves the information needs of executives involved in various aspects of the food and beverage supply chain. Through our print and online products, we provide news, trends, and best practices that help more than 24,000 grocery and foodservice suppliers, distributors, and retailers make better business decisions. 

About Cygnus Business Media

Cygnus Business Media is an internationally recognized business-to-business media company. Our diverse portfolio serves 15 market categories with print and interactive products, and live events. Through our media, we reach more than 1.7 million print subscribers, nearly 1 million industry professionals via our Custom Marketing services, and we attract almost 2 million unique visitors to our Web sites each month.

title: West Monroe Named One of the Country's Best Small and Medium Workplaces
name: West Monroe Named One of the Country's Best Small and Medium Workplaces

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named One of the Country's Best Small and Medium Workplaces

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named One of the Country's Best Small and Medium Workplaces
global_field.meta_description: Firm ranks 16 out of 100 in midsize category

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners has been named by Great Place to Work® as one of the best small and medium workplaces in the United States on their 2016 Best Small & Medium Workplaces list, published today in Fortune magazine. Ranked 16 out of 100 in the mid-size category, this is the fourth consecutive year West Monroe has received this honor. Divided into two categories, Small (25-100 employees) and Medium (101-999 employees), the list has recognized companies with exceptional workplace cultures for the past twelve years. 

West Monroe Partners won this accolade based on employees' anonymous responses to an extensive survey about their levels of trust, pride and camaraderie at work. Great Place to Work® reviewed the survey results of more than 52,000 employees from hundreds of companies in the ranking process. Among the findings from the study: trust fuels business performance. The Best Small and Medium Workplaces not only provide a better experience for their people, but also enjoy roughly three times the revenue growth of their peers.

“Winning this award is more than just adding another plaque on our awards wall or social media post – winning this award means we continue to foster an environment that is challenging to our people, putting them first as we build the next generation of leaders,” said Kevin McCarty, CEO and co-founder of West Monroe. “We are extremely proud of the culture we have built – and that we’ve been successful maintaining it as we grow.”

“There’s a generosity of spirit that infuses the Best Small and Medium workplaces—one that has a measurable return,” said Kim Peters, Executive Vice President of Great Place to Work. “Whether it’s funding employee ‘passion projects’ or giving surprise gifts to customers, the best workplaces give it away. And they get it back in the form of inspired people who innovate harder and generate higher revenue.”

Gary Beu, Managing Director of People and Leadership at West Monroe Partners, said, "There are countless workplace recognition awards but none we've received are more important to us than Fortune's given its rigor, prestige and the diversity of quality companies we are held in comparison to."

The Best Small and Medium Workplaces is one of a series of rankings by Great Place to Work and Fortune based upon employee survey feedback from Great Place to Work–Certified™ organizations. West Monroe Partners also ranked as a best workplace for Giving Back and Millennials by Great Place to Work and Fortune.

About The Best Small and Medium Workplaces

Published together with our partner, Fortune, the Best Small & Medium Workplaces rankings are based entirely upon feedback from more than 52,000 employees at Great Place to Work–Certified companies. Employees completed our anonymous Trust Index© survey, answering questions about how frequently they experience the behaviors that create a great workplace, including, for example, their assessment of the honesty and quality of communication by managers, degree of support for employees' personal and professional lives and the authenticity of relationships with colleagues.

Results from the survey are highly reliable, having a 95% confidence level and a margin of error of 5% or less. Winning a spot on this list indicates the company has distinguished itself from peers by creating a great place to work for all – not only do the majority of their employees experience the company as a great place to work, but this experience is consistent across the organization, regardless of gender, race/ethnicity, job role, or other personal characteristics. The companies with the highest employee ratings compared with organizations of the same complexity in size and scope were selected for the list. Companies with fewer than 100 employees compete for placement on the 50 Best Small Workplaces list, and companies between 100 and 999 employees compete for placement on the 100 Best Medium Workplaces list.

title: West Monroe Named One of the Country's Best Workplaces for Giving Back
name: West Monroe Named One of the Country's Best Workplaces for Giving Back

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named One of the Country's Best Workplaces for Giving Back

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named One of the Country's Best Workplaces for Giving Back
global_field.meta_description: West Monroe ranked 12th out of 50 firms on the list

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Our 1+1+1 Program empowers our employees to give back to our communities in a way that complements their personal and professional interests.

West Monroe Partners, a full-service business and technology consultancy, today announced that Great Place to Work® and Fortune have recognized them as one of the country's 50 Best Workplaces for Giving Back.

Great Place to Work® analyzed surveys from nearly 600 companies to rank those that best create a sense of purpose and meaning among their employees through involvement in the community. Not only do these workplaces stand out for their generosity, their team members also express a great deal of pride in what their organizations accomplish. West Monroe ranked 12th on the list.

“Before opening our doors 14 years ago, we first developed a list of core values to guide the type of people-first business we wanted to create. Due to our purpose-driven culture, Social Responsibility was added to our list of core values and continues to be one of our most highly demonstrable values. Each year, we strive to donate one percent of our time, one percent of our talent (pro-bono engagements), and one percent of our treasure (profits) to the communities in which we live and work,” said Kevin McCarty, CEO and co-founder of the firm. “Our 1+1+1 Program empowers our employees to give back to our communities in a way that complements their personal and professional interests.”

West Monroe manifests giving back to the community not only through the 1+1+1 Program, but also through The Fisher Global Service Fellowship, which allows employees 3-6 months of sponsored leave to work on a global service project of the employee’s choice. The Fisher Global Service Fellowship Program supports employees’ altruistic and humanitarian interests to make a meaningful contribution to a global cause. A number of directors hold positions on local non-profit boards as well.

 The Best Workplaces for Giving Back took into consideration feedback from about 240,000 employees in a diverse range of industries, as well as their companies' volunteer programs and charitable giving relative to revenue. Overall, West Monroe Partners as a firm donated nearly $700,000 to community organizations in 2015 via the 1+1+1 program and The Fischer Global Service Fellowship. The firm continues to exceed their annual 1+1+1 program goals.

"The Best Workplaces for Giving Back demonstrate more than just a commitment to charity,” said Kim Peters, executive vice president at Great Place to Work®. “These organizations have earned employees' admiration by involving staffers in their community service efforts and contributing resources in ways that genuinely reflect their unique cultures."

West Monroe Partners and the other winning companies were selected based on responses to the Trust Index©, Great Place to Work’s employee assessment survey. Employees rated their sense that they make a difference in their jobs, the meaningfulness of their work, and the impact they feel their organizations make in the community. The list also took into account company programs and an analysis of anonymous employee comments about their workplaces.

The Best Workplaces for Giving Back is one of a series of rankings by Great Place to Work® and Fortune based upon employee survey feedback from Great Place to Work®-certified organizations.

West Monroe Partners also ranked as a best workplace in 2013, 2014 and 2015 by Great Place to Work and Fortune.

About Great Place to Work®

Great Place to Work® is the global authority on high-trust, high-performance workplace cultures. Through proprietary assessment tools, advisory services, and certification programs, including Best Workplaces lists and workplace reviews, Great Place to Work® provides the benchmarks, framework, and expertise needed to create, sustain, and recognize outstanding workplace cultures. In the United States, Great Place to Work® produces the annual Fortune "100 Best Companies to Work For®" and a series of Great Place to Work® Best Workplaces lists, including lists for Millennials, Women, Diversity, Small and Medium Companies and over a half dozen different industries.

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named One of Washington Stateâ€™s 100 Best Companies to Work For
global_field.meta_description: West Monroe Partners was recognized by Seattle Business magazine for the seventh year in a row.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named one of Washington state’s 100 Best Companies to Work For by Seattle Business magazine.

West Monroe Partners has made the list every year since 2011, and is one of only a handful of companies who have been named to the list for seven consecutive years or more. The winners, hailing from cities all across the state of Washington, were chosen based on extensive confidential surveys completed by employees.

“Our mission is to develop the next generation of leaders, and we can’t do that without a people-first work environment that helps us attract and retain the best talent,” said Brian Paulen, senior director and head of the Seattle office. “Making the list of Washington’s 100 Best Companies to Work For seven years in a row is particularly meaningful, as it’s based on feedback from our employees and validates that we’re creating the culture we want.”

West Monroe’s Seattle office has more than 80 employees and serves more than 40 clients across the Pacific Northwest in key industries, including banking, insurance, healthcare, and retail. To meet continued strong growth projections, the firm plans significant local hiring, up to 25 consultants by the end of 2017 (including campus graduates).

The winners were honored at an awards dinner on June 22, 2017.

Nationally, the firm has been listed as a top company to work for by Consulting Magazine, Vault Inc., and Great Place to Work® Institute and FORTUNE as one of the best workplaces in the United States. West Monroe Partners was also named by Great Place to Work as a top workplace for millennials in 2015 and as one of the 50 best workplaces for giving back in 2016 and 2017.

title: West Monroe Named to Brill Street Top 50 Generation Y Employers 2011
name: West Monroe Named to Brill Street Top 50 Generation Y Employers 2011

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named to Brill Street Top 50 Generation Y Employers 2011

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named to Brill Street Top 50 Generation Y Employers 2011
global_field.meta_description: West Monroe Partners gained 10 spots to rank 19th in 2011, up from 29th in Brill Streetâ€™s inaugural 2009 list.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
As part of this award, Brill Street cited the nature of work and experiences our firms' Gen Y consultants are exposed to—including the ability to work with top-level talent, to learn new things every day, and to be innovative and flexible in addressing client needs—as a key area of strength.

West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced that it has been named one of the 50 most Generation Y friendly companies in the Chicagoland area in a biannual ranking published by Brill Street + Company. For the purposes of the study, Brill Street defined Generation Y as employees 28 years old and younger.

“Since our inception in 2003, we have worked hard to build and maintain a people-focused culture and an authentic, upbeat, and highly motivated work environment,” said Dean Fischer, West Monroe Partners’ president and CEO. “We know from our own internal feedback that this type of environment resonates well with Generation Y, and the Brill Street validates that in this study. We are pleased to be recognized as an organization committed to engaging Generation Y, the future of our workforce.”

West Monroe Partners, with a workforce of more than 300 across North America, has more than 100 Generation Y employees as defined in the study. Brill Street cited the nature of work and experiences to which West Monroe’s younger consultants are exposed—including the ability to work with top-level talent, to learn new things every day, and to be innovative and flexible in addressing client needs—as a key area of strength. It also recognized the opportunities for Generation Y employees to collaborate with others, at all levels of the organization, and to contribute their ideas openly both in both client work and in company operations.

For-profit companies, not-for-profit companies, and government employers with at least 10 percent of its workforce comprised of Generation Y employees were eligible to nominate their organizations through a detailed survey assessment of their workplaces. Finalists scoring highly in several areas—including social media position, overall environment, advancement potential, nature of day-to-day work, work/life balance, social responsibility, benefits, flexible working hours, employee voice in pitching new ideas, and training and development programs—were selected for on-site interviews to verify survey data and hear what employees believe make their workplace unique.

Using a proprietary mathematical model developed by GtK Custom Research North America, a world leading marketing research organization, companies were ranked on a 300-point scale The model was weighted by the key attributes that Gen Yers find important in the workplace.

Read more about the Brill Street + Company ranking.

About West Monroe Partners

West Monroe Partners is a North American, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 300 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada.

title: West Monroe Named to Crainâ€™s â€œChicagoâ€™s Largest Privately Held Companiesâ€ List
name: West Monroe Named to Crainâ€™s â€œChicagoâ€™s Largest Privately Held Companiesâ€ List

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named to Crainâ€™s â€œChicagoâ€™s Largest Privately Held Companiesâ€ List

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named to Crainâ€™s â€œChicagoâ€™s Largest Privately Held Companiesâ€ List
global_field.meta_description: Ranked 12th for Fastest Growing & 15th for Top Job Creators

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named to the Crain’s Chicago Business list of more than 300 largest privately held companies in Chicago. Surpassing more than $100M in revenue in 2014, West Monroe ranked  243rd on the list, up from 295th in 2014. West Monroe also ranked 12th overall among the  fastest-growing companies on the list, recording 2014 revenue growth of 33.9 percent. In addition, the firm ranked 15th among top “job  creators”—companies with the highest growth rate in local full-time employees—with a 34-percent increase in local full-time headcount in 2014.

“The right formula is critical to the level of growth and stature we have achieved. Our uncommon blend of business savvy consultants and deep technologists resonates well with companies navigating complex and changing markets,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe’s CEO, president, and co-founder. “More than that, our entrepreneurial spirit, underpinned by our commitment to remaining a 100-percent employee-owned organization, has created an extraordinary and unique ability to attract and retain talent in an environment that challenges each of us to be better every day.”

Founded in Chicago in 2002, West Monroe Partners has experienced sustained growth and expansion annually and now has eight offices across the United States. As of December 31, 2014, it employed more than 600 employees nationally, including 425 full-time employees in Chicago. The Chicago office hired 125 people during 2014 and expects similarly strong personnel growth in 2015 across all of its service areas.

The Chicago office, which relocated to 222 West Adams Street in 2012 and recently expanded its office adding 20% more space bringing the total to more than 50,000 square feet,, serves more than 600 clients in key industries, including banking, healthcare, private equity, life sciences, insurance, utilities, and retail.

West Monroe Partners restructured as an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) trust on December 31, 2012. All of the firm’s US employees participate as beneficial owners. Since its inception, West Monroe Partners has received national recognition as a leading employer from Vault.com, Consulting® magazine, and Great Place to Work®, as well as from major business publications in Chicago, Seattle, Minneapolis and Columbus.

Crain’s annually publishes a list of the top privately held companies in the Chicago area, based on revenue. The 2015 list was released on April 20.

title: West Monroe named to Crainâ€™s 2015 Best Places to Work in New York City

global_field.meta_description: West Monroe Partners ranked 13 on Crainâ€™s 2015 Best Places to Work in New York City

richtext.rich_text_editor:
New York, NY - September 18, 2015 - West Monroe Partners, a full-service business and technology consultancy, announced today that it has been named one of Crain’s Best Places to work in New York City, a list that honors the best employers in New York City, benefiting the city’s economy, workforce and businesses. 

"We are honored and proud to be included in this year’s list of New York City’s best places to work,” said Gil Mermelstein, Managing Director of the New York Office. “We have grown, this year alone, by over 120 percent, and this award reflects our continued commitment to providing a people-first workplace".

West Monroe Partners has established eight offices across the country; built a team of more than 650 people; and serves clients in a number of industries, including; private equity, banks & credit unions, insurance, energy & utilities, and healthcare. To meet continued strong growth plans, the New York office has continued to pursue local hiring, including campus graduates, and further diversification of its industry capabilities and credentials.

Crain’s New York Business selected 100 companies, from across all five boroughs, that best represent an exceptional commitment to workplace policies & practices, and nurtures a superior level of employee satisfaction and engagement. 

This year’s winning companies will be honored at a luncheon on December 4th. Additionally, winners will be featured online at crainsnewyork.com on Friday, December 4th and in Crain’s New York Business’ print edition on Monday, December 7th.

West Monroe Partners was most recently recognized, nationally, as a top company to work for by Consulting Magazine, the Great Place to Work® Institute and FORTUNE magazine, among others. The firm was also named one of the 2015 Crain’s Fast 50 for the sixth time in nine years based on a five-year growth rate of 274%. 

To see the full list, click here.

title: West Monroe named to Crainâ€™s 2015 Fast Fifty
name: West Monroe named to Crainâ€™s 2015 Fast Fifty

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe named to Crainâ€™s 2015 Fast Fifty

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe named to Crainâ€™s 2015 Fast Fifty
global_field.meta_description: West Monroe Partners has been named to Crainâ€™s Fast Fifty, a list of the 50 fastest-growing companies in Chicago published annually by Crainâ€™s Chicago Business.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service business and technology consultancy, announced today that it has been named to Crain’s Fast Fifty, a list of the 50 fastest-growing companies in Chicago published annually by Crain’s Chicago Business. With a five-year growth rate of 274 percent, West Monroe ranked 42 on the list of 50 companies. 

Founded in 2002, West Monroe Partners has grown revenue to more than $110 million by focusing on key industries and services. West Monroe partners with clients to reimagine, build, and operate their businesses, yielding a dramatic commercial impact on profitability and performance. Since opening its doors thirteen years ago, West Monroe has grown to more than 600 business consultants and deep technologists.

“It’s an honor to be named a Fast Fifty company for the sixth year,” said Kevin McCarty, CEO and President of West Monroe. “At our increased size, it is difficult to grow at the same pace purely through organic means. Our strategy to augment organic growth with selective acquisitions has paid off by scaling and extending our capabilities in key areas. We will look to do the same in the coming years.”

This is West Monroe Partners’ sixth time on the Crain’s Fast Fifty list over the past nine years. Additionally, it has been listed as a top company to work for nationally by Consulting Magazine and FORTUNE’s Great Place to Work; in Chicago the Chicago Tribune; in Seattle by Seattle Business Magazine and Puget Sound Business Journal; and in Columbus by Columbus Business First.

Crain’s annual roundup of the fastest-growing Chicago companies represents 50 companies that achieved impressive gains over a five-year period. Crain’s reporters and researchers studied each company and asked probing questions of CEOs to figure out how they grew, what did each company do to achieve impressive gains and how do they plan to sustain them. 125 applications were vetted to choose this year’s honorees.

To qualify for the Fast Fifty list, Crain’s evaluated companies with an inception date on or before December 31, 2007; with headquarters in the six-county area (Cook, DuPage, Kane, Lake, McHenry and Will) as of December 31, 2014; and with 2014 revenue of at least $15 million. The publication required financial statements or tax returns and enlisted an outside accounting firm to assist with verifying the financial information.

To read the full list click here.

West Monroe Partners, a full-service business and technology consultancy, announced today that it has been named one of Crain’s Best Places to Work in New York City. The list honors the best employers in New York City, who benefit the city’s economy, workforce and businesses.

“We are honored to receive this accolade a second year in a row, we take a lot of pride in our culture and are excited to be included in this year’s list of New York City’s best places to work,” said Gil Mermelstein, Managing Director of the New York Office. “We have more than doubled in size over the last year and we attribute this in part to our continued commitment to providing a people-first workplace and focus on high impact work for our clients.”

title: West Monroe Named to Crainâ€™s Chicago Business Top Privately Held Companies List

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named to Crainâ€™s Chicago Business Top Privately Held Companies List

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named to Crainâ€™s Chicago Business Top Privately Held Companies List
global_field.meta_description: West Monroe Partners ranked 295th on the list.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named to the Crain’s Chicago Business list of over 300 large privately held companies in the Chicago area for the first time in the Chicago-based firm’s history. West Monroe Partners ranked 295th on the list.

West Monroe Partners, founded in Chicago in 2002, has experienced sustained growth and expansion over the past 12 years. Now with 10 offices across North America and more than 500 employees, it achieved an increase of 25 percent revenue over 2012.

“We founded this firm with the intent to create a distinctive culture and a commitment to our people, including remaining 100-percent employee owned. It is particularly rewarding to see that commitment materialize and to be recognized now among the largest privately held firms in a metropolitan area with such a rich history for entrepreneurialism,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe Partners’ president and co-founder. “Even more gratifying is the impact that our growth and success has had on our people and the opportunities it is affording them to do groundbreaking, transformational work and develop rewarding careers.”

West Monroe Partners strengthened its concept of employee ownership by restructuring as an Employee Stock Ownership Plan (ESOP) trust on December 31, 2012, transferring 100-percent ownership to the ESOP trust. All of the firm’s more than 500 US employees participate as beneficial owners of the firm.

Since its inception, West Monroe Partners has received national recognition as a leading employer from Vault.com, Consulting Magazine, and Great Place to Work, as well as from major business publications in three of its primary markets: Chicago, Seattle, and Columbus.

Crain’s annually publishes a list of the top privately held companies in the Chicago area, based on revenue. The 2014 list was released on April 21, 2014.  For more information, visit: www.chicagobusiness.com. 

 

About West Monroe Partners

global_field.meta_description: With a five-year growth rate of 300 percent, West Monroe Partners ranked 25 on the list of 50 companies.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named to Crain’s Fast Fifty, a list of the 50 fastest-growing companies in Chicago published annually by Crain’s Chicago Business. 

Founded in 2002, West Monroe Partners has grown to a nearly $43 million consultancy by guiding clients through projects that fundamentally transform the way they do business. West Monroe Partners caters primarily to middle-market companies that often are underserved by larger consultancies but also works with many Fortune 500 clients. In nine years, it has established seven offices in the United States and Canada; built a team of more than 250 people, including 177 in Chicago; and served more than 300 clients.

“One of the biggest keys to West Monroe Partners’ consistent growth is our ability to remain relevant to our clients and focused on helping them adapt efficiently to a changing business reality—whether that means significant new regulatory, competitive, or market demands,” said Dean Fischer, the company’s president and CEO and one of its founders. “Doing so has enabled us to realize growth in all facets of our business; not just in certain sectors.”

This is West Monroe Partners’ third time on the Crain’s Fast Fifty list during its nine years in business. Crain’s previously recognized the firm as one of the region’s fastest growing enterprises in 2008 and 2009. West Monroe Partners also was named to the Inc. 5000 in 2008. It has been included in lists of the top companies for which to work nationally by Consulting Magazine and Vault Inc.; in Chicago by Crain’s, the Chicago Tribune and the National Association of Business Resources; and in Seattle by Seattle Business Monthly.

To identify its Fast Fifty list, Crain’s evaluated companies with an inception date on or before December 31, 2005; with headquarters in the six-county area (Cook, DuPage, Kane, Lake, McHenry and Will) as of December 31, 2010; and with 2010 revenue of at least $20 million. The publication required financial statements or tax returns and enlisted an outside accounting firm to assist with verifying the financial information.

West Monroe Partners is an international, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. Our more than 200 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada.

title: West Monroe Named to Forbesâ€™ List of Americaâ€™s Best Management Consulting Firms
name: West Monroe Named to Forbesâ€™ List of Americaâ€™s Best Management Consulting Firms

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named to Forbesâ€™ List of Americaâ€™s Best Management Consulting Firms

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named to Forbesâ€™ List of Americaâ€™s Best Management Consulting Firms

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named to Forbes’ list of America’s Best Management Consulting Firms. The list, a collaboration of Forbes and online statistics provider Statista published by Forbes on April 20, 2016, recognizes more than 250 management consultancies recommended by consulting executives and validated by clients as the best firms in 15 industries and 16 functional areas. West Monroe Partners appeared on the list of best firms in five functional areas: Digital Transformation, IT Implementation, IT Strategy, Mergers and Acquisitions, and Operations.

“We are proud to be recognized among the leaders in our profession, and especially in areas that are so critical to success today’s business environment such as mergers and acquisitions, IT strategy, and digital transformation,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe Partners’ CEO and co-founder. “It is particularly gratifying that our presence on among the profession’s best is based on input from our clients—evidence that we have been successful in fielding the right blend of business consulting savvy and deep technology expertise to help them navigate through complex challenges and transform successfully to compete in evolving markets. ”

Founded in 2002 in Chicago, West Monroe Partners has grown to 12 offices across the United States and more than 700 consultants. It has received numerous national and regional accolades for its workplace and human resource practices.

To produce a list of America’s Best Management Consulting Firms, Forbes and Statista compiled a list for consideration based on various sources and then conducted two online surveys. First, they asked more than 7,000 consulting firm partners and executives to recommend firms (excluding their own) across the 15 industries and 16 functional areas. From this survey, they created lists of consultancies for each industry and functional area and then asked more than 1,300 client senior executives to recommend consultancies on lists for industries and functional areas in which they had worked with a consultancy in the past four years. Firms received up to five stars based on the numbers of mentions from consultants and clients; those earning three, four, or five stars within a particular industry or functional area were included on the final list of best firms for that area. The study did not produce an overall ranking of firms across industries and functional areas.

title: West Monroe Named to National Best and Brightest in Wellness list for 2016.
name: West Monroe Named to National Best and Brightest in Wellness list for 2016.

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named to National Best and Brightest in Wellness list for 2016.

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named to National Best and Brightest in Wellness list for 2016.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named to The National Association for Business Resources’ Nation’s Best and Brightest in Wellness® list for 2016. The annual ranking honors companies and organizations that recognize and celebrate quality and excellence in employee and worksite health. West Monroe Partners appears on the list for the third consecutive year.

“It is very challenging to maintain a healthy diet and exercise with the consulting lifestyle, which includes non-standard hours and travel,” said Munzoor Shaikh, director in the firm’s Healthcare practice whose primary focus is on healthcare mergers and acquisitions, hospital systems, managed care, population health, and wellness. “From our early days, we have strived to find ways to help our people lead healthy, balanced lives. It is a privilege to represent our profession on this list of leaders in promoting wellness in the workplace, and we are particularly proud that it is the grassroots efforts of our people that have positioned our firm for such recognition.”

West Monroe Partners’ Wellness Committee, with 20 members across all firm offices, creates and oversees initiatives that help employees thrive in the intensive consulting lifestyle. For example, recent committee initiatives have included a virtual marathon (step competition), group yoga class followed by juice “happy hour” in the office, and a guest speaker to teach employees how to maximize return on investment in wellness efforts. The Wellness Committee is a product of West Monroe’s “Chiefs” program, which encourages employees to volunteer to create and run a committee around an area of interest.

“Each year we create a roadmap that aims to educate, engage, and empower our people in wellness-related activities,” said Tory Loebig, a Chicago-based consultant who chairs the Wellness Committee. “From initial small changes such asking employees to visibly schedule walking meetings on their calendars to competitive fitness challenges among hundreds of employees, we see interest in creating healthy workplaces and communities continuing to grow.”

Founded in 2002 in Chicago, West Monroe Partners has grown to 11 offices across the United States and more than 800 consultants. It has received numerous national and regional accolades for its workplace and human resource practices.

The Best and Brightest in Wellness®, a program of the National Association for Business Resources, is presented annually. The 2016 list of companies recognized as Best and Brightest in Wellness® includes 14 wellness providers and 62 employers. 

The 2016 winning companies were evaluated by an assessment, created and administered by SynBella, the nation’s leading wellness firm. The evaluation process statistically examined entries’ quantitative data on a criteria-based point system to benchmark and improve wellness program effectiveness. These criteria include outcomes, analysis and tracking, participation and incentives, benefits and programs, leadership, employee input, culture, and environment.

title: West Monroe Named to Vault 2013 Consulting 50 List
name: West Monroe Named to Vault 2013 Consulting 50 List

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named to Vault 2013 Consulting 50 List

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named to Vault 2013 Consulting 50 List
global_field.meta_description: This is the firmâ€™s third consecutive appearance on the list.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Chicago- August 30, 2012 - West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named to the Vault.com 2013 Consulting 50 list. This is the firm’s third consecutive appearance on the list. West Monroe Partners ranked 24th overall, and  earned top-10 rankings in eight specific “Quality of Life” criteria: green policies (3rd), hours (6th), firm culture (7th), philanthropy (7th), satisfaction (8th), innovation (9th), leadership (9th), and work-life balance (10th).

In its survey report, Vault.com points to West Monroe’s strength in work-life balance, noting, “While insiders report that long hours are often a fact of life—as they are elsewhere in the industry—the firm is notable for its attempts to mitigate this industry norm. The most obvious aspect: a generous vacation policy with days off that employees are actually able to use—a feat this not always equaled at rival firms.”

“Vault’s research confirms what we know from our own experience, which is that culture is becoming more and more important in the consulting profession,” said Dean Fischer, West Monroe Partners’ Chairman and CEO. “Since our founding, we have taken a strong stand with respect to shaping our culture. We work hard, as is typical in this profession, but by putting a ‘people-centric’ lens on everything we do, we believe we have created a very different and compelling consulting workplace.”

In its survey commentary, Vault.com also mentions West Monroe’s medium- and long-term growth potential and career development opportunities as strengths. In addition, the written profile highlights the firm’s “people-first” culture and commitment to community service.

Vault.com annually ranks consultancies using a combination of metrics. In 2013, Vault.com calculated its overall rankings using the following formula: prestige - 30 percent of the total score; satisfaction, firm culture, and compensation - each 15 percent; and work/life balance, overall business outlook, and promotion policies - each 10 percent of the total score.

title: West Monroe Named to Vault 2014 List of Top 50 Consulting Firms
name: West Monroe Named to Vault 2014 List of Top 50 Consulting Firms

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named to Vault 2014 List of Top 50 Consulting Firms

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named to Vault 2014 List of Top 50 Consulting Firms
global_field.meta_description: Rankings reflect our unwavering focus on our people and our strength of culture.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named to Vault’s list of 2014 Top 50 Consulting Firms. This is the firm’s fourth consecutive appearance on the list. 

West Monroe Partners ranked 37th overall among the 50 firms on the list, and placed among the top 25 consultancies in 14 individual “quality of life” categories and among the top 25 in three “diversity” categories. West Monroe earned top-10 rankings in green policies (3rd overall) and philanthropy (6th). 

“Again this year, the results of the Vault survey reflect our unwavering focus on our people and our strength of culture,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe Partners’ president and co-founder. “Vault research mirrors our own experience that consulting firm candidates consider culture as much as or more so than practice strength, prestige and other factors when selecting an employer. We are pleased to be represented among the best firms again this year, and are even more committed to building on these areas of strength.”

West Monroe Partners earned top-25 rankings in areas ranging from culture (14th) to satisfaction (20th) to formal and informal training (19th and 23rd) to relationships with supervisors (19th). 

Vault.com annually ranks consultancies using a combination of metrics – prestige, satisfaction, firm culture, compensation, work/life balance, overall business outlook and promotion policies.  The survey is open to consultants currently employed at reputable firms in the industry. When rating quality of life issues, consultants are only permitted to rate their own firm. For prestige and practice area rankings, consultants may only rate competitors and not their own firms.

title: West Monroe Names 8 Employees to 2019 Class of Fischer Global Service Fellows
name: West Monroe Names 8 Employees to 2019 Class of Fischer Global Service Fellows

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Names 8 Employees to 2019 Class of Fischer Global Service Fellows
summary_info.summary_description: Programâ€™s largest class to date includes first-ever director fellow and will support agricultural, cultural, literacy, health, and entrepreneurial programs.

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Names 8 Employees to 2019 Class of Fischer Global Service Fellows
global_field.meta_description: Programâ€™s largest class to date includes first-ever director fellow and will support agricultural, cultural, literacy, health, and entrepreneurial programs.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
CHICAGO – West Monroe Partners, a national business and technology consultancy, today announced its 2019 class of Fischer Global Service Fellows. Now in its sixth year, the Fischer Global Service Fellowship Program provides West Monroe employees with a three- to six-month leave to support a philanthropic and humanitarian issue of interest, anywhere in the world.

West Monroe launched the Global Service Fellowship Program in 2013. The firm renamed the program in 2015 to honor the firm’s co-founder and former CEO, Dean Fischer, who inspired the organization with his commitment to building healthy communities and preserving the natural environment. 

“We are excited to welcome our largest class of Fischer Fellows to date. Our eight new Fischer Fellows have exciting and rewarding journeys in progress or ahead, and we look forward to lending our encouragement and support from afar,” said Susan Stelter, West Monroe’s chief people officer. “This program has become an important thread in the fabric of our firm. Our people want to do work that matters, both personally and professionally, and it is extremely motivating to see the impact when they apply their energy and skills in this capacity.”

Following are the 2019 Fischer Fellows:

  • Olivia Grev, an experienced consultant in the Consumer & Industrial Products practice in Minneapolis, will work with an economic development organization to improve the agriculture value chain of smallholder farms in Africa through collaboration with food companies, non-profits, and governments. She will develop solutions that improve crop financing, farming techniques, and field technology.
  • Tom Hulsebosch, senior managing director and leader of the firm’s Energy & Utilities practice and Dallas office, will volunteer with Genesys Works in Chicago, which provides pathways to career success for high school students in underserved communities. An experienced leader, Tom will bring his skills and knowledge to help grow the Genesys Works internship program to meet the demand from Chicago Public Schools students; enhance the organization’s collaboration with the Chicago Apprentice Network; and introduce consulting as a career path for Genesys Works interns during their summer training. 
  • Nick and Sarah Kennedy, Operations Excellence senior manager and visual design manager, respectively, in Chicago, are volunteering with the Chol Chol Foundation (Temuco, Chile), which improves the lives of the indigenous Mapuche people through human development projects and commercialization of artisan products. While previous Fellows have volunteered with partners, this is the first time West Monroe has sent a team (in this case, a married couple) on the same Fellowship, increasing the impact they will create together. The Kennedys are increasing the foundation’s digital capabilities (website, artisan videos, product QR codes) and improving their internal processes (volunteer onboarding, store operations, and microcredit finance). Follow Nick and Sarah on their blog, 180DaysSouth.com.
  • Kaila McDonnell, a senior consultant in the Financial Services practice in New York City, will work with Whole World Women Association (Cape Town, South Africa). The organization began as a self-help and support group for refuge women and now offers services such as skills development, counseling, and health education. She will focus on two business ventures that create entrepreneurship opportunities for unemployed women. 
  • Stephanie Rex, a senior consultant in the Customer Experience practice in Seattle, has arrived in Melbourne and will be volunteering with Make-A-Wish Australia for the next five months. As one of Australia's most trusted and inspirational charities, Make-A-Wish partners with sick kids, their families and medical teams to grant wishes as unique as the children who imagine them. Stephanie will be helping the Wish Production team carefully design Wish Journeys to support children in their fight for their health.
  • Chaille Stewart, a manager in the Operations Excellence practice in Chicago, will work with the Center for Employment Opportunities (New York City), which helps formerly incarcerated individuals build career capital and financial stability. She will help upgrade organization’s Salesforce platform, assist with refreshing its data analytics strategy, support criminal justice policy reform, and mentor individuals through their career journey. 
  • Madeline Verbeten, a senior consultant in the mergers and acquisitions practice in Minneapolis, will work with Manna Project International (Chillos Valley, Ecuador), which provides services ranging from child daycare to adult literacy programs at its community center. She will focus on determining the role Manna can play in addressing the high unemployment that exists in the community. She will begin with an assessment to determine what support the community needs for assisting entrepreneurs and start-ups, training community members for available jobs, and offering job search and placement services.

The eight new Fischer Fellows join 20 other West Monroe professionals who previously completed fellowships, supporting causes that include literacy, clean water, gender equity, mental/behavioral health, economic empowerment, infrastructure development, human trafficking, the refuge crisis in Greece, and more. Fischer Fellows have served on almost all continents, as well as in the United States. 

Employees interested in pursuing a Fischer Fellowship must develop a comprehensive proposal, which includes vetting an organization to work with and creating a proof of concept detailing a budget and expected impact A West Monroe committee solicits and reviews the proposals annually and awards several applicants with fellowship opportunities. 

The Fischer Global Service Fellowship is one component of West Monroe’s social responsibility program, which is focused on boosting capacity for organizations working towards solving the most pressing social issues in the communities where we live and work. Most recently, the firm’s more than 1,100 employees volunteered for its “National Day of Service,” on June 14, dedicating time to 38 organizations in nine cities. 

The Fischer Global Service Fellowship Program received a Social & Community Investment Award from Consulting® magazine in 2016. West Monroe has also been named a top workplace for giving back and in 2018 was part of PEOPLE’s 50 Companies That Care. 

About West Monroe Partners
West Monroe is a national business and technology consulting firm that partners with dynamic organizations to reimagine, build, and operate their businesses at peak performance. Our team of more than 1,100 professionals is comprised of an uncommon blend of business consultants and deep technologists. This unique combination of expertise enables us to design, develop, implement, and run strategic business and technology solutions that yield a dramatic commercial impact on our clients’ profitability and performance. For more information, visit www.wmp.com.
