summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Names 2018 Class of Fischer Global Service Fellows, Celebrates 5th Year
summary_info.summary_description: Employees will spend up to six months supporting economic development in Swaziland, community infrastructure in Indonesia, and the refugee crisis in Greece.

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Names 2018 Class of Fischer Global Service Fellows, Celebrates 5th Year
global_field.meta_description: Employees will spend up to six months supporting economic development in Swaziland, community infrastructure in Indonesia, and the refugee crisis in Greece.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
CHICAGO – West Monroe Partners, a national business and technology consultancy, today announced its 2018 class of Fischer Global Service Fellows. Now in its fifth year, the Fischer Global Service Fellowship Program provides West Monroe employees a three- to six-month leave from their day job to support a philanthropic and humanitarian issue of interest, anywhere in the world.

West Monroe launched the Global Service Fellowship Program in 2013. The firm renamed the program in 2015 to honor the firm’s co-founder and first CEO, Dean Fischer, who inspired the organization with his commitment to building healthy communities and preserving the natural environment.

The 2018 Fischer Fellows include:

  • Valentina Nguyen, a senior consultant in the Technology practice in New York City, who will work with Campfire Innovation to support the refugee crisis in Greece. She will apply her background in analytics and solution implementation.
  • Jon Magin, a senior manager in the Mergers & Acquisitions practice in Seattle, who will deliver strategic planning and operational improvements for Tsandza Weaving in Swaziland, helping the organization develop a formal charity arm to extend its impact beyond social entrepreneurship and economic empowerment.
  • Patrick Miller, a manager in the Technology practice in Chicago, who will work in construction and renovation with International Volunteer HQ in Ubud, Indonesia, developing physical infrastructure that improves living conditions and access to opportunities.
  • Francesca Gabales, a senior consultant in the Customer Experience practice in Seattle, who will work as a community outreach volunteer with Campfire Innovation to support the refugee crisis in Greece. She will focus her efforts in camps and arrival points.

“We congratulate this new group of Fischer Fellows, who have exciting and rewarding journeys ahead. The passion our people demonstrate in their proposals and while on this fellowship is extremely inspiring to all of us,” said Chief People Officer Susan Stelter. “Not only do our employees return having made an impact on the organizations they served , but they return as better professionals, leaders, and consultants. A Fellow’s impact extends beyond their personal journey – everyone at West Monroe becomes part of the experience, whether through group fundraising or remote team and technology support.”

The four new Fischer Fellows join 16 other West Monroe professionals who previously completed fellowships, supporting causes that include literacy, clean water, gender equity, mental/behavioral health, economic empowerment, human trafficking, and more. Fischer Fellows have served on almost all continents, as well as in the United States.

Interested employees research opportunities to make an impact in an area of interest, identify and contact an organization with which they can work to do so, and then develop a proposal. A West Monroe committee solicits and reviews the proposals annually and awards several applicants with fellowship opportunities.

“The opportunity to truly blend your job, your professional skills, and your passion doesn’t come around very often,” said Dean Fischer, now chairman of West Monroe’s Board of Managers. “We are very proud of the program. It has had an impact on organizations and people well beyond what we originally envisioned.”

The Fischer Global Service Fellowship Program received a Social & Community Investment Award from Consulting® magazine in 2016. West Monroe has also been named a top workplace for giving back and was recently listed on PEOPLE’s 50 Companies That Care.

“Our people want to do work that matters—both from a professional and philanthropic standpoint. This program gives our employees the outlet to take an extended work leave without having to leave West Monroe entirely,” said Megan Lantz, senior manager and program coordinator. “Our Fellows frequently rely on other colleagues in the firm to lend their expertise from afar during the fellowship. This brings everyone along on the journey. The program has become an important thread in the fabric of our firm.”

title: West Monroe Names Adam Gersting as Dallas Office Leader
name: West Monroe Names Adam Gersting as Dallas Office Leader

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Names Adam Gersting as Dallas Office Leader
summary_info.summary_description: Fast-growing consultancy to triple its local workforce over five years; continues development of a national hub of technology expertise.

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Names Adam Gersting as Dallas Office Leader
global_field.meta_description: Fast-growing consultancy to triple its local workforce over five years; continues development of a national hub of technology expertise.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a national business and technology consultancy, today announced Adam Gersting as its new Dallas office leader and appointed him to the firm’s Executive Team, effective January 1, 2020. Gersting, a senior director who joined West Monroe in 2018, has played a key role in expanding the office’s capabilities, client base and community involvement, while also overseeing the Technology practice there. He assumes office leadership responsibility from Tom Hulsebosch, who will now head the firm’s Chicago office

In 2018, West Monroe announced plans to triple its workforce in Dallas over the next five years. In addition to investing to build local leadership and capabilities to serve business demand across the region, the firm also is developing a hub of technical competency in Dallas that serves clients both locally and nationally.

“Adam Gersting is not only an accomplished business and technology consultant, but also an exemplary leader. We are fortunate to have someone of his caliber guiding our expansion in Dallas,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe’s president and CEO. “Adam has a keen focus on creating high-value solutions and understands how to do so by fostering collaboration that brings out the best of our collective experience and knowledge. He will drive strategic growth by building a culture of innovation in our Dallas office.”

West Monroe, which has nine offices across the United States, entered the Dallas market in 2015 and has since grown to a team of more than 75 people employing the firm’s uncommon blend of business consulting acumen and deep technology expertise to create value for clients across industries.

“It is exciting to be part of such a dynamic business marketplace and to have this chance to contribute to its prosperity and help local organizations create value,” Gersting said. “Our rapid expansion enables us to fulfill our mission of developing the next generation of leaders within our firm, our clients, and in the community. The attention to a people-first culture is real – it comes to life here more than at any other organization with which I’ve been associated.”

Prior to joining West Monroe, Gersting was a managing director with Slalom Consulting, leading growth and service delivery in Houston. Earlier in his career, he was a partner with Accenture leading Information Management & Analytics for the resources industries and a partner with IBM Global Business Services leading business analytics and optimization in the utilities and telecommunications industries. Gersting was recently honored by D.CEO Magazine as one of the Dallas 500, which celebrates the most influential business leaders in North Texas who impact the Dallas-Fort Worth economy.

In January, West Monroe relocated to new space at One Arts Plaza to accommodate its expansion plans. Known for its distinctive people-first culture, the firm has received numerous workplace awards nationally and in key markets. The Dallas office earned its first such recognition in 2019, appearing on the Dallas Business Journal’s latest list of Best Places to Work in North Texas.

title: West Monroe Names Barbara Bennett to Board of Directors
name: West Monroe Names Barbara Bennett to Board of Directors

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Names Barbara Bennett to Board of Directors
summary_info.summary_description: Seattle-based executive and former CFO for the EPA brings extensive leadership and transformation experience as fast-growing consultancy prepares for next stage of expansion.

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Names Barbara Bennett to Board of Directors
global_field.meta_description: Seattle-based executive and former CFO for the EPA brings extensive leadership and transformation experience as fast-growing consultancy prepares for next stage of expansion.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
CHICAGO – West Monroe Partners, a national business and technology consulting firm, announced today the appointment of Barbara Bennett to its Board of Directors. Bennett will provide guidance to the firm, which increased revenue by 34% in 2017 and expects another year of strong, double-digit growth in 2018. In just 16 years, West Monroe has grown from a startup to a firm of more than 1,000 employees with 10 offices across the United States.West Monroe’s Board of Directors provides oversight for the privately held, 100% employee-owned company. The appointment brings the number of board members to 11. Bennett becomes the third external member, as well as the third woman, on West Monroe’s board.

“As we grow and scale our business, it is increasingly important for us to have outside and diverse voices at the table when we shape strategy and make investment decisions,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe’s president and CEO. “As a former chief operating officer and chief financial officer, Barbara Bennett brings extensive strategic, financial, and operational acumen, along with an outstanding track record for disrupting markets and guiding companies from early stage investments to large public entities.”

Bennett has more than three decades of experience leading complex, high-growth, multinational organizations, with an industry background that spans, media, environment, and diverse portfolio management. Most recently, she was president and chief operating officer for Vulcan, Inc., the engine behind philanthropist and Microsoft co-founder Paul G. Allen’s network of organizations and initiatives. It holds assets as diverse as investment management, consumer experiences, technology development, and professional sports. Previously, she was executive vice president and chief financial officer of Digital First Media and chief financial officer of the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency, a role for which she was unanimously confirmed by the U.S. Senate. Bennett also spent 17 years in senior executive and leadership roles with Discovery Communications, helping build the organization into one of the world’s most extensive media enterprises.

Bennett’s experience includes working with corporate boards, committees, and external stakeholders, with a background that includes both the public and private sectors. She is currently a member of the Board of Directors of Cascade Public Media. She previously served on the boards of the Allen Institute and the Medstar National Rehabilitation Hospital.

“It is an honor to be named to West Monroe’s board  and to assume this significant responsibility to the firm’s employee owners, its clients and the communities in which it operates. West Monroe has, in a short period of time, earned a very distinctive stature and reputation in the consulting marketplace, and I am motivated by the opportunity to help guide the next stage of development,” Bennett said. “I am particularly impressed with the culture West Monroe has established, including its strong focus on people, innovation, and social responsibility. One of my priorities as a board member is to help the firm preserve and nurture this asset as it makes strategic decisions and grows to the next level.”

Bennett is based in the Seattle area, home to West Monroe’s second-largest office.

“Through her recent work overseeing businesses and investments in the Puget Sound area, Barbara Bennett has established a strong local presence and perspective,” said Tom Bolger, West Monroe’s senior managing director of strategic growth and founder of the firm’s Seattle office. “Her expansive knowledge of the local business community will be particularly valuable as we extend our unique value proposition of blending business consulting and deep technology expertise to new clients across the Pacific Northwest.”

Bennett will begin her appointment on September 14.

title: West Monroe Names Laurie Lovett to Board of Directors
name: West Monroe Names Laurie Lovett to Board of Directors

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Names Laurie Lovett to Board of Directors

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Names Laurie Lovett to Board of Directors

richtext.rich_text_editor:
The renowned HR executive from Nielsen and Accenture brings talent and culture expertise to board oversight as the firm executes its growth strategy and international expansion.

December 14, 2022—CHICAGO

West Monroe, one of the fastest-growing digital services firms, today announced the appointment of Laurie Lovett to its Board of Directors.

With more than two decades of organizational transformation experience in HR at major global corporations, Lovett will provide guidance to West Monroe as the award-winning firm pursues its strategy to become a major player in digital services across the globe. West Monroe has announced key steps in its expansion, including a $250 million investment toward building a global product development platform and a long-term expansion in Europe. 

In conjunction with MSD Private Capital’s 2021 investment in a 50% ownership stake of West Monroe, the firm restructured its governance to include representation from MSD and West Monroe. Lovett becomes the first external member of the current board. 

Lovett was most recently the global chief people officer of Nielsen, where she spent three years successfully navigating the company through complex global challenges including the Covid-19 pandemic, the Great Resignation, and the war in Ukraine. In her career spanning nearly three decades, she has successfully orchestrated cultural shifts, led companies through reorganizations, designed award-winning employee experiences, and evolved organizations to meet new and important challenges like diversity, equity, and inclusion.  

“We are very fortunate to have an executive of Laurie Lovett’s caliber serving as our advisor. Her well-earned reputation for guiding successful professional services organizations through change and her understanding of what it takes to be an employer of choice among top global talent will be invaluable,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe’s chairman and CEO. “Laurie possesses the perfect blend of experience—talent and workforce expertise, tenure as a senior executive in a global professional services organization, and a track record for guiding acquisitions, which will continue to play a key role in our growth strategy.”

Her significant transaction experience includes the sale of Nielsen’s Global Connect in 2021 and the company’s transition from public to private equity ownership. Over the course of her career, she has led the people components for nearly 50 acquisitions. 

Prior to joining Nielsen in January 2020, Lovett was global chief human resources officer for Verisk Analytics and North American HR Lead at Accenture, where she spent 20 years of her career. 

“It is a privilege to work with West Monroe and to assume this significant responsibility to the firm’s employees, investors, clients, and communities. Having spent my career cultivating strong cultures, I am particularly impressed with the distinctive reputation and position that the company has achieved in just two decades,” said Lovett.

West Monroe has a unique opportunity to establish itself as a leader in the emerging digital services arena. Talent will be central to that effort, and I look forward to contributing my professional experience and insight as the firm grows and expands into new markets.

In addition to working closely with Nielsen’s board, Lovett has served on the boards of several other organizations. She is currently executive director for governance at the Nielsen Foundation and board director at Girl Stats, Verisk Analytics’ foundation. She is also an international advisory council member for Ankh Impact Ventures. 

Lovett’s board appointment began in November.

About West Monroe
West Monroe is a digital services firm that was born in technology but built for business—partnering with companies in transformative industries to deliver quantifiable financial value. We believe that digital is a mindset—not a project, a team, or a destination—and it’s something companies become, not something they do. That’s why we work in diverse, multidisciplinary teams that blend management consulting, digital design, and product engineering to move companies from traditional ways of working to digital operating models—and create experiences that transcend the digital and physical worlds. Connected by the 13 founding values that drive our culture, our 2,200 employees work collaboratively across the firm with the belief that our clients’ success is our success. Visit WestMonroe.com to learn more.

title: West Monroe Names Tom Bolger Managing Director, Strategic Growth & Seattle Office Lead
name: West Monroe Names Tom Bolger Managing Director, Strategic Growth & Seattle Office Lead

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Names Tom Bolger Managing Director, Strategic Growth & Seattle Office Lead

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Names Tom Bolger Managing Director, Strategic Growth & Seattle Office Lead
global_field.meta_description: Bolgerâ€™s New Role Oversees Acquisitions, Office Expansion and Other Growth Initiatives

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Chicago, IL – September 5, 2012 – West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consultancy, announced today that it has appointed Tom Bolger to the new role of Managing Director, Strategic Growth & Seattle office lead. As part of his strategic growth role, Tom will work with the firm’s senior leadership team to develop and advance strategic growth initiatives, including, but not limited to plans for geographic expansion and assessing potential mergers and acquisitions.

Bolger founded the firm’s Seattle office in 2005 and has overseen its growth to more than 40 employees and 20 active clients across the Pacific Northwest. Since its inception, the Seattle office has received accolades from the Puget Sound Business Journal, Seattle Business Monthly, and Seattle Business Magazine as one of the area’s best workplaces. In addition to his new responsibilities, Bolger will continue to lead the Seattle and other West Coast practices.

“Given our significant development as a firm over the last 10 years and our future growth plans, we recognized the importance of formalizing responsibilities for strategic growth,” said West Monroe Partners’ Chairman & CEO, Dean Fischer. “In addition to founding and leading an office, Tom has played a key role in our annual strategic planning process and, over time, distinguished himself as one of our firm’s most strategic thinkers. We—and our clients—will benefit tremendously from his focus on this area.”

In addition to his practice leadership responsibilities, Bolger has directed many transformation projects for West Monroe clients, including mergers and acquisitions, digital channel expansion, enhanced payment processes, and the alignment of technology with strategic objectives. His consulting experience spans multiple industries, including banking, insurance, capital markets, and professional services.

Before joining West Monroe Partners in 2005, Bolger held several key positions with Washington Mutual including business unit manager for the company’s debit card business, at the time, the third-largest debit card issuer in the United States, and vice president for online banking. Previously, he spent several years as a consultant with Saltmine, a Seattle-based internet consulting firm, and with Arthur Andersen in Chicago. He earned Bachelor of Arts degrees in Computer Applications and Psychology from the University of Notre Dame.

title: West Monroe Offers Enhanced Smart Energy Services Offering
name: West Monroe Offers Enhanced Smart Energy Services Offering

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Offers Enhanced Smart Energy Services Offering

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Offers Enhanced Smart Energy Services Offering
global_field.meta_description: Our experts help facilitate the creation of effective new energy programs and strategies for businesses, utilities, and communities.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners’ Smart Energy Platform identifies new financial value streams through innovative energy and pollution management programs.

West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, announces an enhanced smart energy services offering designed to facilitate creation of effective new energy programs and strategies for businesses, utilities, and communities, alike. “Smart energy” is an emerging high priority for a variety of organizations seeking to address escalating energy and pollution costs and regulatory demands by equipping users to understand and proactively manage energy consumption.

"As the cost of and demand for electricity and fossil fuels continues to climb, so has interest in innovative solutions that allow organizations to better understand how they can optimize their energy use and distributed generation options,” said Tom Hulsebosch, managing director of West Monroe Partners’ Energy & Utilities practice. “We have found that many organizations are struggling to bring smart energy strategies to life because they are not holistically analyzing the key technical, business, and societal factors that impact their energy vision and business case. Our Smart Energy Platform is designed to integrate energy efficiency and distributed generation options through design, conservation, demand management, and finally distributed generation, including renewables.”

West Monroe Partners’ smart energy services offering supports community developers and planners looking to attract environmentally-conscious residents and companies, businesses that have significant financial risk and opportunity related to energy use and pollution, and utilities and municipalities that want to develop optimal energy policies that generate support of key stakeholders and bolster job and economic growth. Learn more about West Monroe’s smart energy service offering.

“West Monroe Partners translated our smart energy community design concepts into a roadmap for our 1500 acre master planned community, Badger Mountain South. Their Smart Energy Platform enabled us to create an integrated set of developer, municipal and customer choices that, when implemented, will allow us to build an innovative community infrastructure to promote energy efficiency and regulatory compliance, reduce pollution, and save money for our residents and stakeholders,” said Loren Combs, Project Manager, VSI Development, LLC.

The City of Chicago is also benefiting from West Monroe’s smart energy capabilities. West Monroe Partners is part of a City-led consortium that received a $750,000 grant from the US Department of Energy (DOE) as part of an effort to transform the Chicago region into one of the nation’s leading solar markets. Over the next year, the West Monroe team will be working across multiple City of Chicago departments to streamline the zoning, permitting, and inspection processes for distributed solar photovoltaic systems. As part of this project, the team will be working with Chicago’s electric distribution utility, Commonwealth Edison (ComEd), to improve the interconnection process and provide policy framework recommendations.

Smart energy services represent the latest offering introduced by West Monroe Partners’ Energy & Utilities and Sustainability Practices, which have become trusted advisors to large energy users and utility industry clients in the area of smart grid transformational programs and sustainable energy strategies. These service offerings simultaneously address the economic, environmental, and energy objectives of utilities and large energy users alike.

For more information, please contact Tom Hulsebosch, managing director of West Monroe’s Energy & Utilities practice.

About West Monroe Partners
West Monroe Partners is a North American, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 300 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada.

title: West Monroe Opens Los Angeles Office
name: West Monroe Opens Los Angeles Office

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Opens Los Angeles Office

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Opens Los Angeles Office
global_field.meta_description: LA is firmâ€™s tenth office in North America and its first in the state of California

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has opened an office in Los Angeles, California, staffed with experienced West Monroe leaders and consultants. The Los Angeles office, the firm’s tenth in North America and its first in the state of California, will largely serve financial services and energy and utilities clients.

“As we considered growth opportunities across North America, we felt that Southern California fit well with our areas of strength in business transformation and was a natural choice for extending our reach on the West Coast,” said Tom Bolger, West Monroe Partners’ managing director of strategic growth. “The region is a financial services hub for the western United States, as well a center for smart-grid innovation. It also offers us a strong recruiting base.”

Ken Siegman, a director responsible for West Monroe Partners’ Banking team on the West Coast, is the office leader. He has more than 30 years of financial services and consulting experience. He will now lead and grow a full-service Southern California team. In addition to growing the firm’s local banking and energy and utilities practices, Siegman and team will expand West Monroe Partners’ private equity, customer experience and technology capabilities within the region to better serve its clients on the west coast.

“Over the past few years, we have done a substantial amount of work for clients in Southern California without a physical presence here. Now, we can continue to build our relationships with local talent,” said Siegman. “Like other large metropolitan markets, this area is a composite of distinctive smaller communities. Each of us here is a part of one of those communities, and we are excited about the opportunities to make an impact and to establish West Monroe Partners as a true piece of the fabric of Southern California.”

title: West Monroe Opens Office in Minnesota
name: West Monroe Opens Office in Minnesota

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Opens Office in Minnesota

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Opens Office in Minnesota

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has opened a new office in Minnesota. The office is West Monroe’s sixth office in the United States. The firm also has two offices in Canada. Tom Ewers, a director who has been with West Monroe Partners for 10 years, will lead the office.

Initially, the office will focus on merger and acquisition-related services for key local industries—particularly private equity, healthcare, and manufacturing and distribution—throughout Minnesota and the upper Midwest. In addition, it will coordinate a full range of business and technology services for national and international clients with operations in that region.

“Throughout our 10 years in business, we have been very deliberate in establishing and developing offices in markets that demonstrate steady growth potential, and that thoughtful approach has enabled us to be successful in expanding our coverage across North America. Our research and local networking has confirmed that this is a good time for us to devote dedicated resources in Minnesota,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe’s president and one of the consultancy’s founding members. “Tom Ewers’ track record for client service and practice development, along with his deep experience in the challenges and opportunities associated with mergers and acquisitions, make him an ideal candidate to develop this new office.”

Prior to opening the Minnesota office, Ewers worked in West Monroe Partners’ Seattle office from 2007 to 2012, with responsibility for expanding the Mergers & Acquisitions practice to the West Coast. He joined West Monroe Partners in 2002 in Chicago after holding positions with BearingPoint and Arthur Andersen.

“Local companies in the financial services, healthcare payer, high tech and food sectors, among others, are performing well and fueling local growth,” said Ewers. “These areas of focus fit well with our established industry strengths as a consultancy, as well as with our capability to provide both strategic and technology solutions.”

The new office is located at 7760 France Avenue South, 11th Floor, Minneapolis, MN  55435. The local telephone number is 612-594-8000.

West Monroe Partners also has offices in Chicago, Illinois; Seattle, Washington; New York City, New York; Columbus, Ohio; Dallas, Texas; Montreal, Quebec; and Toronto, Ontario. The firm serves its clients’ international interests through a global alliance with BearingPoint in Europe.

About West Monroe Partners

West Monroe Partners is a North American, business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 350 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada. For more information, visit our website at www.westmonroe.com.

title: West Monroe Opens Offices in Houston (TX) and Pittsburgh (PA)
name: West Monroe Opens Offices in Houston (TX) and Pittsburgh (PA)

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Opens Offices in Houston (TX) and Pittsburgh (PA)

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Opens Offices in Houston (TX) and Pittsburgh (PA)
global_field.meta_description: Business and Technology Consultancy Expands to 12 Locations Nationally; Establishes Key Resources Closer to Growing Client Base

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced it has opened new offices in Houston, Texas, and Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, bringing its in-market locations across the United States to 12. 

Founded in 2002, West Monroe Partners today has a team of more than 750 business consultants and deep technologists across the United States. The firm collaborates with clients to reimagine, build, and operate their businesses through technology, yielding a dramatic commercial impact on profitability and performance. Its uncommon blend of business savvy and deep technology expertise has produced distinctive capabilities for enabling growth and transformation through improvements to the customer experience, efficiencies across operations, informed mergers and acquisitions, and insights driven from advanced analytics. 

“Establishing teams in Houston and Pittsburgh is a key step in our ongoing nationwide growth strategy, allowing us to broaden our reach into top business markets, position on-the-ground resources closer to our clients, and provide exciting new opportunities for top talent,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe Partners’ president and chief executive officer. “We are pleased to bring world-class business and technology capabilities to both markets and even more pleased to provide some of our emerging leaders with terrific entrepreneurial opportunities to lead and grow new offices.”

“Opening the Houston office allows us to begin building a presence in the fourth-largest US market and to extend some key relationships we already have with clients that operate in this area,” said Tom Hulsebosch, managing director and leader of West Monroe Partners’ Energy & Utilities practice. “While our initial focus will be on bringing to bear rich experience in mergers and acquisitions and in complex operational and technological transformation within the energy and utilities sector, Houston-area clients will have access to all of West Monroe’s broad industry and functional skills as needs require.”

“Pittsburgh is also a market that provides a strong fit with our intent to grow West Monroe’s nationally recognized Workforce Optimization capabilities, as well as our presence in the eastern part of the country,” added Jeff Arnold, Director of Workforce Optimization. “One of our key areas of focus in this market will be working with companies looking to optimize labor spend, build high-performing workforces and to accomplish the same or more with fewer resources.”

West Monroe Partners has enjoyed solid and sustained growth in both size and national scope over the past 14 years. Crain’s Chicago Business has recognized the firm among its Crain’s Fast Fifty, the 50 fastest-growing companies headquartered in the six-county Chicago metropolitan area, for the past six years. Additionally, West Monroe’s “people-first” culture and workplace practices have earned accolades nationally from Consulting® magazine and Great Place To Work as well as regionally in several key markets, including Chicago, Seattle, Minneapolis and New York.

title: West Monroe Partners Announced as Finalist for the 12th Annual M&A Advisor Awards
name: West Monroe Partners Announced as Finalist for the 12th Annual M&A Advisor Awards

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Announced as Finalist for the 12th Annual M&A Advisor Awards

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Announced as Finalist for the 12th Annual M&A Advisor Awards
global_field.meta_description: Firm recognized in M&A Product/Service of the Year category for its Carve-out Services

richtext.rich_text_editor:
The M&A Advisor promotes mentorship and professional development amongst emerging business leaders

West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced it is a finalist in The M&A Advisor 12th Annual M&A Advisor Awards in the M&A Product/Service of the Year category for its Carve-out Services. West Monroe Partners has been selected from the nominees in the first stage of evaluation and the independent panel of judges will now focus their attention on selecting the ultimate award winners.

“Since the inception of the M&A Advisor Awards in 2002, we have been recognizing the leading dealmakers, firms and transactions. And each year we celebrate the creativity, perseverance and ingenuity of our industry’s professionals,” says David Fergusson, President of The M&A Advisor. “While our industry has undergone significant transformation since our first awards were presented 11 years ago, we are convinced, more than ever before, that investment in middle market companies will continue to be the driving force of the economy. It is truly an honor for our firm to be able to recognize the contribution that the 2013 award finalists have made.”

“Carve-outs can produce positive returns for both parties if managed and executed correctly from strategy through execution, but pose many challenges. That’s where we come in,” said John Stiffler, Director in West Monroe Partners’ Private Equity practice. “Reducing risk, time and cost for a successful carve-out is our number one goal. Our team uses vast carve-out experience to provide strategy planning from pre-divesture to post-TSA, and then execute on that future vision.”

“West Monroe Partners, representing the best of the industry, has demonstrated creativity and perseverance in today’s challenging climate,” says Roger Aguinaldo, CEO and Founder of The M&A Advisor.   

The winners for M&A Deal of the Year, Restructuring Deal of the Year, Cross-Border Deal of the Year, Corporate/Strategic Acquisition of the Year, Deal Financing of the Year, Sector Deal of the Year, Firms of the Year, M&A Product/Service of the Year and M&A Professionals categories will be announced at the 12th Annual M&A Advisor Awards Gala on Tuesday, December 17 at the New York Athletic Club.

For a detailed list of all of the Award Finalists for the 12th Annual M&A Advisor Awards, please CLICK HERE.

THE M&A ADVISOR
The M&A Advisor was founded in 1998 to offer insights and intelligence on M&A activities. Over the past fifteen years, through our research, reporting, publishing, symposiums and awards we have established the world’s premier network of mergers and acquisitions, restructuring and financing professionals. To learn more visit www.maadvisor.com

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Quickly growing Managed Services practice is expecting to hire up to 20 technical candidates at May event

West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American consultancy and managed services provider, will hold an open house in its Chicago office on May 15, 2014, to recruit technology candidates for its Managed Services practice. The firm expects to recruit up to 20 technical candidates through the event.

West Monroe Partners’ Managed Services practice, which provides IT, business process, and other outsourcing services, has grown rapidly over the past two years and has nearly doubled in size in each of those years. The firm is recruiting for various positions, including Windows and system engineers, NOC analysts and service desk analysts.

“Over the last few years, we’ve seen a significant uptick in the number of firms seeking to outsource their day-to-day IT maintenance and operations to fill key skill gaps and scale their capabilities to meet growing demands,” said Andy Smith, who leads West Monroe Partners’ Managed Services practice. “Engaging with a service provider like us allows clients to balance tactical activities and daily support with vital strategic initiatives. Managed Services is a critical component of our firm’s overall growth strategy and a point of differentiation in terms of what we bring to the table.”

The Managed Services recruiting event will take place at West Monroe Partners’ Chicago office at 222 W. Adams Street, 11th Floor, on May 15 from 3-8 pm. To register, please provide your contact information and resume to recruiting@westmonroe.com.

title: West Monroe Partners Completes Customer Engagement Initiative for Woodland Park Zoo
name: West Monroe Partners Completes Customer Engagement Initiative for Woodland Park Zoo

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Completes Customer Engagement Initiative for Woodland Park Zoo

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Completes Customer Engagement Initiative for Woodland Park Zoo
global_field.meta_description: As part of our firm's commitment to social responsibility, we partner with local non-profit organizations and help achieve their strategic business goals.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Through our work with the Woodland Park Zoo, West Monroe Partners has helped the zoo develop a strategy for increasing its connections with and engaging the 18-25 year-old market—a segment that is vital to the zoo because of its high level of interest and participation in conservation activities.

West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced that it has completed a pro-bono project for the award-winning Woodland Park Zoo in Seattle.

“Woodland Park Zoo’s desire to strengthen its interaction with the 18-25 market presented a unique opportunity to contribute our expertise in customer engagement and strategy in a way that also supports our corporate citizenship goals,” said Kyle Hutchins, West Monroe Partners’ director of the Customer Experience practice. “As an organization, we share Woodland Park Zoo’s commitment to sustainability and the environment and are pleased to be able to contribute time toward helping the zoo advance its accomplishments in this area.”

West Monroe Partners’ work included conducting cross-departmental workshops that applied principles of effective customer engagement—enabling zoo personnel to discuss and understand the 18-25 audience and define what it means to engage and interact effectively with this demographic. During these sessions, the zoo identified and planned multiple opportunities to “intercept” the Generation Y audience, as well as activities for connecting with this group in more focused conservation-related events and activities. West Monroe Partners also enhanced elements of Woodland Park Zoo’s technology platform to facilitate the zoo’s use of the Internet, social media, and other channels critical to reaching the 18-25 market.

“West Monroe Partners not only helped Woodland Park Zoo develop a strategy that complements our mission as an organization; it guided us through a very valuable collaborative process to develop that strategy which involved the participation and support of all key departments,” said Jamie Creola, the zoo’s vice president of education. “We now have the capabilities in place to pursue our goals for the 18-25 market through a variety of channels and activities.”

About West Monroe Partners. West Monroe Partners is a North American, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 300 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada.

Woodland Park Zoo. Accredited by the Association of Zoos & Aquariums, award-winning Woodland Park Zoo is helping to save animals and their habitats in Washington state and in 50 countries around the world. By inspiring people to care and act, Woodland Park Zoo is making a difference in our planet’s future. For more information, visit www.zoo.org.

title: West Monroe Partners helps Define My Style Launch DMS 2 Go
name: West Monroe Partners helps Define My Style Launch DMS 2 Go

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners helps Define My Style Launch DMS 2 Go

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners helps Define My Style Launch DMS 2 Go
global_field.meta_description: As a nimble startup, Define My Style collaborated with West Monroe Partners, a Chicago based full service management consulting firm, to design, develop and launch this new app in just four weeks.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
As a nimble startup, Define My Style collaborated with West Monroe Partners, a Chicago based full service management consulting firm, to design, develop and launch this new app in just four weeks.

Define My Style, a leading online, style-centric community for girls 13-19, today announced the availability of "DMS 2 Go" an iPhone app and the newest tool in the DMS Studio™. 

Teen DMS community members use online tools to create thousands of unique handbag designs, personal logos and virtual stores. With more than a hundred designs created each day, a dynamic and rich stream of activity can flood by members between logins. This new iPhone app, DMS 2 Go, allows members to browse and comment on the latest community activity; feeding both the friend and fashion fetishes of DMS designers. Teen influencers are juggling school, clubs, family, social interests, sports and much more. The challenge for this first release was to inject a creative escape; something fresh and fun that fits into a 3 minute break during their incredibly demanding schedules.

"We are thrilled to launch our first mobile app and the collaboration on this project was incredibly satisfying," says Kristine Sturgeon, Founder & CEO of Define My Style. "Everyone has an opinion about mobile, but we wanted to prioritize feedback from our DMS members. These girls spend thousands of hours on mobile devices; they are the experts and we wanted to hear their opinions. We are proud that the DMS community helped define the requirements. We were able to bring these inputs to West Monroe Partners, complete rapid brainstorming and mockups then quickly transition to working prototypes and launch within a few weeks. Our target audience is creative and connected, if we want to catch their attention, we can't miss mobile.

"This project had a tight timeline while being the first piece of a bigger vision for the DMS Member engagement model," states Gregory Layok, Director of West Monroe Partners' Technology Integration Practice. "We've sketched out a number of additional ideas to carry the strategy forward, but identified the most tangible pieces to deliver value to the market quickly. This is an approach to project management we are working with clients on across multiple industries as a response to the increasing need to improve the customer experience. Many organizations we are working with are focused on more intimate relationships with their customers. The mobile experience must feel simple and consistent with other communication channels, regardless of the complexity of security and integration requirements behind the scenes. We look forward to furthering an ongoing relationship with Define My Style as their business continues to grow."

About Define My Style
Define My Style is an online, style-centric community that empowers creative and curious teen girls, ages 13 to 19. Define My Style provides web based tools and connections to engage and spark young designers and entrepreneurs. Our virtual community, the DMS Studio™, provides a unique, social and dynamic environment to help teens explore design, understand the value of other perspectives and develop confidence in genuine personal expression. The DMS Marketplace™ empowers enterprising teens to open a virtual store to promote, sell and have their personal brand of handbags manufactured. For more information, please visit www.DefineMyStyle.com.

Their consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada. The Technology Integration Practice works with companies to design, build, and deploy all aspects of mobile applications, including strategy, functionality, user-friendly interfaces, and security.

title: West Monroe Partners Introduces Distributed Generation Services
name: West Monroe Partners Introduces Distributed Generation Services

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Introduces Distributed Generation Services

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Introduces Distributed Generation Services
global_field.meta_description: The firmâ€™s Distributed Generation services include capabilities for helping utilities understand real-time impact of DG loads on grid operations.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Capabilities Streamline and Improve Complex Enrollment, Approval, and Reporting Processes

West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has added Distributed Generation services to the suite of solutions currently provided by its Energy & Utility practice. These services support utilities and cities embracing a growing number of small-scale, distributed generation (DG) technologies that produce power at the point of consumption, with capabilities that extend from customer enrollment to municipal integration.

To assist utilities with administrative processes for completing interconnection and net metering approvals within state-mandated time requirements, West Monroe Partners evaluates current enrollment processes and develops improvement recommendations. It also examines utility data management for DG enrollments to ensure proper records management and reporting. The firm’s Distributed Generation services also include capabilities for helping utilities understand real-time impact of DG loads on grid operations.

West Monroe Partners also works with many large municipalities to assess, design, and implement process and technology improvements to expedite permitting and zoning approvals.

“Distributed generation promises attractive benefits, but its rapid acceleration in adoption—the result of technology cost reductions, state and federal subsidy programs, and enhanced state grid access rules—are straining utilities’ resources and operations,” said Tom Hulsebosch, managing director of West Monroe Partners’ Energy & Utilities practice. “Our experience with distributed generation to date has enabled us to help utilities and municipalities streamline complex enrollment, approval, and reporting processes.”

To complement its Distributed Generation services, West Monroe Partners also is introducing ConnecttheGridTM, a cloud-based platform that enables utilities to enroll, track, report on, and forecast their service territory’s distributed generation resources more effectively.

For more information reach out to Tom Hulsebosch, managing director of management and technology consulting firm West Monroe Partners’ energy & utilities practice.

title: West Monroe Partners is a Finalist for the Association of Management Consulting Firms 2012 Awards
name: West Monroe Partners is a Finalist for the Association of Management Consulting Firms 2012 Awards

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners is a Finalist for the Association of Management Consulting Firms 2012 Awards

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners is a Finalist for the Association of Management Consulting Firms 2012 Awards
global_field.meta_description: AMCF is an organization dedicated to promoting the practice and integrity of the management consulting profession.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
The AMCF awards, as described by organization representatives, are presented to consulting teams that have been a “tremendous force in helping clients find solutions to critical challenges, moving them forward with sustainable solutions for their businesses.”

West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, was recently named as a finalist by the Association of Management Consulting Firms (AMCF) for their 2012 Awards, honoring excellence in consulting.

This year, West Monroe’s Healthcare Payer Practice has been nominated in the Technology Transformation category for their work at DentaQuest, LLC. DentaQuest, a client of the firm for over four years, administers dental benefit programs for more than 15 million members in 24 states plus the District of Columbia, making it one of the largest dental benefits companies in the United States. West Monroe led DentaQuest through this large, complex transformation initiative, including the design, development, validation, and then implementation of a new claims administrative platform. This platform serves as a comprehensive end to end solution for DentaQuest, including provider management, claim intake and processing, reporting, analytics, web portal, provider and member outreach, and seamless integration with financial applications. By completing this program DentaQuest now enjoys a single administrative platform, improved operational portability and efficiencies, increased member and provider self-service capabilities, and is positioned for future growth and acquisitions.

According to Will Hinde, head of West Monroe’s Payer Practice, “the work we’ve done at DentaQuest has not only been transformational for their organization, but for our firm as well. In addition to the deep technical and industry expertise required for a project of this magnitude, we’ve learned that true transformation comes from the ability to partner with our clients, crafting solutions that align with their business strategies and objectives, and building a relationship that can stand the test of time. We hope that our relationship with DentaQuest continues far into the future.”

The winners of the 2012 AMCF Awards will be honored at gala in New York City on March 2, 2012. To learn more about this organization and the awards process, please visit their website at www.amcf.org.

About West Monroe Partners’ Payer Practice
West Monroe Partners’ dedicated Payer practice has the necessary insight and deep industry knowledge to advance payer organization objectives. Our hands-on experience combined with an inherent disposition for driving change will help payer organizations prepare for and implement systemic, process, and organizational changes to increase staff productivity and reduce IT spend, consolidate claims platforms to simplify operations and allow flexibility for growth, improve fidelity of benefits information across the enterprise to eliminate manual touches of data and increase claim payment precision, and drive growth by improving overall customer experience and satisfaction.

title: West Monroe Named a Best Place to Work by Seattle Business Magazine
name: West Monroe Named a Best Place to Work by Seattle Business Magazine

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named a Best Place to Work by Seattle Business Magazine

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Named a Best Place to Work by Seattle Business Magazine
global_field.meta_description: Seattle Business Magazine recognized West Monroe for our core company values, most importantly our "people first" philosophy.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe was the only company recognized for the second consecutive year by Seattle Business Magazine as one of the city's "Best Company's to Work for - Headquartered Outside of Washington."

West Monroe Partners, a full-service business and technology consultancy, today announced their Seattle office has been named “Best Company Headquartered Outside of Washington” by Seattle Business Magazine for the second year in a row. Seattle Business Magazine recognizes companies throughout Washington State for outstanding employee culture, values, and benefits.

“We are thrilled to be named one of the Best Companies to Work For in Washington once again,” said Tom Bolger, managing director and founder of the Seattle office. “We continue to focus on our core company values, most importantly our ‘people first’ philosophy, because we know our people are paramount to what we do.”

Founded in 2002, West Monroe Partners has grown to a nearly $60 million consultancy by guiding clients through projects that transform the way they do business. The Seattle office was founded in 2005. Key industries served by the Seattle office include banking, energy & utilities, healthcare, insurance and private equity.

“West Monroe, and specifically our Seattle office, has been growing rapidly over the last year and expanding our presence in new industry verticals,” said Jerin May, director of technology services. “But, we remain committed to striving for quality first, growth second, taking great care to hire people who bring the right mix of attitude and ability and who share our values.”

In addition to this most recent award, West Monroe has been included in lists of the best workplaces nationally by Consulting Magazine and Vault Inc.

To be considered for the Best Workplaces list, applicants must submit a formal nomination, participate in an employee satisfaction survey conducted by an independent third-party, and then be selected by a panel of judges from previously recognized workplaces throughout the state.

About West Monroe Partners
West Monroe Partners is a North American, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. Seattle Business magazine is owned by Minneapolis-based Tiger Oak Publications, which also publishes Seattle magazine, Seattle Bride magazine as well as more than 20 other leading regional magazines. title: West Monroe Named a Finalist for Washington's Best Workplaces
name: West Monroe Named a Finalist for Washington's Best Workplaces

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named a Finalist for Washington's Best Workplaces

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named a Finalist for Washington's Best Workplaces
global_field.meta_description: Puget Sound Business Journal Recognizes Fast-growing Consultancy among Top 80 Workplaces

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners’ Seattle office was previously a finalist in the Puget Sound Business Journal’s ranking of “Best Workplaces” in Washington in 2012 and 2014. West Monroe Partners has been named one of Washington’s “2015 Best Workplaces” by Puget Sound Business Journal.

West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named one of Washington’s “2015 Best Workplaces” by Puget Sound Business Journal. The publication surveyed nearly 250 nominated businesses in the region, ultimately honoring 80 finalists—20 each in four size categories: 10-49 full time employees, 50 to 99 full time employees, 100-249 full time employees and more than 250 full time employees in Washington state.

Celebrating its 10th anniversary this year, West Monroe’s Seattle office today has nearly 70 employees and serves more than 40 clients across the Pacific Northwest in key industries, including banking, private equity, insurance, utilities, and retail. The Seattle office, like the rest of West Monroe Partners, has experienced rapid growth, including a 175-percent increase in revenue over the past two years. To meet continued strong growth projections, the firm plans significant local hiring, up to 20 additional consultants by the end of 2015 (including campus graduates), and further diversification of its industry capabilities and credentials.

“We are thrilled to mark our 10th year in Seattle with this recognition, and are honored to be included as one of Washington’s best workplaces among the most respected companies in the region,” said Brian Paulen, director of the Seattle office. “As a consulting firm, our ‘product’ and our most valuable assets are our people. We strongly believe that investing in opportunities for growth, leadership experience, and career development is critical to retaining our extraordinary people and helping them excel.”

Like all West Monroe Partners offices, the Seattle practice maintains a highly participatory and collaborative culture marked by an open work environment; frequent employee meetings and gatherings, including an annual strategic planning retreat; a strong commitment to serving the local community through its 1+1+1 social responsibility program; and regular recognition awards. The company has rigorously maintained this culture as it has grown to nine offices across North America and a team of more than 500 consultants—in part by remaining 100-percent employee owned. Its innovative human resources practices enable people at all levels contribute to the company’s direction, and through its December 2012 conversion to an employee stock ownership plan (ESOP), to share in its results.

West Monroe Partners’ Seattle office was previously a finalist in the Puget Sound Business Journal’s ranking of “Best Workplaces” in Washington in 2012 and 2014. In addition, it has received workplace accolades from Seattle Business magazine. Nationally, the firm has been listed as a top company to work for by Consulting Magazine and Vault Inc., and was named by Great Place to Work® Institute and FORTUNE as one of the best workplaces in the United States on its 2013 and 2014 Best Small & Medium Workplaces list, as well as a top workplace for millennials in 2015.

The Puget Sound Business Journal asked readers to nominate their own or other companies between January and April. Nearly 250 companies were nominated for awards. To be eligible for recognition, companies must have 10 or more full-time employees at an office in Washington. Eligible companies participated by asking their full-time Washington-based employees to complete a survey.

The publication honored 80 top-scoring companies based on survey results covering the areas of employee engagement, management, communication, benefits, and others. The highest scoring companies in each size category were named finalists, and the publication then honored the companies with the top three scores in each category as Gold, Silver and Bronze medalists. The publication celebrated all 2015 honorees at an event at Safeco Field on August 13.

title: West Monroe Partners Named Brill Street + Companyâ€™s 2012 Top 50 Employers for Gen Y Emerging Talent in Chicago
name: West Monroe Partners Named Brill Street + Companyâ€™s 2012 Top 50 Employers for Gen Y Emerging Talent in Chicago

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Named Brill Street + Companyâ€™s 2012 Top 50 Employers for Gen Y Emerging Talent in Chicago

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Named Brill Street + Companyâ€™s 2012 Top 50 Employers for Gen Y Emerging Talent in Chicago
global_field.meta_description: "The cool thing about this company is the level of openness and transparency."

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Brill Street cited West Monroe Partners for attracting Gen Y with an energizing mix of approach, ability, enthusiasm and a go-getter attitude.

West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm of over 350 professionals, today announced that it has been listed number 7 on the 2012 Top 50 Employers for Gen Y Emerging Talent in Chicago in a ranking published by Brill Street + Company. The list contains companies from all industries and of all sizes that has a presence in Chicago. Since 2009, Brill Street has been ranking the top employers for Gen Y Emerging Talent in Chicago, recognizing companies where young professionals thrive. Brill Street + Company defines Gen Y as employees between 18 and 29 years.

Brill Street cited West Monroe Partners for attracting Gen Y with an energizing mix of approach, ability, enthusiasm and a go-getter attitude. “We are thrilled to be recognized as an organization committed to engaging Generation Y,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe Partners’ president and co-founder. “Maintaining and building a collaborative, flexible, transparent and upbeat environment is paramount to fostering the people-focused culture of our firm.”

Tory Paez, Consultant in the Customer Experience practice was attracted to West Monroe Partners’ genuine qualities. “After graduating college, I thought you have your personal life and then your professional life. Here at West Monroe Partners, they really pride themselves on being authentic.”

Chicago employers qualified for the award by employing at least 10 employees, with at least 10 percent of their workforce comprised of Gen Y. Companies were evaluated on professional development opportunities, benefits, environment, company reputation and culture, perks offered and the enthusiasm of company leadership and Gen Y employees. "Gen Y is uniquely positioned to step in, step up and offer new capabilities for employers. With the Top 50, we recognize those companies that offer a place for Gen Y to thrive," says Kevin C. Carlson, Brill Street + Company CEO.

To read about the companies on the Top 50 Employers for Gen Y Emerging Talent in Chicago, please visit www.brillstreet.com/GenYTop50.

About Brill Street  + Company
At Brill Street + Company, we see talent differently. Founded in and focused on Chicago, Brill Street + Company connects emerging professionals with companies, helping Gen Y find meaningful work. Brill Street + Company provides clients with advisory services, sourcing resources and contingent labor options, all with the Gen Y perspective in mind. For more information about Brill Street + Company, please visit www.brillstreet.com. Follow Brill Street on Twitter @brill_street.

 

About Brill Street’s Top 50 Employers for Gen Y Emerging Talent in Chicago
At Brill Street + Company, we see talent differently. Founded in and focused on Chicago, Brill Street + Company connects emerging professionals with companies, helping Gen Y find meaningful work. Since 2009, Brill Street has been ranking the top employers in Chicago for Gen Y emerging talent. Companies are evaluated on professional development opportunities, benefits, environment, company reputation and culture, perks offered and the enthusiasm of company leadership and Gen Y employees. For more information about Brill Street + Company, and Brill Street’s Top 50 Employers for Gen Y Emerging Talent in Chicago, please visit www.brillstreet.com. Follow Brill Street on Twitter @brill_street.

title: West Monroe Partners Named on Great Place to WorkÂ® 2015 Best Small & Medium Workplaces List
name: West Monroe Partners Named on Great Place to WorkÂ® 2015 Best Small & Medium Workplaces List

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Named on Great Place to WorkÂ® 2015 Best Small & Medium Workplaces List

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Named on Great Place to WorkÂ® 2015 Best Small & Medium Workplaces List
global_field.meta_description: Employee trust in the workplace is the leading factor for great workplaces

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Ranked 17 in the mid-size category, this is the third consecutive year West Monroe has received this honor.

West Monroe Partners has been named by Great Place to Work® as one of the best small and medium workplaces in the United States on their annual 2015 Best Small & Medium Workplaces list, published today in Fortune magazine. Ranked 17 in the mid-size category, this is the third consecutive year West Monroe has received this honor. Divided into two categories, Small (25-250 employees) and Medium (251-999 employees), the list has recognized companies with exceptional workplace cultures for the past eleven years.

Competing against hundreds of companies across the country, West Monroe participated in a rigorous selection process, which included an employee survey and an in-depth questionnaire about benefits programs and company practices. Great Place to Work® evaluates each application using its unique methodology based on five dimensions of a great workplace: credibility, respect, fairness, pride and camaraderie.                                                                                                                                                      

In compiling the list, Great Place to Work® has found that employees believe they work for great organizations when they consistently trust the people they work for, have pride in what they do and enjoy the people they work with.

“It’s a tremendous honor to be named to such a renowned list for the third year in a row. As a growing firm, maintaining a people first culture is our number one priority – which can be a challenge at times,” said Kevin McCarty, CEO and President. “I want to thank our employees for accepting the challenge to join and maintain a dare to be great community. Our people are the fabric that tie this community of One West Monroe together and allow us to be a ‘best company’ work culture.”

Organizations named on the list see many benefits that include better financial performance, less employee turnover, higher levels of customer satisfaction and loyalty, more innovative and creative thinking, higher productivity and enhanced public perception.

To see the 2015 Best Small & Medium Workplaces list and to learn more about how to build a high-trust workplace culture, visit www.greatplacetowork.com or to learn more about West Monroe Partners visit www.westmonroe.com.

 

About Great Place to Work
Great Place to Work® is the global authority on high-trust, high-performance workplace cultures. Through proprietary assessment tools, advisory services, and employer branding programs, including Best Companies lists and workplace reviews, Great Place to Work® provides the benchmarks, framework, and expertise needed to create, sustain, and recognize outstanding workplace cultures. In the United States, Great Place to Work® produces the annual Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For® list and the Great Place to Work® Best Small & Medium Workplaces list.

title: West Monroe Partners Named One of 100 Best Companies to Work For in Washington State Sixth Year In A Row
name: West Monroe Partners Named One of 100 Best Companies to Work For in Washington State Sixth Year In A Row

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Named One of 100 Best Companies to Work For in Washington State Sixth Year In A Row

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Named One of 100 Best Companies to Work For in Washington State Sixth Year In A Row

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners recognized by Seattle Business magazine as one of Washington state’s 100 Best Companies to Work For.

West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named one of Washington state’s 100 Best Companies to Work For by Seattle Business magazine. 

West Monroe Partners has made the list every year since 2011, and is one of only a handful of companies who have been named to the list for seven consecutive years or more. The winners, hailing from cities all across the state of Washington, were chosen based on extensive confidential surveys completed by employees.  

“It’s an honor to be one of only a few companies who have been one of the 100 Best Companies six years in a row,” said senior director Brian Paulen, who leads West Monroe’s Seattle office. “It validates our sustained commitment to a people-first culture, which we are dedicated to maintaining even as we experience significant growth.”

West Monroe’s Seattle office has more than 70 employees and serves more than 40 clients across the Pacific Northwest in key industries, including banking, insurance, telecommunications, healthcare, and retail. To meet continued strong growth projections, the firm plans significant local hiring, up to 10 additional consultants by the end of 2016 (including campus graduates), and further diversification of its industry capabilities and credentials.

The winners were honored at an awards dinner on June 23, 2016.


Nationally, the firm has been listed as a top company to work for by Consulting Magazine, Vault Inc., and Great Place to Work® Institute and FORTUNE as one of the best workplaces in the United States. West Monroe Partners was also named by Great Place to Work as a top workplace for millennials in 2015 and as one of the 50 best workplaces for giving back in 2016.

title: West Monroe Named One of Consulting Magazineâ€™s 2012 â€œBest Firms to Work For.â€
name: West Monroe Named One of Consulting Magazineâ€™s 2012 â€œBest Firms to Work For.â€

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Named One of Consulting Magazineâ€™s 2012 â€œBest Firms to Work For.â€

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Named One of Consulting Magazineâ€™s 2012 â€œBest Firms to Work For.â€
global_field.meta_description: Annual ranking cites strengths in culture and career development.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Firm ranked 15th overall, as well as tenth in the category of firm culture and fifth among multi-service firms.

Chicago, IL – August 22, 2012 – West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consultancy, announced that it has been named one of Consulting Magazine’s 2012 “Best Firms to Work For.” This is the third year Consulting Magazine has recognized West Monroe Partners in its annual workplace ranking, and the first time outside of the ‘small firm’ category.  The Consulting Magazine ranking is developed through a comprehensive look at the quality of life within the consulting profession’s top firms based on responses to an independent survey of nearly 13,000 consultants representing more than 400 firms. West Monroe Partners ranked 15th overall, as well as tenth in the category of Firm Culture and fifth among multi-service firms.

In ranking West Monroe Partners among its 2012 best consulting workplaces—defined as those with more than 250 billable consultants—the publication cited the firm’s high scores in the areas of Firm Culture and Career Development. The firm, along with all recognized consultancies, is profiled in the “Best Firms to Work For” special section of Consulting Magazine’s August 17 issue.

“From day one, ours has been a different type of consulting workplace, and that is by intent,” said Dean Fischer, West Monroe Partners’ president, CEO and one of its founders. “The same factors that drive our growth—focusing on the quality rather than quantity of our client relationships, aligning our rewards with value delivered, and measuring our success as a firm rather than as individuals—are the factors that make a difference in our culture and our people’s career opportunities.”

Founded in Chicago in 2002, West Monroe Partners has developed a full-service business and technology consulting organization on a platform of people-focused core values. The company has rigorously maintained this focus as it has grown to 8 offices across North America and a team of more than 350 consultants—in part by remaining 100-percent employee owned. Its innovative people first practices include a highly collaborative and participatory environment in which people at all levels contribute to the company’s direction and share in its results. Because of its size and predominantly middle-market client base, consultants have opportunities to assume significant client service and internal team responsibilities early in their careers.

West Monroe Partners has received numerous accolades for its workplace and people first practices. In addition to recognition from Consulting Magazine, the firm has been recognized nationally by Vault.com and regionally by the Chicago Tribune, Crain’s Chicago Business, the National Association for Business Resources, Columbus Business Journal, Seattle Business Magazine, Seattle Business Monthly, and Puget Sound Business Journal.

Consulting Magazine’s annual Best Firms to Work For survey is open to all consulting firms that currently employ at least 20 billable consultants; the publication names a separate list of “Best Small Firms” for consultancies with between 20 and 250 consultants. Results are based on survey data from at employees on six, equally-weighted categories: Career Development, Compensation and Benefits, Firm Culture, Work/Life Balance, Firm Leadership, and Client Engagement.

About West Monroe Partners
West Monroe Partners is a North American, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 350 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada. For more information, visit our website at www.westmonroe.com.
