richtext.rich_text_editor:
Moves Up to No. 10 in Overall Ranking;  Achieves Top-10 Rankings in Career Development, Culture, and LeadershipWest Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named one of Consulting magazine’s 2013 “Best Firms to Work For.” This is the fourth time Consulting magazine has recognized West Monroe Partners in its annual workplace ranking, a comprehensive look at the quality of life within the consulting profession’s top firms. Rankings are based on responses to an independent survey of nearly 12,000 consultants representing more than 400 firms. West Monroe Partners ranked 10th overall, up from 15th in 2012.

West Monroe Partners is listed among the top 10 firms in three of six employee satisfaction categories: 6th in Career Development, 9th in Firm Culture, and 10th in Leadership. In addition, it ranked 10th in Morale and 3rd among Multi-Service Firms. West Monroe Partners, along with all recognized consultancies, is profiled in the “Best Firms to Work For” special section of Consulting magazine’s September issue.

“This award is recognition and validation of the soundness and relevancy of the approach we defined when we founded our firm 11 years ago, which was to build something a little different from scratch,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe Partners’ president and co-founder. “Ours is an entrepreneurial story, just like those of many of our clients, and this has created great opportunities for our people.”

West Monroe Partners’ innovative human resources practices include a highly collaborative and participatory environment in which people at all levels contribute to the company’s direction and share in its results. Because of its size and predominantly middle-market client base, consultants have opportunities to assume significant client service and internal team responsibilities early in their careers. The firm converted to an ESOP at the end of 2012, further strengthening its commitment to 100-percent employee ownership.

West Monroe Partners has received numerous accolades for its workplace and human resource practices. In addition to recognition from Consulting magazine, the firm has been recognized nationally by Vault.com and regionally in several key markets, including Chicago, Seattle, and Columbus, Ohio. 

Consulting magazine’s annual “Best Firms to Work For” survey is open to all consulting firms that currently employ at least 20 billable consultants; the publication names a separate list of “Best Small Firms” for consultancies with between 20 and 250 consultants. Results are based on survey data from employees on six, equally-weighted categories: Career Development, Compensation and Benefits, Firm Culture, Work/Life Balance, Firm Leadership, and Client Engagement.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners has been named one of Consulting® Magazine’s 2014 “Best Firms to Work For”

West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named one of Consulting® Magazine’s 2014 “Best Firms to Work For.” This is the fifth time Consulting® has recognized West Monroe Partners in its annual workplace ranking, a comprehensive look at the quality of life within the consulting profession’s top firms based on responses to an independent survey of nearly 10,000 consultants representing more than 350 firms. West Monroe Partners ranked 7th overall.

West Monroe Partners also ranked among the top 10 firms in six of six employee satisfaction categories:  Firm Culture, Work/Life Balance, Compensation & Benefits, Client Engagement, Career Development, and Leadership. West Monroe Partners, along with all recognized consultancies, is profiled in the “Best Firms to Work For” special section of Consulting®’s September issue.

They come here for differentiated career development opportunities, mentoring, and on-the-job experiences and the promise of working with the best in the business,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe Partners’ president and co-founder. “This recognition validates their choice, but it also raises the bar for us to do more and do it even better.”

title: West Monroe Partners Named one of Washington's Best Workplaces
name: West Monroe Partners Named one of Washington's Best Workplaces

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Named one of Washington's Best Workplaces

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Named one of Washington's Best Workplaces
global_field.meta_description: Puget Sound Business Journal Recognizes Firm among Top 25 Best Workplaces â€“ Small Category

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners was named one of the 85 local business recognized as one of Washington’s “2012 Best Workplaces” by Puget Sound Business Journal.

Seattle, WA – August 13, 2012 – West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consultancy, announced today that it has been named one of Washington’s “2012 Best Workplaces” by Puget Sound Business Journal. The publication surveyed more than 230 businesses in the region, ultimately honoring 85 finalists—25 each in the small, medium, and large business categories, and 10 in the extra-large business category.

Opened in 2005, the Seattle office today has more than 40 employees and serves more than 20 active clients across the Pacific Northwest, including some of Washington’s other “Best Workplaces”.

“West Monroe Partners is built on a foundation of people-focused core values,” said Tom Bolger, who has led the Seattle practice since its inception. “We believe that focusing on the type of environment and experiences we offer our people translates directly into the quality of service we deliver to our clients. That philosophy is responsible for the growth and success we have enjoyed in the Pacific Northwest.”

Like all West Monroe Partners offices, the Seattle practice maintains a highly participatory and collaborative culture marked by an open work environment; frequent employee meetings and gatherings, including an annual retreat at Leavenworth to celebrate Oktoberfest; a strong commitment to serving the local community by hosting firm-sponsored community service events; and regular recognition of its employees. The company has rigorously maintained this culture as it has grown to seven offices across North America and a team of more than 300 consultants—in part by remaining 100-percent employee owned. Its commitment to a people-first culture enables people at all levels to contribute to the company’s direction and share in its results.

This is not the first local or national recognition for West Monroe Partners. Seattle Business Magazine has included the firm on its list of “Best Companies to Work For—Headquartered Outside of Washington” for the past two years. Additionally, in 2008, Seattle Business Monthly named West Monroe Partners one of Seattle’s “Best Places to Work.” Recognition like this is not just specific to the Seattle market; West Monroe has institutionalized a people-first oriented culture firm-wide, which has led to national recognition for its workplace by Consulting Magazine and Vault.com as well as multiple local awards in Chicago and Columbus.

The Puget Sound Business Journal asked readers to nominate their own or other companies beginning in March. To be eligible for recognition, companies must be at least four years old with 10 or more full-time employees at an office in Washington. Eligible companies participated by asking full-time Washington-based employees to complete a survey. The publication honored 85 top-scoring companies based on survey results and determined the top three medalist in each category by administering a best practices survey in July.

The publication celebrated all 2012 honorees at an event at Safeco Field on August 9.

title: West Monroe Partners Named to 2013 Great Place to Work Best Small & Medium Workplaces List published in FORTUNE magazine
name: West Monroe Partners Named to 2013 Great Place to Work Best Small & Medium Workplaces List published in FORTUNE magazine

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Named to 2013 Great Place to Work Best Small & Medium Workplaces List published in FORTUNE magazine

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Named to 2013 Great Place to Work Best Small & Medium Workplaces List published in FORTUNE magazine

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Firm Recognized for the First Time; Profile Cites Strong People-first Culture, Including Recent Introduction of Employee Stock Ownership Plan

West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named by Great Place to Work as one of the best workplaces in the United States on its annual 2013 Best Small & Medium Workplaces list, published today in FORTUNE magazine. Ranked 20, this is West Monroe Partners’ first time receiving this honor.

Great Place to Work cited West Monroe Partners’ culture and, in particular, its people-first values as a distinguishing factor that contributed to this recognition. In its profile of West Monroe Partners, Great Place to Work calls out the firm’s recently implemented employee stock ownership plan (ESOP), “CXO” (chief “something” officer) program, career equity initiative, and 1+1+1 social responsibility program as unique elements that contribute to a strong and compelling culture and workplace.

A survey of more than 200 West Monroe Partners employees produced ratings of greater than 95 percent in six areas: great challenges (98 percent), great atmosphere (98 percent), great pride (98 percent), great communication (98 percent), great bosses (97 percent), and great rewards (96 percent).

“We are extremely honored to receive this recognition from Great Place to Work for the first time,” said Dean Fischer, West Monroe Partners’ CEO and co-founder. “We founded this firm with the intent to create a distinctive culture, and it is particularly rewarding to see how this impacts our people today—after 11 years and significant growth and expansion. What struck me the most was a comment from one of our employees who has worked for a number of consulting companies and describes our firm as ‘nothing like any of them.’”

Competing against hundreds of companies across the country, West Monroe Partners participated in a rigorous selection process, which included an employee survey and an in-depth questionnaire about benefits programs and company practices. Great Place to Work evaluates each application using its unique methodology based on five dimensions: credibility, respect, fairness, pride, and camaraderie. In compiling the list, Great Place to Work® has found that employees believe they work for great organizations when they consistently trust the people the work for, have pride in what they do, and enjoy the people they work with.

Divided into two categories, Small (50-250 employees) and Medium (251-999 employees), the list has recognized companies with exceptional workplace cultures for the past ten years.

“The companies appearing on our Best Small & Medium Workplaces list help us achieve our mission by presenting others with an example to emulate. These companies demonstrate that being an excellent employer leads to business success,” said Robert Levering, CEO and Co-founder of Great Place to Work. “While these companies may be relatively small in headcount, many of them provide services to some of the country’s largest and most notable organizations, suggesting that success has not so much to do with size as with the quality of service and experience a company provides. A great workplace, full of great employees, is better equipped to achieve that success.”

Organizations named on the list see many benefits that include better financial performance, less employee turnover, higher levels of customer satisfaction and loyalty, more innovative and creative thinking, higher productivity and enhanced public perception.

More information about Great Place to Work is available at www.greatplacetowork.com.

About Great Place to Work
Great Place to Work® is a global consulting and management training firm specializing in workplace excellence and development of high-trust organizational cultures. Its proprietary research tool, the Trust Index© Employee Survey is taken by over 10 million employees in 45 countries annually. Leading companies worldwide apply its Model® to increase the levels of trust across their organizations and drive business results. Annually, Great Place to Work® produces the annual FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For® list and the Great Place to Work® Best Small and Medium Workplaces list. Follow Great Place to Work® online at www.greatplacetowork.com and on Twitter at @GPTW_US.

West Monroe Partners employees produced ratings of greater than 95 percent in six areas: Great Challenges (98%), Great Atmosphere (99%), Great Rewards (97%), Great Pride (99%), Great Communication (98%) and Great Bosses (97%).

“We’ve taken great care to build a people-first culture through initiatives such as our career development program, our on-the-job experiences, and our ownership model. Competing against hundreds of companies across the country, West Monroe Partners participated in a rigorous selection process, which included an employee survey and an in-depth questionnaire about benefits programs and company practices. For example, the growth that many of these companies are experiencing is tremendous, and they are paying close attention to culture every step of the way. Organizations named on the list see many benefits that include better financial performance, less employee turnover, higher levels of customer satisfaction and loyalty, more innovative and creative thinking, higher productivity and enhanced public perception.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners’ makes it onto the Crain’s Fast Fifty list for the fifth time in the past six yearsWest Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced that it has been named to Crain’s Fast Fifty, a list of the 50 fastest-growing companies in Chicago published annually by Crain’s Chicago Business. With a five-year growth rate of 148 percent, West Monroe ranked 36 on the list of 50 companies. 

Since opening its doors eleven years ago, West Monroe has grown revenue to more than $65.4 million and headcount to over 350 consultants. At the end of 2012 West Monroe opened its eighth office in Minneapolis.

Several contributing factors had an impact on West Monroe’s success over the last year. In 2012 West Monroe saw incremental growth as clients became increasingly active in the revitalized M&A market. By adding a dedicated insurance practice leader and supporting talent, the firm’s insurance practice revenue increased significantly from 2011 to 2012. Additionally, the energy sector experienced high growth with rising interest in renewable energy projects. West Monroe continues to rely on our E&U expertise to support these efforts, such as:  working with the City of Chicago on a program to help make the Chicago land area a leading U.S. market for residential and commercial rooftop solar.  

“Our success can be attributed to the discipline and focus on quality over quantity – both with our people and our clients.” said Dean Fischer, the company’s CEO and one of its founders. “We know—and have seen time and time again—that when you have happy people, this translates to better client service and better quality work. In fact, our motto is ’to do the work we love with the people we trust’.” 

This is West Monroe Partners’ fifth time on the Crain’s Fast Fifty list over the past six years. Additionally, it has been listed as a top company to work for nationally by Consulting Magazine and Vault Inc.; in Chicago by Crain’s, the Chicago Tribune and the National Association of Business Resources; in Seattle by Seattle Business Monthly and Puget Sound Business Journal; and in Columbus by Columbus Business First.

To qualify for the Fast Fifty list, Crain’s evaluated companies with an inception date on or before December 31, 2007; with headquarters in the six-county area (Cook, DuPage, Kane, Lake, McHenry and Will) as of December 31, 2011; and with 2012 revenue of at least $20 million. The publication required financial statements or tax returns and enlisted an outside accounting firm to assist with verifying the financial information.

title: West Monroe Partners Provides Pro-bono Strategy Services for Seattle Repertory Theatre
name: West Monroe Partners Provides Pro-bono Strategy Services for Seattle Repertory Theatre

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Provides Pro-bono Strategy Services for Seattle Repertory Theatre

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Provides Pro-bono Strategy Services for Seattle Repertory Theatre
global_field.meta_description: Project Produces a Plan for Strengthening Governance Processes and Audience Experience

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced that it has provided pro-bono strategy and planning services for Seattle Repertory Theatre. West Monroe Partners helped Seattle Repertory Theatre synthesize extensive data gathered through past planning efforts, assess current operations, and develop an action plan for strengthening its governance processes and audience experience.

In addition to assessing key areas of the theatre’s operations, West Monroe Partners also applied expertise in customer experience to guide Seattle Repertory Theatre executives through a workshop designed to understand key audience segments and define ways to enhance their experience and interactions with the organization. 

“We are pleased to contribute core strategy and customer experience skills, as well as our time, to assist Seattle Repertory Theatre, a cornerstone of our local community for many years,” said Tom Bolger, leader of West Monroe Partners’ Seattle office. “Social responsibility and building vibrant communities is very important to West Monroe and to our people, and working with the Rep to enable its services and growth is one way that we are able to give back.”

“West Monroe Partners’ broad experience with non-profits and membership-based organizations, including other prominent organizations in our Pacific Northwest community, has been very valuable to us as we look to strengthen our ability to engage and serve all of our constituents,” said Benjamin Moore, managing director for Seattle Repertory Theatre. “Just as valuable as helping us develop a practical plan for executing our strategy was West Monroe’s ability to engage and build consensus among a very diverse set of stakeholders.”

West Monroe Partners announced an ambitious social and environmental responsibility commitment in early 2011. Following on the leadership efforts of its clients and business partners, West Monroe strives to contribute one percent of its talent in pro-bono work, one percent of its profits in donations to qualifying organizations, and one percent of its collective personnel time to community engagement and leadership activities. Locally, it has provided pro-bono services to support prominent non-profit organizations including the Woodland Park Zoo, Abused Deaf Women’s Advocacy Services (ADWAS), and the YMCA of Greater Seattle.

About Seattle Repertory Theatre

Seattle Repertory Theatre celebrates its 50th Anniversary with the 2012-2013 season. The theatre was founded in 1963 and is currently led by Artistic Director Jerry Manning and Managing Director Benjamin Moore. One of America's premier non-profit resident theatres, Seattle Repertory Theatre has achieved international renown for its consistently high production and artistic standards, and was awarded the 1990 Tony Award for Outstanding Regional Theatre. With an emphasis on entertaining plays of true dramatic and literary worth, Seattle Rep produces a season of plays along with educational programs, new play workshops and special presentations.

title: West Monroe Partners ranks among top North American, global managed services providers in 2013 MSPmentorÂ© study

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners ranks among top North American, global managed services providers in 2013 MSPmentorÂ© study

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners ranks among top North American, global managed services providers in 2013 MSPmentorÂ© study
global_field.meta_description: Strong core managed services plus specialized capabilities produce 67-percent growth during 2012

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Strong core managed services plus specialized capabilities produce 67-percent growth during 2012.

West Monroe Partners today announced that it is among the top 100 firms recognized both in North America and globally in Nine Lives Media’s MSPmentor© 2013 Edition rankings of top managed services providers (MSPs).  West Monroe ranked 76th on the MSPmentor 200—North American Edition list, up from 104th the previous year. Globally, the firm ranked 97th in the MSPmentor© 501 report.

The MSPmentor© rankings are based on data from MSPmentor’s global online survey, conducted between October and December 2012. The MSPmentor rankings recognize top managed service providers based on a range of metrics, including annual recurring revenue, total devices managed, revenue per employee, growth rates, and more. More than 1,100 companies participated in the 2012 survey.

Since West Monroe Partners’ inception in 2002, it has provided managed services for organizations across a variety of industries, delivering both routine and proactive help desk, infrastructure management, application management and development, and data management and reporting services, as well as IT service management capabilities. The firm utilizes an array of state-of-the-art monitoring and maintenance tools as part of its managed services offering. Its revenues from managed services increased 67 percent during 2012

“Our continued strong growth and reputation in managed services reflects the effort we put into delivering quality service as well as our clients’ confidence in and reliance on our capabilities,” said Mark Nelson, Managed Services Practice Lead. “By taking our core service desk and infrastructure management offerings and expanding them in areas such as SharePoint, application management, data management and analytics, software asset management, and disaster recovery services, we are delivering more specialized services and advice that helps our clients keep their businesses running efficiently.”

“Nine Lives Media and MSPmentor congratulate West Monroe Partners for its leadership position, both in North America and globally,” said Amy Katz, president of Nine Lives Media, a division of Penton Media. “In the fiercely competitive IT services market, these MSPs represent the best of the best.”

“We expanded our 2013 global report from 100 companies to 501 companies worldwide, reflecting the now-mainstream nature of managed services and demand for more detailed information about market size, competitive positioning, and overall industry performance,” said Joe Panettieri, editorial director of Nine Lives Media. “MSPs on this year’s global list generated annual recurring revenues of US$2.5 billion, up 25 percent from 2011, and those MSPs are now managing 4.8 million desktop and mobile devices for customers, up 20 percent from 2011.”

MSPmentor, produced by Nine Lives Media, is the ultimate guide to managed services. MSPmentor features the industry’s top-ranked blog, research, Channel Expert Hour Webcasts and FastChat videos. It is the number one online media destination for managed service providers in the world. The exclusive Nine Lives Media research covers:

The MSPmentor 501, Global Edition
The MSPmentor 200, North America Edition
The MSPmentor 50, EMEA (Europe, Middle East, Africa) Edition
The MSPmentor 25, AANZ (Asia, Australia, New Zealand) Edition
The MSPmentor 100 Small Business Edition—new in 2013, recognizing MSPs with 10 or fewer employees

The full 2013 study is available at: http://www.mspmentor.net/top-100-msps/.

About Nine Lives Media
Nine Lives Media, a division of Penton Media, defines emerging IT media markets and disrupts established IT media markets. The company’s IT channel-centric online communities include MSPmentor (www.MSPmentor.net), The VAR Guy (www.TheVARguy.com), Talkin’ Cloud (www.TalkinCloud.com), VARtweet (www.VARtweet.com) and MSPtweet (www.MSPtweet.com). For more information, visit www.NineLivesMediaInc.com.

title: West Monroe Partners Tops Seattle Business Magazine 2014 â€œBest Companies to Work Forâ€”Headquartered Outside of Washingtonâ€ List
name: West Monroe Partners Tops Seattle Business Magazine 2014 â€œBest Companies to Work Forâ€”Headquartered Outside of Washingtonâ€ List

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Tops Seattle Business Magazine 2014 â€œBest Companies to Work Forâ€”Headquartered Outside of Washingtonâ€ List

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Tops Seattle Business Magazine 2014 â€œBest Companies to Work Forâ€”Headquartered Outside of Washingtonâ€ List
global_field.meta_description: Consultancy Recognized Among 100 â€œBest Companies to Work Forâ€ for Fourth Year in A Row

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it has been named the number one, top company in Seattle Business magazine’s 2014 ranking of “Best Companies to Work For—Headquartered Outside of Washington” list. This is the fourth year in a row that Seattle Business has recognized West Monroe Partners in its annual ranking of 100 “Best Companies to Work For” in Washington State based on outstanding employee culture, values, and benefits.

West Monroe received the top ranking on a list of companies headquartered outside of Washington ranked at an awards dinner June 17, 2014, at Westin Seattle. The winners, hailing from 18 cities across the state of Washington, were chosen based on extensive surveys completed by nearly 10,000 employees.  Employees’ detailed responses were used to determine each company’s score in 10 categories, including such vital areas as communication, executive leadership, corporate culture and workplace environment. A panel of judges selected the top winners in each category.

“Receiving this recognition as a top employer four years in a row is a remarkable accomplishment, and we are honored to be in such elite company,” said Tom Bolger, managing director and founder of the Seattle office. “It can be challenging to distinguish one consulting firm from others, but we are successfully doing that at West Monroe Partners. The type of work we do is different, how we do it is different, and we serve a different breed of client. None of that is possible without having a distinctive workplace.”

Founded in 2002, West Monroe Partners has grown to a nearly $82.2 million consultancy with more than 450 consultants across North America. The Seattle office, opened in 2005, serves more than 40 clients in key industries, including banking, private equity, insurance, utilities, and healthcare. Its team numbers more than 60 people, including more than 20 who joined West Monroe Partners in January 2014 through its acquisition of Madrona Solutions Group. West Monroe Partners is moving to new, larger office space in Seattle in July to fully integrate its growing team.

“West Monroe Partners’ focus on developing a truly people-focused workplace was a strong factor in our decision to become part of the organization,” said Brian Paulen, a director in the Seattle office and former CEO of recently acquired Madrona Solutions. “Now that we are a part of the organization and immersed in this culture every day, it’s even clearer how this translates to tremendous service and value to clients. It’s very motivating for our people.”

West Monroe Partners’ Seattle office previously has received workplace accolades from the Puget Sound Business Journal. In addition, the firm has been listed as a top company to work for nationally by Consulting Magazine and Vault Inc., and was named by Great Place to Work as one of the best workplaces in the United States on its annual 2013 Best Small & Medium Workplaces list, published in FORTUNE magazine.

To be considered for the Seattle Business Best Workplaces list, applicants must submit a formal nomination, participate in an employee satisfaction survey conducted by an independent third party, and then be selected by a panel of judges from previously recognized workplaces throughout the state.

The judges’ conclusions were based in part on data submitted anonymously by thousands of employees of the participating businesses. For judging purposes, nominated companies were separated into five classifications: small firms (30 or fewer employees), midsize (31 to 100 employees), large (more than 100 employees), nonprofits and firms headquartered outside Washington.

title: West Monroe Partners Unveils FLEXwfmâ„¢ Workforce Management Tool
name: West Monroe Partners Unveils FLEXwfmâ„¢ Workforce Management Tool

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Partners Unveils FLEXwfmâ„¢ Workforce Management Tool

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Partners Unveils FLEXwfmâ„¢ Workforce Management Tool
global_field.meta_description: FLEXwfmâ„¢ enables optimal staffing and workforce planning for branch banking and operations.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
FLEXwfm™, a secure, web-based application helps banks uncovers bottlenecks and idle time in organizations to maximize efficiency in staffing and resource scheduling.

West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced the release of FLEXwfm™, a proprietary workforce modeling tool designed exclusively for front and back office operations at banking centers.

“We saw a huge gap in the marketplace between manual tools and overly complex integrated applications with hefty price tags,” says Bryan Slepian, senior manager of the Workforce Optimization practice at West Monroe Partners. “FLEXwfm™ provides detailed analytics essential for making optimal staffing decisions delivered in a cost effective platform that can be implemented in a matter of days.”

Custom configured with a client’s process, productivity targets and volume arrival patterns, FLEXwfm™ helps banks effectively manage workflow, meet increasing customer demands, decrease costly overtime wages and improve budgeting and forecasting. It offers key benefits, such as: reducing customer wait times, increasing productivity by 10-25% and accelerating time to revenue by 15% without supplemental staff.

FLEXwfm™ was built on the Microsoft Azure cloud platform to maximize efficiency, speed to deployment and a quicker return on investment.

“More and more we are seeing companies turn to cloud-based systems to ease the burden of implementation and reduce cost,” says Jerin May, director of Technology Services at West Monroe Partners. “Like many of our banking clients that are gravitating towards the cloud platform, we also leverage this operating model. Offering both the security and the flexibility demanded by the industry, we can now deploy almost immediately across one branch or hundreds,” continues May.

Key features enable the end user to:

  • Easily build staff schedules with a visual interface and drag and drop functionality – customized graphical output provides immediate feedback on service levels and employee utilization

  • Analyze customer and employee impact with scenario modeling capability

  • Associate and prioritize job roles with more than one function

  • Account for reduced productivity for new hires

  • Update data quickly and easily as input variables change

  • Use the formula builder for dynamic volume drivers

Technology Specifications:

  • Built using the Microsoft .Net Framework

  • Deployment options include Microsoft Azure cloud and on-premise

FLEXwfm™ is part of West Monroe Partners’ FUSION solution suite, a proprietary workforce optimization methodology that helps banks establish new scheduling strategies, gain intelligence into existing operations, evaluate improvement opportunities and implement solutions that optimize their workforce and operations.

The West Monroe Partners team has more than 25 years of experience implementing workforce optimization solutions for companies of varying industries with over 500 implementations completed across North America and an average of 25% productivity improvement.

About West Monroe Partners
West Monroe Partners is a North American, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 300 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada.

title: West Monroeâ€™s Minneapolis Office Announces 2020 Relocation to The Nordic
name: West Monroeâ€™s Minneapolis Office Announces 2020 Relocation to The Nordic

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroeâ€™s Minneapolis Office Announces 2020 Relocation to The Nordic
summary_info.summary_description: Larger North Loop space will bring employees together following recent GoKart Labs acquisition, accommodate plans to double Minneapolis-based workforce.

global_field.meta_title: West Monroeâ€™s Minneapolis Office Announces 2020 Relocation to The Nordic
global_field.meta_description: Larger North Loop space will bring employees together following recent GoKart Labs acquisition, accommodate plans to double Minneapolis-based workforce.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
MINNEAPOLIS – West Monroe Partners, a national business and technology consultancy, today announced that its Minneapolis office will relocate to new space in the North Loop neighborhood to accommodate its expanded local team and future growth projections. The firm has agreed to lease more than 42,000 square feet at The Nordic, a unique mixed-use development at 729 Washington Avenue, and expects to move into the new space in April 2020.

West Monroe, which has nine offices across the United States, doubled its local team in October 2019 through the acquisition of Minneapolis-based digital product studio, GoKart Labs. The new office will have more than two times the space of West Monroe’s current local footprint, allowing the firm to bring more than 100 employees together in one location and still have room to grow. Based on increasing demand for consulting services from the region’s upper-mid-market and Fortune 1000 companies, West Monroe expects to double the size of its local workforce again between now and 2025.

“Already, we are seeing tremendous impact from integrating the respective consulting, creative, and technology talents of West Monroe and GoKart Labs, so it has been a priority for us to find space where we can bring everyone together. The Nordic not only enables us to do that; it also offers a modern, efficient, human-centered environment that is very much aligned with our people-first culture,” said Tom Ewers, managing director and Minneapolis office leader. “We are excited to find a space that enables us to collaborate and do ground-breaking work for category leaders committed to differentiating themselves and creating value in a digital marketplace.

West Monroe opened its Minneapolis office in 2013. Today, the office provides technology-enabled consulting solutions for clients across the Upper Midwest in key industries, including healthcare and life sciences, financial services, consumer and industrial products, and private equity. The firm’s Minneapolis-based digital product studio serves clients nationally as West Monroe builds out additional studios in other offices.

West Monroe earned 35 awards for its unique, people-first company culture in 2019. Nationally, the firm has been recognized as a leading company at which to work by Great Place to Work and Fortune, as well as by Vault Inc. and Consulting magazine. Both West Monroe and GoKart Labs have been named a Star Tribune Top Workplace and a Minneapolis/St. Paul Business Journal Best Place to Work. 

“Collaborating to create value through multi-disciplinary teams is at the heart of what we do, so it is important for us to have space that inspires that, while also being an attractive destination for our current and prospective employees. The Nordic offers a space and location that exemplifies our unique culture, while also proximity to both of our current offices so as not to disrupt people’s current commutes,” said Don Smithmier, co-founder of GoKart Labs and now a senior director with West Monroe. “Just as important, we are eager to have our entire Minneapolis team together in one space so that everyone has exposure to and can learn from each other’s skills and diverse perspectives. This creates career growth opportunities for all and helps us fulfill our mission to build the next generation of leaders.

The Nordic, led by United Properties, is one of Minnesota’s first registered projects employing the WELL Building StandardTM (WELL), a global movement focused exclusively on the health and wellness of building occupants. It features full-service restaurants, retail, micro-unit housing, parking and bike storage, and gathering areas, including a unique four-season plaza and a rooftop patio.

"We're pleased to welcome West Monroe Partners to The Nordic, our unique mixed-use development in Minneapolis' vibrant North Loop neighborhood,” said Gordy Stofer, vice president, capital markets for United Properties. “West Monroe joins other fast-growing companies on the leading edge of their industries that have selected The Nordic as their home because it offers an ideal location and a variety of amenities their employees can enjoy."

West Monroe is currently hiring for an array of positions in Minneapolis. For career opportunities, visit https://www.acceptthechallenge.com.  

About West Monroe Partners
West Monroe is a national business and technology consulting firm that partners with dynamic organizations to reimagine, build, and operate their businesses at peak performance. Our team of more than 1,400 professionals is comprised of an uncommon blend of business consultants and deep technologists. This unique combination of expertise enables us to design, develop, implement, and run strategic business and technology solutions that yield a dramatic commercial impact on our clients’ profitability and performance. For more information, visit www.wmp.com.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Independent Research Firm lists West Monroe’s mobile claims application as one way for insurance companies to engage with customers

Chicago, Illinois- October 4, 2012 - West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that its mobile claims application was featured in the September 2012 Forrester Research, Inc., Ellen Carney report, “The Future of Insurance is Mobile.”

In the report, Carney notes that “mobile is changing the nature of engagement throughout the customer life cycle [for both agents and customers].” Vital to customer retention and loyalty is engaging with customers in a timely fashion via mobile devices. Carney highlights West Monroe’s mobile claims application as an engagement tool for insurance companies. West Monroe’s mobile application for the homeowners market includes a hail claim function that ties a live hail map feed to support the severity of the damage being claimed, while offering helpful reminders to the homeowner that they’re obligated to protect their property from further damage and linking to local contractors.

“Mobile and portal solutions for driving both customer and agent retention and satisfaction are increasing dramatically to match growing expectations from both sides,” says Cindy De Armond, director of West Monroe’s insurance practice. “Both customers and agents alike want easy access to information as quickly as possible. Real-time claims data not only allows insurers to provide immediate services to clients, but also provides insurers live claim data feeds to better predict the potential loss for that client.”

West Monroe’s mobile claims application was built using an Agile development methodology and works with all mobile platforms including iOS (iPhone, iPad), Android, Windows Phone 7 and more. It can be fully integrated with internal systems.

A full copy of “The Future of Insurance is Mobile” can be accessed on Forrester’s website (subscription required).

title: West Monroe' Paul A. DeCotis Named One of New York's 'Responsible 100' Honorees
name: West Monroe' Paul A. DeCotis Named One of New York's 'Responsible 100' Honorees

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe' Paul A. DeCotis Named One of New York's 'Responsible 100' Honorees

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe' Paul A. DeCotis Named One of New York's 'Responsible 100' Honorees
global_field.meta_description: Energy & Utilities Consultant and Steward Recognized for Leadership in Promoting Environmental Sustainability

richtext.rich_text_editor:
NEW YORK CITY - West Monroe Partners, a national business and technology consultancy, today announced that Paul A. DeCotis, a senior director and head of West Monroe’s East Coast Energy & Utilities practice, is one of City & State’s Responsible 100 Honorees. The Responsible 100 list recognizes 100 of New York’s most outstanding corporate citizens. City & State celebrated the accomplishments of DeCotis and other honorees at a luncheon today at New York University.

 

The Responsible 100 annually recognizes New York executives, thought leaders, visionaries, and influencers who are setting new standards of excellence, dedication, and leadership in improving their communities and making transformative change by promoting one of the core principles of social responsibility: charity, community engagement, customer service, diversity and inclusion, equity, ethics, transparency, sustainability, and volunteerism.

“Thank you to City & State for this recognition, but more importantly for highlighting the exceptional and diverse contributions of the entire group of honorees,” DeCotis said. “It is an honor and privilege to have the opportunity to work with clients and within our communities to promote better, safer delivery of energy, and promote the sustainability of our environment.”

DeCotis has more than 30 years of experience as an industry executive, consultant, steward, thought leader, and adjunct professor of 26 years at Sage Graduate School, Cornell University, and Rochester Institute of Technology. Among his consulting responsibilities with West Monroe, he helps investor-owned and municipal utilities, independent energy companies, and government agencies respond to the changing business environment, customer needs, and society’s demands.

“Paul’s personal and professional interests reflect his passion for improving the health and viability of the people, communities, and environment around us,” said Gil Mermelstein, managing director and West Monroe’s New York office leader. “His contributions to our clients and community represent a true intersection of our work as a business and technology consultancy and our core value of social responsibility.”

DeCotis is a board member of the Delta Institute in Chicago; chair of the National Academy of Sciences, Engineering, and Medicine committee reviewing the energy resource development potential on U.S. Department of Energy-owned lands; and a columnist and editorial board member of the Wiley Natural Gas and Electricity Journal, and Springer’s Energy Efficiency Journal. He is also a board member of the Advanced Energy Research and Technology Center at Stony Brook University, an advisory board member for the National Renewable Energy Laboratory’s Strategic Energy Analysis Center, and a past member of the Board on Energy and Environmental Systems of the National Academies in Washington, D.C.

Prior to joining West Monroe in 2014, DeCotis held several roles responsible for shaping energy policy, strategy, and legislation in New York and the Northeast. As energy secretary and chair of the state energy planning board for two New York governors, Paul was instrumental in establishing and implementing the state’s clean energy initiatives. He also was a member of the mayor’s energy planning board in New York City. DeCotis continues to write extensively on energy and environmental issues of the day.

“City & State is pleased that we can play a role in acknowledging the accomplishments and contributions of New York’s most responsible leaders,” said City & State President & CEO Tom Allon. “We are thrilled to shine a spotlight on these 100 winners who all set a clear example for their peers by promoting corporate social responsibility and authenticity in every area of their enterprises.”

City & State New York

City & State New York is the only media company devoted solely to covering government and politics in New York. Formed from the merger of City Hall and The Capitol newspapers in 2012, City & State provides insightful and detailed coverage of the politics, the policies and the influential individuals and organizations all over New York.

title: West Monroe Plans 100% Growth in Los Angeles Over the Next Five Years
name: West Monroe Plans 100% Growth in Los Angeles Over the Next Five Years

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Plans 100% Growth in Los Angeles Over the Next Five Years

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Plans 100% Growth in Los Angeles Over the Next Five Years
global_field.meta_description: West Monroe Partners' Los Angeles office plans to double the size over the next five years to address todayâ€™s growing tech skills gap in business and innovation.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a progressive business and technology consultancy, today announced it plans to double the size of its office over the next five years to address today’s growing tech skills gap in business and innovation, as the firm hires professionals with an uncommon blend of deep technological expertise and business acumen.

The Los Angeles office provides a full array of business and technology consulting services to dozens of mid-market and Fortune 1000 clients across Southern California and is investing in the area for its wealth of business improvement opportunities in financial services, healthcare, and energy and utilities.

West Monroe, which has 10 locations and nearly 1,000 employees across the United States, opened the Los Angeles office in 2014 and has expanded it rapidly since then. On Oct. 31, 2017, West Monroe completed its acquisition of Los Angeles-based CAST Management Consultants, bringing its current headcount to more than 40 employees.

“Our growth mindset has created dozens of jobs in the Los Angeles area in just a few years, and will fuel even more in the years to follow,” said Ken Siegman, senior director in West Monroe’s Financial Services practice and leader of the Los Angeles office leader. “Seeing West Monroe’s distinctive people-first culture take shape here and evolve into a unique and collaborative work environment has been extremely gratifying, and I continue to be impressed with the talent pool here. Today, we have a close-knit team here that is unlike any I have experienced in my consulting career.”

West Monroe’s people-focused culture and policies has resulted in Los Angeles Business Journal ranking West Monroe No. 1 in its Best Places to Work Los Angeles for the past two years.

The newly created positions will cover all areas of the consulting business, from operations to project managers to strategists, adding technical, functional, and industry expertise, primarily in the financial services, energy and utilities and private equity industries. In candidates, the firm looks for an “uncommon blend” of deep technical expertise and business acumen, both at the individual and collective level.

To accommodate its investment in new talent, the firm recently relocated to 1000 Wilshire Boulevard, Suite 1100. The new office is located in the same building, known as The Wedbush Center, as West Monroe’s previous office and more than doubles the firm’s space to 8,700 square feet. It was critical for the firm to remain downtown and contribute to the revitalization of downtown Los Angeles.

“Our Los Angeles office has played a key role in increasing our presence and scale on the West Coast, and it is an important market for some of the core industries we serve, including financial services, healthcare, and energy and utilities,” said Tom Bolger, West Monroe’s senior managing director of strategic growth. “Achieving a compound annual growth rate of 35 percent is rare in this profession, but we have been able to do so by carefully enhancing our team with professionals who possess an uncommon blend of deep technological expertise and business acumen. We are eager to continue building the next generation of leaders by tapping into Southern California’s wealth of talent.”

name: West Monroe Plans to Double Workforce to Address IT Skills Gap

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Plans to Double Workforce to Address IT Skills Gap

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Plans to Double Workforce to Address IT Skills Gap
global_field.meta_description: The firm plans to double its workforce over the next five years and is on target to have hired more than 200 professionals by the end of 2017.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a leading business and technology consulting firm, announced today it plans to double its workforce over the next five years. And by the end of 2017, the firm is on target to have hired more than 200 professionals. Its hiring spree is part of an effort to address today's growing tech skills gap in business and innovation, as the firm hires professionals with an uncommon blend of deep technological expertise and business acumen.

West Monroe Partners serves hundreds of clients across the mid-market and Fortune 1000 through specialized industry practices. Its expertise in technology, with a business mindset, has fueled incredible growth: West Monroe Partners was founded in 2002 with a handful of employees and has grown at a CAGR of 35%. It currently employs nearly 1,000 nationwide.

"We designed the company to have technological underpinnings while also being the best at solving business problems," said CEO Kevin McCarty. "At many companies, business and IT people don't speak each other's languages, and that rift has affected their ability to perform at peak. The confluence of our uncommon blend starts with me, a technologist at heart, and permeates throughout the company. We've always known this blend was the right answer to the business problems our clients face."

West Monroe Partners' people-focused culture and policies consistently rank the firm as one of the best places to work in the consulting industry and in major metropolitan areas such as Seattle, Los Angeles, New York, Chicago, and Minneapolis. This focus on "people first" has driven client satisfaction and project success: The firm's leadership believes employees do their best work when they are fulfilled and taken care of.

The newly created positions will cover all areas of the consulting business, from operations to project managers to strategists, adding technical, functional, and industry expertise, primarily in the healthcare, life sciences, energy, utilities, and financial services industries. Across the country, jobs will also include corporate services hires such as human resources, marketing, and finance. In candidates, the firm looks for an "uncommon blend" of deep technical expertise and business acumen, both at the individual and collective level.

Part of the firm's purpose is developing professionals that strike this uncommon blend into the next generation of leaders. Through mentorship and learning, West Monroe Partners invests significantly in talent to develop the business skills of technologists, and the technology skills of business professionals. "This investment in talent has been critical to our growth, allowing us to adapt quickly and move faster than most firms," McCarty said. "When companies have more business-minded technologists and technology-minded business people, it's a force multiplier. That is exactly why we are developing this blend within our young leaders today."

West Monroe Partners has offices in Chicago, Columbus, Dallas, Houston, Los Angeles, Minneapolis, New York, Pittsburgh, San Francisco, and Seattle.

About West Monroe Partners

West Monroe Partners is a progressive business and technology consulting firm that partners with dynamic organizations to reimagine, build, and operate their businesses at peak performance. Our team of more than 850 professionals is comprised of an uncommon blend of business consultants and deep technologists. This unique combination of expertise enables us to design, develop, implement, and run strategic business and technology solutions that yield a dramatic commercial impact on our clients' profitability and performance.

title: West Monroe Plans to Triple Dallas Presence Over Next 5 Years
name: West Monroe Plans to Triple Dallas Presence Over Next 5 Years

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Plans to Triple Dallas Presence Over Next 5 Years

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Plans to Triple Dallas Presence Over Next 5 Years
global_field.meta_description: The consulting firm recently added new capabilities and additional expertise to the growing office

richtext.rich_text_editor:
DALLAS – West Monroe Partners, a national business and technology consultancy, today announced it plans to triple its Dallas office presence over the next five years. West Monroe entered the Dallas market in 2015 through its acquisition of Etherios. Since then, the office has grown from seven employees to nearly 40 today and is expected to more than triple in size over the next five years.

West Monroe serves dozens of companies in Texas in its core industries of Financial Services, Healthcare and Life Sciences, Energy and Utilities, and Manufacturing and Distribution. Its success in the region has helped fuel incredible growth for the firm: West Monroe was founded in 2002 with a handful of employees and has grown at a CAGR of 35%.

Most recently, the firm has expanded the Dallas office capabilities to locally deliver its industry-leading mergers and acquisition services to private equity clients, and nCino implementation services to leading financial services institutions. To support these additional offerings, the Dallas office welcomes Scott Fuzer, a director in the Mergers & Acquisitions practice who transferred from Chicago, effective January 1. It also welcomes Jeff Boswell, a member of the Customer Experience and Operations Excellence practices, who leads the firm’s nCino Center of Excellence.

The two additional directors add extensive credentials and strong track records for applying technology to business needs for clients in the private equity and financial services industries. They are providing local leadership for two of West Monroe’s fastest-growing practices and building the firm’s capacity to meet demand in Texas and surrounding markets.

“Our rapid growth is creating new career and leadership opportunities for professionals in Dallas. With the addition of two local directors, we have significantly expanded our ability to deliver industry-leading solutions in Dallas and established the leadership we need to respond to demand in the Dallas market,” said Tom Hulsebosch, senior managing director and Dallas office leader. “Scott Fuzer and Jeff Boswell exemplify what we envision in our leaders, with well-honed capabilities for bringing our uncommon blend of business consulting acumen and deep technology expertise to the complex business challenges companies in this region face.” 

Fuzer led West Monroe’s Chicago M&A practice prior to his move to Dallas. He has more than 20 years of experience in business consulting and technology leadership roles across a range of industries, directly addressing the challenges of divestitures and mergers, including transforming, managing, and running an effective IT organization that enables business strategy.

Boswell plays a key role in growing multiple aspects of West Monroe’s business. He is the national Customer Experience lead for nCino bank operating platform solutions and leader of the Dallas Operations Excellence practice. He has more than 20 years of experience leading complex enterprise software projects that enable clients’ business goals. 

West Monroe’s people-focused culture and policies consistently rank West Monroe as one of the top places to work. The firm supports employees who desire to transfer from another West Monroe office, including those who wish to transfer to Dallas permanently. West Monroe’s Dallas office is one of the firm’s 10 offices across the United States.

About West Monroe Partners

West Monroe is a progressive business and technology consulting firm that partners with dynamic organizations to reimagine, build, and operate their businesses at peak performance. Our team of more than 950 professionals is comprised of an uncommon blend of business consultants and deep technologists. This unique combination of expertise enables us to design, develop, implement, and run strategic business and technology solutions that yield a dramatic commercial impact on our clients’ profitability and performance. For more information, visit www.westmonroe.com.

Media Relations Manager

title: West Monroe Projects Triple Digit Hiring in 2012
name: West Monroe Projects Triple Digit Hiring in 2012

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Projects Triple Digit Hiring in 2012

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Projects Triple Digit Hiring in 2012
global_field.meta_description: Market Changes, New Global Alliance Produce Unprecedented Demand for Talent

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it added more than 60 people to its team in the first six months of 2012 and more than 190 people to its team over the past 18 months. The new hires span all offices, industry teams, and practice specialties. Based on growth and demand projections, the firm expects to add more than 100 people to its team during 2012.

“A variety of market forces, from regulatory changes to globalization, are requiring our clients to adapt and transform their operations in order to thrive,” said Dean Fischer, West Monroe Partners’ president and CEO. “This, in turn, has driven demand across all of our areas of specialty and our need to expand our team significantly and at all levels—from highly experienced industry veterans to new college graduates.”

In 2011, West Monroe Partners enjoyed 28 percent growth in revenues.  Other than in 2009, West Monroe Partners has posted significant revenue growth every year since the firm was founded in 2002. Following 2009, West Monroe rebounded in 2010 with 49 percent year over year growth.

With seven offices in Canada and the United States, West Monroe Partners works with local and national clients that are looking to make significant improvement in their performance. In 2010, the firm initiated a global alliance with BearingPoint in Europe, providing its consultants additional opportunities to work with international colleagues and multinational clients.

“This is not your typical consulting workplace,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe Partners’ co-founder and Chicago office leader. “We are a 100-percent employee-owned company that has enjoyed tremendous growth due in part to an entrepreneurial culture that was developed early on in the firm’s existence. From day one, we strive to put our people in complex business situations and encourage them to challenge the status quo. By inspiring our people with the right career opportunities and rewarding them for exceptional work, we are able to deliver both outstanding client work and tremendous career and professional development opportunities.”

Since West Monroe Partners was founded 10 years ago, business and industry publications—from Consulting Magazine and Vault.com to the Chicago Tribune and Seattle Business Magazine—have recognized the firm numerous times for its growth, client service, culture and career opportunities.

title: West Monroe Promotes 7 New Managing Directors
name: West Monroe Promotes 7 New Managing Directors

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Promotes 7 New Managing Directors

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Promotes 7 New Managing Directors
global_field.meta_description: Groupâ€™s ascension reflects the consulting firmâ€™s commitment to building the next generation of leaders

richtext.rich_text_editor: Group’s ascension reflects the consulting firm’s commitment to building the next generation of leaders

CHICAGO  – West Monroe, a national business and technology consulting firm, today announced the appointment of seven new directors. In addition, seven current directors will assume new leadership roles as the firm flexes its management structure to address evolving market needs and prepare for significant planned growth.

“Continuous expansion of our leadership structure and team is essential if we are to achieve our ambitious plan to more than double revenue by 2025. But this isn’t just about growth. It is also central to our mission to build the next generation of leaders,” said Doug Armstrong, West Monroe’s chief operating officer.

West Monroe appointed the following new managing directors:

Saurabh Bansal works with energy companies and utilities to improve competitiveness and increase customer and shareholder value. He has 20 years of industry and consulting experience in operations, supply chain, business strategy, lean practices, and business transformation. He joined West Monroe in 2015.

Jason Cutler is a recognized Salesforce expert with a diverse background in finance, strategy, and operations. He has led multiple $1 million-plus transformation initiatives for financial services, manufacturing, healthcare/life sciences, and software clients. He joined the firm in 2015 through an acquisition. 

Sam Dawes works with leading consumer and industrial products companies to deliver transformative digital and workforce solutions. Known for his intrapreneurship, he has also been instrumental in launching and growing West Monroe’s Minneapolis office, the national C&IP practice, and numerous other strategic initiatives. He joined the firm directly from college in 2011.

Michael Guckian partners with financial services organizations to challenge the status quo and deliver innovations that increase differentiation, enhance performance, and improve the bottom line. He has extensive experience implementing new technology solutions – loan origination systems, card conversions, call center buildouts, and mobile banking platforms. He joined the firm in 2014. 

Andy Johnson guides private equity firms through all stages of the investment lifecycle. His relentless focus on value creation for portfolio companies has produced tangible wins for clients across industries and earned him a 2019 M&A Advisor’s Emerging Leaders award. He joined the firm in 2014.

Chris Stafford is a leader in West Monroe’s longstanding Mergers & Acquisitions practice, focusing on software companies. He helps software-as-a-service (SaaS) and tech-enabled services companies navigate complex situations. A trusted advisor to private equity firms and management teams, he has led more than 300 transactions. He joined West Monroe directly from college in 2008.

Sam Uyeno is a leading adviser to energy and utility companies on the West Coast. He has a unique blend of engineering, military operations, and business experience that enables him to examine complex issues from various perspectives. Always an innovator, he has developed tools that allow utilities and customers to assess the economic value of distributed energy resources. He joined the firm in 2015.

All promotions were effective March 1, 2021.

About West Monroe
West Monroe is a national consulting firm that was born in technology but built for business—partnering with companies in transformative industries to deliver real, measurable results. Technology is who we are, it is not something we bolted on overnight, and we believe it is one of the greatest enablers of business value. That’s why we work in diverse, multidisciplinary teams that blend industry expertise with deep operational and technology capabilities to create quantifiable, financial value for our clients. Our 1,500 employees based in eight offices across the United States also own 100% of our business, so when you partner with us you know we are committed—because your success is our success. Our undeniably different approach breeds undeniable results. Visit westmonroe.com to learn more.

For all inquiries, please contact:

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Promotes 13 Managing Directors, Appoints New Office Leaders to Continue Scaling Firmâ€™s Next Stage of Growth

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Promotes 13 Managing Directors, Appoints New Office Leaders to Continue Scaling Firmâ€™s Next Stage of Growth

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Group reflects firm’s continued commitment to building the next generation of leaders and helping clients drive measurable results on their journey to become digital

West Monroe, one of the fastest-growing digital consulting firms, today announced the promotion of 13 individuals to managing director. Additionally, the firm continues to adapt its management structure as it grows, announcing a new firmwide office leader and three new office leaders in Los Angeles, Minneapolis, and Seattle.

“Today’s announcement truly exemplifies our mission to build the next generation of leaders who will continue to help us evolve and grow as a firm. As our talented people assume new responsibilities, opportunities for yet another generation of leaders emerge,” said Susan Stelter, West Monroe’s chief people officer. “The sheer number of promotions and appointments this year is a direct reflection of the robust growth we’ve experienced. This wouldn’t be possible without the investment we make in our people by creating a fulfilling workplace where employees have the support and opportunities to grow as leaders. I congratulate this talented group for reaching this well-deserved recognition.”

West Monroe promoted the following individuals to managing director:

  • Jeremy Bruck, as part of the M&A practice, advises financial and strategic buyers and portfolio companies across the deal life cycle to create value with a focus on leveraging analytics to drive growth and margin expansion. He joined West Monroe in 2016.
  • Calvin Cheng, as a part of the Product & Experience Lab, delivers customer-centric strategies and digital solutions to improve clients’ customer experience, operational efficiency, and financial performance. He joined West Monroe in 2018.
  • Cameron Cross, as a part of the Technology practice, helps clients become data-driven organizations with analytics advisory, products, and implementation. He joined West Monroe in 2011.
  • Eric Freshour, as part of the Operations Excellence practice, leads the firmwide Organizational Change Management team, advising clients on change management, organizational alignment, and value realization strategies, while navigating times of transition. He joined West Monroe in 2010.
  • Jon Magin, as a part of the M&A practice, leads the Seattle M&A team and partners with private equity clients leading due diligence transactions and post-close value creation work. He joined West Monroe in 2007.
  • Elisabeth Moore, as part of the internal Strategic Growth team, leads the firm’s Strategy function guiding West Monroe’s organic and inorganic growth. She joined West Monroe in 2013.
  • Brian Pacula, as part of the Operations Excellence practice, helps clients problem-solve operational, technology, and logistics issues across the supply chain. He joined West Monroe in 2007.

  • Mike Patelski, as part of the Energy & Utilities practice, works with utilities on complex modernization initiatives to deliver operational efficiency and performance benefits. He joined West Monroe in 2010.

  • Christina Powers, as part of the Technology practice, partners with private equity firms and their portfolio companies to understand and mitigate cybersecurity risks through the firm’s Cybersecurity Advisory for Private Equity (CAPE) program, which she leads. She joined West Monroe in 2013.

  • Deric Selchow, as part of the Operations Excellence practice, leads teams focused on financial transformation and created West Monroe’s corporate financial management center of excellence. He joined West Monroe in 2013.

  • Amy Sparling, as part of the internal Shared Services team, leads the firm’s Talent Acquisition function. She partners with business leaders to bring the best, brightest, and most diverse talent to the firm. She joined West Monroe in 2012.

  • Hubert Selvanathan, as part of the High-Tech & Software practice, works with companies in the industry to grow their top-line revenue through organic initiatives and acquisition strategies. He joined West Monroe in 2019.

  • Rich Snipes, as part of the Technology practice, provides technology expertise to clients undergoing a merger or acquisition. He advises throughout the entire deal lifecycle from development of investment thesis to post-close integration. He joined West Monroe in 2018.

All promotions and appointments were effective March 1, 2022.

In addition to these promotions, West Monroe is excited to announce the elevation of individuals into new office leadership roles. First, Brian Paulen will be stepping into a new position, Managing Partner, Firmwide Office Leadership, where he will work with all the geography leaders across the firm. In this new role, Brian will work with office leaders to drive consistency, efficiency, and best practices as the firm scales for growth. The firm also named the following individuals as new office leaders in 2022:

  • Jerin May, Senior Partner, will lead the Seattle office.

  • Tom Racciatti, Partner, will lead the Minneapolis office.

  • Jordan Sternlieb, Senior Partner, will lead the Los Angeles office.

Other West Monroe offices will continue with their existing leadership.

About West Monroe
West Monroe is a digital consulting firm that was born in technology but built for business—partnering with companies in transformative industries to deliver quantifiable financial value. We believe that digital is a mindset—not a project, a team, or a destination—and it’s something companies become, not something they do. That’s why we work in diverse, multidisciplinary teams that blend industry expertise with deep operational and technology capabilities—moving clients from traditional to digital operating models and creating products and experiences that transcend the digital and physical worlds. Our 2,000 employees have the opportunity to own a stake in the company, so when you partner with us you know we are committed—because your success is our success. Our undeniably different approach breeds undeniable results. Visit WestMonroe.com to learn more.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
MARCH 1, 2023—Group reflects firm’s mission to build the next generation of leaders 

West Monroe, one of the fastest-growing digital services firms, today announced the promotion of 16 individuals to managing director. 

“I am incredibly proud of these 16 talented individuals who represent the next generation of leaders at West Monroe,” said Kevin McCarty, Chairman & CEO.

Their leadership and growth have made a significant impact on their clients, their teams, and this firm. We are excited to honor their contributions and congratulate them on reaching this well-deserved milestone.

West Monroe promoted the following individuals to managing director:

  • Shehzad Amin, as part of the operations excellence practice, drives large-scale IT transformations for major health systems and Fortune 500 companies, resulting in over $1 billion in savings and operational improvements. He has a strong track record driving strategy all the way to execution. He joined West Monroe in 2020 through the acquisition of Pace Harmon.

  • Sam Arora, as part of the operations excellence practice, helps clients negotiate large-ticket outsourcing contracts, leveraging his relationships with top-tier suppliers, to execute over $2 billion in favorable outsourcing contracts across Fortune 100 companies. He joined West Monroe in 2020 through the acquisition of Pace Harmon. 

  • David Chaddock, as part of the technology practice, partners with clients to define cybersecurity strategies, launch new initiatives, and reduce their overall risk. He is passionate about IT/OT cybersecurity, working with clients to protect critical infrastructure and sensitive data while establishing adherence to industry standards and regulatory obligations. He joined West Monroe in 2018. 

  • Tim Crickenberger, as part of the M&A practice, specializes in mergers and carveouts across the transaction lifecycle, executing cross-functional business transformation initiatives that focus on value capture. He has advised clients on over 150 transactions, including due diligence and post-close execution for both financial and strategic buyers. He joined West Monroe in 2018.

  • Sanket Dave, as part of the technology practice, works with clients as a strategic business advisor and technology expert, helping them design, develop, and implement cloud-based data & analytics solutions. He is a recognized data & analytics expert, leading multiple large-scale strategic initiatives that leverage data to create business impact. He joined West Monroe in 2016.

  • Katie Fitzgerald, as part of the operations excellence practice, works closely with senior executives to develop fit-for-culture strategies to help organizations manage their transformation. Her focus on leadership and relationship building helps clients identify and realize value. She joined West Monroe in 2019.

  • Trevor Jones, as part of the healthcare & life sciences practice, delivers innovative solutions to address the market’s biggest healthcare challenges. He helped lead and grow the dental & ancillary group and maintains a passion for creating new offerings for clients and the firm. He joined West Monroe in 2015.

  • Kate Kiyosaki, as part of the healthcare & life sciences practice, delivers transformational results for the front office of health plans—specifically product, marketing governance, consumer experience, and digital transformation. She leads the firm’s largest payer clients, helping them be digital and saving millions annually. She joined West Monroe in 2013. 

  • Connor Kohlenberg, as part of the M&A practice, partners with private equity clients on complex global transactions and portfolio company value creation initiatives across various industries. He leads the M&A team out of our London office and played an integral role in its opening. He joined West Monroe in 2014.  

  • Dan Mackowiak, as part of the technology practice, leads clients through technology-related activities in divestitures and merger integrations. He is a mentor to many colleagues, helping them understand how projects can benefit their career goals and the client's objectives. He joined West Monroe in 2005.

  • Dan McGuire, as part of the human capital management practice, aligns people and business strategy to create value for clients. Having lived and worked in many countries, he translates complexities into understandable stories, supporting all organizational, people, and cultural aspects of global transformations, including mergers and acquisitions. He joined West Monroe in 2019.

  • Sean McHale, as part of the technology practice, leverages his 25 years of experience to help private equity clients understand and mitigate technology risks in M&A transactions. His involvement spans the entire deal lifecycle, from investment thesis development through post-close integration. He joined West Monroe in 2018.

  • Chris Miller, as part of the product experience & engineering lab, partners with clients to understand their challenges and guides the creation of digital solutions to those challenges. He focuses on helping electric utilities capture digital opportunities presented by the clean energy transition. He joined West Monroe in 2011.  

  • Dani Newman-Biczak, leads West Monroe’s internal people, strategy & experience team, focusing on building a differentiated employee experience. She is also responsible for our corporate social responsibility program and internal communications. She joined West Monroe in 2016. 

  • Roger Taylor, as part of the financial services practice, leads strategy, operational improvement, digital, and technology projects for financial institutions. His exposure across a bank’s sales, operations, and service for consumer, commercial, and private bank groups, provides him with the unique ability to deliver enterprise-wide solutions. He joined West Monroe in 2015.

  • Foster Tidwell, as part of the M&A practice, works with private equity sponsors and their portfolio companies to evaluate investments and implement value-creation strategies. He has advised on over 300 carve-out diligence, day-one readiness, and post-close separation transactions. He joined West Monroe in 2011.

All promotions are effective March 1, 2023.

About West Monroe
West Monroe is a digital services firm that was born in technology but built for business—partnering with companies in transformative industries to deliver quantifiable financial value. We believe that digital is a mindset—not a project, a team, or a destination—and it’s something companies become, not something they do. That’s why we work in diverse, multidisciplinary teams that blend management consulting, digital design, and product engineering to move companies from traditional ways of working to digital operating models—and create experiences that transcend the digital and physical worlds.
