title: West Monroe Teams with CharterMast Partners and Ativo Research on Sustainability
name: West Monroe Teams with CharterMast Partners and Ativo Research on Sustainability

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Teams with CharterMast Partners and Ativo Research on Sustainability

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Teams with CharterMast Partners and Ativo Research on Sustainability

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service business and technology consulting firm, today announced that it has entered into an alliance with CharterMast Partners, LLC, and Ativo Research LLC, affiliate companies that provide tools and insight for assessing the impact of management decisions on enterprise value.

“Our clients face increasing scrutiny from boards, regulators, and consumers about their commitment to sustainability and the initiatives they put in place. We have seen growing interest in the ability to measure the impact of their efforts,” said Dean Fischer, West Monroe Partners’ president and CEO. “Our strategic sustainability value framework is a way to help organizations embed sustainability more effectively and guide development of initiatives that are best aligned with corporate and investor goals.”

The sustainability value framework leverages a one-of-a-kind modeling process which combines cost of capital (COC) calculations with more than 120 sustainability factors from 2,800 firms to determine what sustainability behavior, practices, policies and risks have material value impacts.

“Traditionally, companies have struggled to assign a value to sustainability initiatives and demonstrate the financial impact to the organization,” said Dennis Aust, managing director of Charter Mast Partners. “Through this offering, we can help them build a direct link between sustainability and financial results and take the right steps to creating enterprise value.”

“By working with West Monroe Partners, we are able to package a one of a kind financial modeling process with on-the-ground business and industry experience to offer a practical and value-based approach to sustainability,” said Daniel Allen, director of sustainability initiatives for Ativo Research.

About CharterMast

CharterMast Partners, LLC provides public and privately held companies the insights and tools to link specific management decisions and actions to share prices, to understand exactly how reported corporate performance does and does not reflect real economic performance, and how real economic performance increases the total value of the enterprise.  CharterMast’s key expertise is in understanding what drives your company's enterprise value, identifying what is needed to change it, and putting in place the strategies and operating plans/processes to make it happen.  For more information, visit www.chartermast.com

About Ativo Research

CharterMast is the consulting affiliate of Ativo Research LLC,  one of the industry pioneers in the practical application of quantitative finance theory (Chicago School) to real-world analysis of securities.  With a pedigree that dates from 1971, Ativo today covers the world with research recommendations on almost 17,000 securities, or 98% of global investable capital. The Ativo group of companies is currently developing Q-ESG™, a proprietary quantitative methodology for the integration of environmental, social and governance (ESG) risk management factors into financial research and the investment process.  For more information, visit www.ativoresearch.com

title: West Monroe Tops â€œBest Places to Work in Los Angelesâ€ List by Los Angeles Business Journal in the Large Company Category
name: West Monroe Tops â€œBest Places to Work in Los Angelesâ€ List by Los Angeles Business Journal in the Large Company Category

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Tops â€œBest Places to Work in Los Angelesâ€ List by Los Angeles Business Journal in the Large Company Category

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Tops â€œBest Places to Work in Los Angelesâ€ List by Los Angeles Business Journal in the Large Company Category
global_field.meta_description: Fast-growing consultancy wins top honors in first year of participation

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that it earned first place in the Large Company category in the “Best Places to Work in Los Angeles” awards, produced by the Los Angeles Business Journal. 

This survey and awards program was designed to identify, recognize and honor the 100 best employers in Los Angeles, benefiting the county's economy, workforce and businesses. This was the first year the West Monroe Los Angeles office eligible to participate, based on local headcount criteria. Companies are categorized based on U.S. headcount for the purposes of the awards.

“Receiving the top honor in our category is a remarkable achievement the first year out, and validates the significant investment we have made to build an outstanding team and develop the next generation of leaders in this market,” said Ken Siegman, senior director and head of the Los Angeles office. “Our focus on our “people first” culture and growth opportunities for all our employee-owners differentiates us from other consulting firms and helps us retain our top talent.”

West Monroe’s Los Angeles office has more than 25 employees and serves more than 15 clients across Los Angeles region in key industries, including banking, energy and utilities, healthcare and private equity. The office’s headcount has grown by 42% since the first of the year in response to strong growth projections and momentum in the local market.

Like all West Monroe Partners offices, the Los Angeles practice maintains a highly participatory and collaborative culture marked by an open work environment; frequent employee meetings and gatherings, including an annual strategic planning retreat; a strong commitment to serving the local community through its 1+1+1 social responsibility program; and regular recognition awards. The company has rigorously maintained this culture as it has grown to 11 offices across North America and a team of more than 850 consultants—in part by remaining 100-percent employee owned. Its innovative human resources practices enable people at all levels contribute to the company’s direction, and through its December 2012 conversion to an employee stock ownership plan (ESOP), to share in its results.

Nationally, West Monroe has been listed as a top company to work for by Consulting Magazine and Vault Inc., and has been named by Great Place to Work® Institute and FORTUNE as one of the best workplaces in the United States on its Best Small & Medium Workplaces list 2013-2016, as well as a top workplace for millennials in 2015 and a top workplace for giving back in 2016.

The publication celebrated all 2016 honorees at an event at the J.W. Marriott on August 16.

title: West Monroe Unveils New Version of FLEXdlsâ„¢ Labor Management Software
name: West Monroe Unveils New Version of FLEXdlsâ„¢ Labor Management Software

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Unveils New Version of FLEXdlsâ„¢ Labor Management Software

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Unveils New Version of FLEXdlsâ„¢ Labor Management Software
global_field.meta_description: New FLEXdlsâ„¢ delivery module expands labor management capabilities beyond the distribution center

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consultancy, today announced the release of the next generation of FLEXdls™, a proprietary labor management system designed to manage performance within any distribution environment. The newly upgraded FLEXdls™ includes additional functionality to support delivery operations.

The new delivery module is equipped to handle virtually unlimited sources of external data and can be easily configured according to specific client needs to enable better evaluation of distribution and delivery operations.  Customers that implement FLEXdls™ for delivery can expect to realize the following benefits:

  • Improved delivery window performance
  • Enhanced fleet utilization
  • Increased driver productivity and utilization
  • Reduced overall delivery cost
  • Decreased carbon emissions and enhanced energy efficiency
  • Better planning capabilities and reduced idle time

“As transportation costs continue to rise, companies are looking for ways to offset increased costs and ideally reduce their cost while becoming more efficient and improving customer service,” says Josh Sandstrom, director in West Monroe’s workforce optimization practice.  “FLEXdls™ provides a platform to help companies realize this goal quickly while providing the flexibility needed to sustain the improvements over time.”

FLEXdls™ is a labor management software solution developed by West Monroe Partners to help companies manage engineered labor standards.

The West Monroe Partners team has more than 25 years of experience implementing workforce optimization solutions with over 500 implementations completed across the globe.

About West Monroe Partners

West Monroe Partners is a North American business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 350 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada. For more information, visit our website at www.westmonroe.com.

title: West Monroe Welcomes Business Integration Partners to Global Consulting Network
name: West Monroe Welcomes Business Integration Partners to Global Consulting Network

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroe Welcomes Business Integration Partners to Global Consulting Network

global_field.meta_title: West Monroe Welcomes Business Integration Partners to Global Consulting Network
global_field.meta_description: The agreement will expand the two firmsâ€™ global market coverage and enhance their ability to serve international clients.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners today announced a strategic consulting agreement with Business Integration Partners (“Bip”), a business and technology consulting firm with offices in Europe, Latin America, and North Africa.

In March 2010, West Monroe Partners announced a strategic consulting alliance with BearingPoint to expand their global market coverage and better provide services to their international clients. Both firms offer business consulting services that address their clients’ most important and broader business issues. While BearingPoint has European roots, West Monroe Partners is active in the North American management consulting market. Bip joined BearingPoint’s network in in May 2010.

Headquartered in Milan and Rome, Bip has over 600 consulting professionals who work from offices in Milan, Italy; Madrid, Spain; Tunis, Tunisia; Sao Paulo, Brazil; and Buenos Aires, Argentina. Like West Monroe Partners and BearingPoint, Bip has strong industry capabilities and credentials, particularly in the energy and utilities, telecommunications and media, manufacturing, financial services, life sciences, and public sectors.

West Monroe Partners, BearingPoint and Bip will continue to focus on their respective local markets, while collaborating on projects that require worldwide reach. Under the terms of the agreement, the three firms will refer business opportunities; collaborate on client work in Europe, North America, South America, and beyond; and share intellectual capital.

“West Monroe Partners’ 300 percent growth rate over the past five years is evidence of our strong foundation, but being able to address our clients’ global needs is essential to our continued strength. I am very enthusiastic about this latest step in the expansion of our global network,” said Dean Fischer, West Monroe Partners’ chairman and CEO. “Our firms share values, culture, and scopes of practice—elements that are essential to a successful international alliance.”

“Most of our respective clients have international operations, and their business interests are continuing to expand into new or emerging economies,” said Peter Mockler, BearingPoint’s managing partner. “By adding Bip to the global network, we are enabling all three organizations to deliver better and more relevant services to international clients.”

One initial goal for the alliance is to build a more significant presence in Latin America.

“During four years of directed expansion, Bip has established a strong reputation in the markets we serve, including some of the world’s fastest growing business sectors,” said Bip President Nino Lo Bianco. “We look forward to working with BearingPoint and West Monroe Partners to support their clients in achieving their business goals. At the same time, we look forward to accelerating our own expansion through this network.”

About West Monroe Partners

West Monroe Partners is a North American full-service management consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Their consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada. For more information, please visit: www.westmonroe.com

About BearingPoint

BearingPoint delivers business consulting with management and technology capabilities. As an independent firm with European roots and global reach, BearingPoint serves leading companies and public sector organizations world-wide to align and optimize processes, IT and operating models with business strategy. Driven by a strong entrepreneurial mindset and desire to create long-term partnerships, BearingPoint’s consultants are committed to delivering excellence and value to their clients. The firm’s approach to working with clients is highly collaborative and designed to improve business performance, from strategy through to execution. BearingPoint currently employs 3,200 people in 15 countries. For more information, please visit: BearingPoint Consulting. 

About Business Integration Partners

Bip is a management consulting company specializing in Business Integration and Innovation. At present, the biggest Italian consulting reality, meanwhile recognized as true alternative to traditional consulting. The differentiating factors, which make Bip a preferred service provider, are:

  • Authority and proven competency in core industries 
  • A strong focus on execution and attainment of measurable benefits
  • Absence of conflict of interest with audit activities or software development

It is the profound knowledge of strategic context and operations that turn Bip professionals into factual industry specialists, with in-depth expertise in critical subject matters. Further to its industry thought leadership, Bip offers two distinct competencies in training and innovation, through its specialized business units Bip. Institute and Ars et Inventio. Today Bip is acknowledged by clients as a competent and even more importantly, hands-on consulting service provider, able to transform ideas immediately into visible and tangible results. For more information please visit www.businessintegrationpartners.com

title: West Monroe Welcomes Grupo ASSA to Global Consulting Network

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners today announced a strategic consulting agreement with Grupo ASSA, a Latin American consulting and managed services firm that helps its clients transform their organizations. Headquartered in Sao Paulo, Brazil, Grupo ASSA has nearly 1500 consultants in 10 offices across Latin America, including Brazil, Argentina, Mexico, Chile and Colombia. Like West Monroe Partners, their team focuses on “Full Transformation Lifecycle Management.” Programs led by Grupo ASSA start with digital transformation and have a growing reputation as a key player in this space.

Grupo ASSA now joins BearingPoint and West Monroe Partners’ global network which promotes joint client service, referrals and the ability to share intellectual property and assets. In March 2010, West Monroe Partners announced a strategic consulting alliance with BearingPoint to expand their global market coverage and better provide services to their international clients. Like West Monroe Partners and BearingPoint, Grupo ASSA was founded by a group of consultants with an entrepreneurial spirit and a deep desire to help organizations transform the way they do business. This strengthens the global network’s common goals and is a show of solidarity to the market of a strong presence across the globe.

“As we work more and more with global organizations, having an expanded group of network partners and access to knowledge and resources in new markets allows us to deliver on our promise to serve our global clients, locally,” said Gil Mermelstein, Managing Director of the Strategic Alliance. “It also opens new doors for us to serve clients based in Latin America with consulting needs in North America, specifically in key industries such as Retail, Manufacturing and Life Sciences.”
 
“We look forward to working with West Monroe Partners to support clients in achieving their global business goals,” said Claudio Della Penna, Chief Operating Office of Grupo ASSA.  “Our complimentary cultures and business philosophies create a winning recipe for a successful alliance relationship. We foresee a bright future ahead with West Monroe Partners.

West Monroe Partners and Grupo ASSA will continue to focus on their respective local markets, while collaborating on projects that require worldwide reach. Under the terms of the agreement, the two firms will refer business opportunities; collaborate on client work in North America, Latin America, and beyond.

About Grupo ASSA

Founded in 1992, gA is the leading independent Latin American Digital Business Transformation firm. We partner with leading global companies to meet their business aspirations. gA helps its clients deal with increasing challenges and complexities brought about by the digital economy, with its “Full Transformation Lifecycle Approach” and has recently been recognized in May 2014 as a leader in Digital Business Transformation by Gartner.

title: West Monroe wins Microsoft Northwest Area Best Practice Award

richtext.rich_text_editor:
Microsoft's Best Practice award is given to the firm that best identifies new ways to improve profitability, deepen partnerships and streamline operations for its clients.

West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology consulting firm, today announced that it has received Microsoft’s Best Practice Award for the Northwest District. This award recognizes exceptional partner expertise or competency in a specific industry, vertical, solution or segment.

Jane Dickson, General Manager-West Region Managed Partners, states, “We value our relationship with a firm like West Monroe Partners. Their deep industry expertise and holistic approach to consulting is what makes them a great partner. They are very deserving of the ‘Best Practice Award’ as they are truly interested in transformational change at their clients by addressing People, Process and Technology. This allows them to help their clients get the maximum value out of an investment in Microsoft technologies by going beyond just being product experts.”

West Monroe Partners was recognized specifically for the solutions it provided to a $1 Billion mid-market bank that was struggling to meet audit and regulatory exam requirements within the technology department. Focused on People, Process, and Technology, West Monroe Partners developed an 18 month roadmap and assisted in execution to get them to acceptable levels. After implementing a number of the initiatives on the roadmap, the outcome and benefits for the bank have been profound.

Jerin May, Technology Services Practice Lead for the West Coast, states, “This is great to be recognized amongst peers and competitors, but more importantly this gives us great recognition as a firm that helps businesses realize their full potential.”

title: West Monroeâ€™s Brian Paulen Named to Board of The First Tee of Greater Seattle
name: West Monroeâ€™s Brian Paulen Named to Board of The First Tee of Greater Seattle

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroeâ€™s Brian Paulen Named to Board of The First Tee of Greater Seattle

global_field.meta_title: West Monroeâ€™s Brian Paulen Named to Board of The First Tee of Greater Seattle

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that Brian Paulen, a director in the firm’s Seattle office, has been named to the Board of Directors of The First Tee of Greater Seattle.

The First Tee is an internationally respected organization that impacts the lives of young people by providing educational programs that build character, instill life-enhancing values and promote healthy choices through the game of golf. 

“It is an honor to be able to serve in this capacity for an organization that has had a tremendous impact on such a large base of youth in our community,” said Paulen. “I am excited to have this opportunity to extend West Monroe Partners’ involvement in the Puget Sound community—and I’m particularly eager to work with our board, our directors, and others on events surrounding next year’s US Open in Seattle.”

The First Tee of Greater Seattle and The First Tee of South Puget Sound are joining forces to host the Fore the Future Gala on June 20, 2015, in conjunction with the 2015 US Open. All funds raised will help promote The First Tee’s character education programs. The First Tee serves more than 80,000 youth in King and Pierce County. The chapters are organizing a round of golf at Chambers Bay, site of the 2015 US Open, on June 17, 2014, to share and promote sponsorship opportunities for the 2015 gala.

Paulen joined West Monroe Partners with its acquisition of Madrona Solutions Group, a Seattle-based consultancy he co-founded in July 2005 that helped mid-market and enterprise-sized clients build customer relationship management solutions on the Dynamics CRM and Salesforce.com platforms. 

West Monroe Partners announced an ambitious social and environmental responsibility commitment in early 2011. Following on the leadership efforts of its clients and business partners, West Monroe strives to contribute one percent of its talent in pro-bono work, one percent of its profits in donations to qualifying organizations, and one percent of its collective personnel time to community engagement and leadership activities.

title: West Monroeâ€™s Cindy Garrett Named One of Consulting Magazine's â€œWomen Leaders in Consultingâ€
name: West Monroeâ€™s Cindy Garrett Named One of Consulting Magazine's â€œWomen Leaders in Consultingâ€

global_field.meta_description: Director Recognized in Women Leaders in Consulting â€œClient Serviceâ€ Category

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that Cindy Garrett, director in the firm’s Customer Experience practice, has been named one of 13 “Women Leaders in Consulting” by Consulting magazine. Garrett is recognized in the Client Service category. 

Since joining West Monroe Partners in 2012, Cindy developed the organization’s High Performance Contact Center solution. With deep contact center experience, she helps clients transform their contact center operations from cost centers to value centers . Her ability to be a successful partner to her clients is a direct result of how well she works with her partners at the firm to bring the best thought leadership and skillsets to bear for her client’s as their advocate.

“As consultants, we are first and foremost experts in our crafts, it’s our expertise and our thinking that adds value for our clients,” said Mazen Ghalayini, leader of the Chicago office’s Customer Experience practice. “You will be hard pressed to find someone that is a deeper contact center operations and Customer Experience enablement expert than Cindy. But her depth of expertise is only the beginning of the value Cindy regularly brings to her clients.” 

Cindy has also been praised as bringing a level of humility to her style that makes her approachable by the most junior consultants and makes her respected in front of the most senior and tough client executives.  She excels at listening and applies feedback well to adjust her style as needed to relate to her audience and continuously up her game while increasing her success.

“I am incredibly honored to receive this prestigious award and to have the support of West Monroe to nominate me,” said Garrett. “Since I joined the firm, I have enjoyed the blend of client delivery, building the High Performance Contact Center practice, developing and mentoring high performing teams, and developing strong relationships with the clients I partner with every day. I am honored to be recognized along with the other women that have demonstrated that women can have a very successful and rewarding consulting career.”

Cindy was honored with a Client Service Award on Nov. 17 at Consulting magazine’s 10th annual Women Leaders in Consulting Gala Awards Dinner at The St. Regis New York.  Consulting magazine is set to profile Garrett and the other “Women Leaders in Consulting” in its December 2016 issue.

title: West Monroeâ€™s Gordana Radmilovic Named One of Consulting Magazine's â€œWomen Leaders in Consultingâ€

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that Gordana Radmilovic, manager in the firm’s Advanced Analytics practice has been named one of 12 “Women Leaders in Consulting” by Consulting magazine. Radmilovic is recognized in the Future Leader category.

Since joining West Monroe Partners in 2011, Radmilovic has established herself as a rising leader—recognized for energy, passion, and exceptional skills in both client service and the workplace. In addition to creating intellectual capital and developing and mentoring others, she has assumed critical project leadership responsibilities for several high-profile transformational programs. In her breakout role as leader, she has led a multi-million dollar, transformative project for a global insurance broker focused on enhancing the organization’s advanced analytics capabilities.

“I am incredibly honored to receive this prestigious Women Leaders in Consulting award. I am also very excited about what the future holds for women in consulting and business – we are reaching a tipping point where female leaders and organizations can influence social dilemmas, and it is this enhanced reach which will help us be the change we want to see in the world,” said Radmilovic.  

Gordana conveys her passion for positive corporate culture and was recently published in Fast Company. Additionally, she is paving the way to advance the firm’s transformation center of excellence by enhancing the firm’s current methodology with new schools of thought and by instituting a streamlined way to leverage all that West Monroe has to offer. In the community, Gordana serves on the Chicago Advisory Board of the Spark Organization and participates extensively on West Monroe’s Women’s Committee. She will co-lead the firm’s Charity Committee in 2015.

“Gordana’s consistent display of ethics and integrity are vital to her success as a great leader and mentor,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe Partners’ CEO. “Her ability to make the right decisions not only has paved the way for her career, but also has enabled her to serve as a model for those who look up to her.” 

Consulting magazine profiles Radmilovic and the other 12 “Women Leaders in Consulting” in its December 2014 issue. She will be recognized on November 6th at a celebratory dinner and gala at the St. Regis Hotel in New York.

title: West Monroeâ€™s Holly Kay Named a Finalist for 2017 Chicago CFO of the Year
name: West Monroeâ€™s Holly Kay Named a Finalist for 2017 Chicago CFO of the Year

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroeâ€™s Holly Kay Named a Finalist for 2017 Chicago CFO of the Year

global_field.meta_title: West Monroeâ€™s Holly Kay Named a Finalist for 2017 Chicago CFO of the Year
global_field.meta_description: FEI Chicago Chapter recognizes consulting executive for 10+years of leadership in guiding Chicago-based firm to double-digit annual growth

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a progressive business and technology consultancy, today announced that Chief Financial Officer Holly Kay has been named a finalist for a 2017 Chicago CFO of the Year® award by the Financial Executives International (FEI) Chicago Chapter. Ms. Kay was a finalist in the mid-size private category. The FEI Chicago Chapter recognized Ms. Kay, along with 16 other finalists and five award recipients, for their exceptional performance and roles as corporate stewards at the 7th Annual Chicago CFO of the Year® Awards reception and dinner on November 1, 2017.

Ms. Kay joined West Monroe as chief financial officer and member of the firm’s executive team in 2006. In the 10 years since, the organization has achieved a 26 percent compound annual growth rate and has maintained profitability even during recessionary years.

In addition to serving as the firm’s CFO and leading its finance and accounting functions, Ms. Kay is responsible for integrating and supporting the company’s 10 offices across the United States and assisting office leaders in driving future growth. She also leads several additional shared services functions, including quality assurance, internal technology, and real estate and facilities. She guided the organization through its sale to an employee stock ownership plan (ESOP) on December 31, 2012. The firm’s share price has increased over 500% percent since the ESOP’s inception.

“It is exciting and gratifying to see Holly Kay recognized for her hard work and leadership in making this hometown success story happen,” said Kevin McCarty, West Monroe’s president and CEO and one of four people who co-founded the firm in Chicago in 2002. “Her ability to create and run high-performing finance, accounting, and shared-services teams has played a key role in our growth success. But numbers aside, she has contributed even more to our organization as a role model and mentor to our people as we strive to build the next generation of leaders.”  

Prior to joining West Monroe Partners, Ms. Kay served in roles at American Capital Strategies and KPMG Transaction Services, where she was a consultant to financial investors focused on the mid-sized manufacturing, mining, and professional services sectors. She began her career at Arthur Andersen in Milwaukee. Ms. Kay is a graduate of the University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee.

The wealth of corporate headquarters across the Chicago area has created a dynamic and accomplished community of financial executives. It is a privilege just to be a part of this community – to be recognized as one of its leaders is truly an honor,” said Ms. Kay. “This community of financial executives has been instrumental in my growth as a professional and my ability to provide sound financial leadership for West Monroe. I hope I am able to pay back at least as much as I have gained by helping to develop future finance leaders.

The FEI Chicago Chapter annually recognizes outstanding chief financial officers in several business categories. In 2017, the organization named 22 finalists in five categories: large public, large private, mid-size private, large not-for-profit, and mid-size not-for-profit.

Candidates must be CFOs or equivalent in their organization, with a minimum tenure of two years in the role as of March 7, 2017. Additionally, the candidate’s organization must be based in the Chicagoland metropolitan area, in the counties of Cook, DuPage, Kane, Kendall, Lake (IL), McHenry, or Will. All nominations must be validated and endorsed by the candidate and the candidate’s chief executive officer.

The FEI Chicago Chapter establishes a selection panel of judges to determine the award finalists and recipients. The 2017 judges included Michele Hooper, (non-voting chair) president and CEO, The Directors’ Council; William Cernugel, retired CFO, Alberto Culver; John Edwardson, retired chairman of the board of directors, CDW; Beverly R. Walther, chair of the Department of Accounting Information & Management and professor of Accounting Information & Management, Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University.

Our team of more than 925 professionals is comprised of an uncommon blend of business consultants and deep technologists. This unique combination of expertise enables us to design, develop, implement, and run strategic business and technology solutions that yield a dramatic commercial impact on our clients’ profitability and performance. For more information, visit www.westmonroe.com.

global_field.meta_description: Director in Energy & Utilities Practice Recognized in Client Service Category.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
November 9, 2018

CHICAGO– West Monroe Partners announced that Jodi Bednar, director in the firm’s Energy & Utilities practice, has been named one of 13 “Women Leaders in Consulting” by Consulting magazine. Bednar is recognized in the client service category.

Since joining West Monroe four years ago, Jodi has helped several utility clients pursue their smart-grid and modernization visions—from strategy development through execution and operational management. Jodi’s core value is her customer-focused delivery approach. She brings a passion and genuine care every day for her clients and their best interests. 

“Jodi’s ability to listen, adjust, and navigate complex environments to meet client expectations is second to none,” said Tom Hulsebosch, senior managing director and leader of the firm’s Energy & Utilities practice. “She continually demonstrates her commitment to clients by understanding their needs and works to ensure quality results.”

Jodi is a recognized leader both inside and outside West Monroe. She is a board member for the Chicago Chapter of Women in Energy, leading their mentorship programs, and at West Monroe leads the Women’s Mentoring Circle, which helps female leaders navigate their careers. She serves on the firm’s Inclusion & Diversity council and supports its employee resource groups (ERG). She is also a 2015 recipient of West Monroe’s Sequoia Award for leadership and mentoring within the firm.

“I am humbled to be recognized by Consulting Magazine as a woman leader in client service,” Bednar said. “Great client service is about the team and not an individual, and we put a lot of energy and effort into delivering outstanding service to our clients. This recognition validates that we are focusing on the right things to be effective leaders in our industry.”

Jodi was honored with a Client Service Award on Nov. 8 at Consulting magazine’s 10th annual Women Leaders in Consulting Gala Awards Dinner at the Lotte New York Palace in New York City. Consulting magazine will profile Bednar and the other “Women Leaders in Consulting” in its December 2018 issue.

Our team of more than 1,000 professionals across nine offices is comprised of an uncommon blend of business consultants and deep technologists. This unique combination of expertise enables us to design, develop, implement, and run strategic business and technology solutions that yield a dramatic commercial impact on our clients’ profitability and performance. For more information, visit www.wmp.com.

title: West Monroeâ€™s Keith Campbell Named One of Consulting Magazineâ€™s 2014 â€œRising Stars of the Professionâ€

global_field.meta_description: Senior Manager Recognized for Outstanding Work in Client Service Category

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that Keith Campbell, senior manager in the firm’s Mergers & Acquisitions practice and one of the leaders of its carve-out service offering, has been named one of 35 “Rising Stars of the Profession” by Consulting magazine. Campbell is recognized in the Client Service category in this inaugural ranking of top consultants under the age of 35.

Since joining West Monroe Partners in 2007, Campbell has developed specialized skills in complex mergers, acquisitions, and corporate divestitures. He has led delivery of more than 30 IT and operational due diligence and carve-out planning projects for leading private equity firms, primarily involving companies in the industrial distribution, healthcare, and oil and gas sectors. He also has led successful completion of large IT carve-out, post-merger integration, and business transformation projects and has played a central role in establishing West Monroe’s carve-out practice and capabilities. 

“It is a tremendous honor to receive a Rising Stars award for Client Service,” said Campbell. “This validates the years of work and dedication that have gone into bringing distinguished merger and acquisition and carve-out solutions to the market. I’ve had the incredible opportunity to be part of building carve-out services that are now core to West Monroe Partners’ overall growth strategy.”

Campbell is an advisor to private equity clients and their targets, helping them identify risks and separation costs, develop transition services agreements, and prepare for and achieve successful separation and independent operations. He authors a blog series on corporate divestitures and has been published in ACG’s Middle Market Growth on best practices for delivering value in complex corporate carve-out transactions. 

“It is no surprise that Keith has been recognized in the Client Service category – his commitment and passion for superior client delivery is what truly sets him apart. This recognition speaks volumes to the effort he has put into building his personal brand since joining West Monroe more than six years ago,” said Kevin McCarty, President of West Monroe Partners. 

Campbell earned a Bachelor of Science degree in Industrial Engineering from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign. He holds certifications in Microsoft Dynamics Trade & Logistics (MCP) and IT Infrastructure Library (ITIL).

Consulting magazine profiles Campbell and the other 34 “Rising Stars of the Profession” in its March 2014 issue. He will receive his award at an April 24 awards dinner in Chicago.

About West Monroe Partners

West Monroe Partners is a North American, business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe Partners is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 400 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada. For more information, visit our website at www.westmonroe.com

West Monroe Partners, a management and technology consulting firm, announced today that Consulting magazine has named Kevin McCarty, West Monroe’s co-founder and president, one of its Top 25 Consultants for 2013. “I consider this honor a true reflection of West Monroe’s collective of driven, talented people,” said McCarty. “I’m happy to say that ten years after forming our firm, we are still committed to ‘doing the work we love with the people we trust.’ It’s that mentality that I believe will sustain and grow our success personally and professionally for years to come.”

title: West Monroeâ€™s Managed Services practice receives clean, unqualified SSAE16 audit opinion
name: West Monroeâ€™s Managed Services practice receives clean, unqualified SSAE16 audit opinion

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroeâ€™s Managed Services practice receives clean, unqualified SSAE16 audit opinion

global_field.meta_title: West Monroeâ€™s Managed Services practice receives clean, unqualified SSAE16 audit opinion

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that its Managed Services practice sought an independent audit under SSAE16 (Statement on Standards for Attestation Engagements No. 16, Reporting on Controls at a Service Organization) and received a clean, unqualified opinion by its audit firm. The result reflects adherence to stated policies and procedures. The Performance Services practice provides managed services for clients’ core infrastructure, systems, and applications.

BDO, the firm’s external auditor, reviewed West Monroe’s policies, processes, and procedures to ensure they align to an agreed upon set of standards for service organizations established by the American Institute of Certified Public Accountants (AICPA). The audit focused on systems and process security. For each category within the standards, auditors tested adherence with policies and procedures by reviewing systems and work outputs. Based on the testing, the audit concluded there were no deviations from the firm’s policies, thus producing a “clean” opinion.

“As a trusted partner to many growing enterprises, it is very important to us to have this third-party attestation to the quality of our managed services, and we know our clients value it,” said Nathan Ulery, a managing director with West Monroe Partners and leader of the Managed Services practice. “While we are growing rapidly, both in size as well as expansion of our capabilities in areas such as managed security and application management, we maintain a strong commitment to delivering high quality in everything we do.” 

West Monroe’s Managed Services team includes more than 100 professionals and deep technology experts who work with clients to run systems and processes at peak performance. In 2016, the practice earned marketplace recognition for managed services, including ranking 22nd among the worlds most progressive Managed Services Providers in the MSPmentor 501 list and 19th on ChannelE2E’s first annual Top 100 Vertical Market MSPs list.

The AICPA finalized the SSAE 16 in January 2010, with the intention and purpose of updating the US service-organization reporting standard so that it mirrors and complies with the new international service-organization reporting standard, ISAE 3402.  The SSAE 16 also establishes a new attestation standard called AT 801, which contains guidance for performing the service auditor’s examination. 

For more information about SSAE 16 please click here.

title: West Monroeâ€™s Q4 poll data: 75% in C-suite are bullish on U.S. economic recovery
name: West Monroeâ€™s Q4 poll data: 75% in C-suite are bullish on U.S. economic recovery

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroeâ€™s Q4 poll data: 75% in C-suite are bullish on U.S. economic recovery

global_field.meta_title: West Monroeâ€™s Q4 poll data: 75% in C-suite are bullish on U.S. economic recovery

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe today released its latest results from the West Monroe Quarterly Executive Poll, showing that the C-suite is bullish on the U.S. economic recovery and has aggressive plans, despite the pandemic’s lingering effects.  

In the Q4 poll, 75% of C-suite respondents said their outlook is bullish heading into 2022, while 25% are bearish. While the effects of COVID-19, The Great Resignation, and supply shortages affected their businesses the most in 2021, their plans include trying new hiring and retention strategies, M&A, and new sustainability measures. 

Key findings of the Q4 poll results include: 

  • Three in four C-suite executives say they’re planning M&A activity in Q4, with 44% focusing on geographic expansion, 42% on acquiring new capabilities, and 9% on merging with a competitor.  
  • Executives are responding differently to the Biden administration’s proposed rule that all companies with 100 or more employees must require the vaccine or a weekly negative COVID test: 17% already act in accordance with the mandate, 30% said they were already on their way to doing so, 44% said they’ll do what they need to do to comply, and 8% said they are exploring alternative options.  
  • Hiring plans are still hot, with 71% saying they expect to hire more people this quarter, and 25% reporting little to no change. Hiring has increased significantly throughout the year, from 49% saying they’re hiring in Q1 to 60% in Q2 to 77% in Q3.  
  • Execs are trying several strategies to address the shortage of talent, with 68% increasing wages and salaries and 51% using contingent talent resources. For 44% of executives, their contingent workforce level is higher than they want it to be.  

Other poll results cover the future of business travel, hybrid workplace models, and sustainability. Read the full findings. 

West Monroe’s Quarterly Executive Poll takes the pulse of 150 C-level executives every quarter. This poll’s data was collected September 17-21, 2021. To qualify for the survey, respondents needed to have a C-level title at a company with at least $250 million in annual revenue.  

West Monroe publishes market-leading insights about the most pressing issues that face organizations today. Unlike other consulting firms, West Monroe believes digital transformation is a myth—digital is not a project, a team, or a destination, it is instead a mindset and way of working. West Monroe continually moves clients closer to running a digital organization.  

Previous West Monroe Quarterly Executive Polls can be found here.

About West Monroe 
West Monroe is a digital consulting firm that was born in technology but built for business—partnering with companies in transformative industries to deliver quantifiable financial value. We believe that digital is a mindset—not a project, a team, or a destination—and it’s something companies become, not something they do. That’s why we work in diverse, multidisciplinary teams that blend industry expertise with deep operational and technology capabilities—moving clients from traditional to digital operating models and creating products and experiences that transcend the digital and physical worlds. Our 1,800 employees also own 100% of our business, so when you partner with us you know we are committed—because your success is our success. Our undeniably different approach breeds undeniable results. Visit WestMonroe.com to learn more.

West Monroe Partners, a full-service North American business and technology consultancy, today announced that Sam Dawes, manager in the firm’s Operations Excellence practice has been named one of 35 “Rising Stars of the Profession” by Consulting magazine. Sam is recognized in the Client Service category in this prestigious ranking of top consultants under the age of 35.

Since joining West Monroe Partners in 2011, Sam developed specialized skills conducting IT and Operations due diligence and strategic business transformation programs in the M&D and retail industries. Sam is one of only a handful of people in firm’s history to be promoted from consultant to manager in 4 years.  

Sam started his career at West Monroe in Chicago as part of the firm’s Operations Excellence practice. In less than a year, he volunteered to assist in starting West Monroe’s Minneapolis office. He has been instrumental in helping the new office grow from 3 to 25 people, and in doing so set the standard for quick, profitable office growth (549%) while maintaining strong culture. Additionally, Sam is an example of firm’s stewardship value serving as the lead trainer of several foundational training courses for campus new hires and consultants.  He is also the national point person for recruiting at his alma mater, Miami University, one of the firm’s top schools for recruiting undergraduate talent.

“I’m extremely honored to continue the tradition of West Monroe employees winning this award for client service,” said Sam. “I view this as a validation of all the time and effort my mentors and managers invested in me early on – this is as much their award as it is mine. I look forward to continuing to grow my consulting career and contributing to West Monroe's overall growth strategy.”

“Sam’s client delivery and relationship skills set him apart from other high performers,” said Tom Ewers, managing director and leader of the firm’s Minneapolis office. “His ability to connect and immerse himself in his client work has been instrumental to building trust that results in long lasting partnerships with clients. He is equally passionate in the areas of recruiting and internal West Monroe cultural development – truly one of our best and brightest at the firm.”

Sam earned a B.S. in Business Economics degree from Miami University.

Consulting magazine profiles Sam and the other 34 “Rising Stars of the Profession” in its March 2016 issue. He will receive his award at an April 14 awards dinner in Chicago.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a progressive business and technology consultancy, today announced the relocation of its San Francisco office to 100 First Street, Suite 355.

The firm leased the 3,000-square-foot space through 2020 to accommodate rapid growth in the Bay Area. The short-term lease will accommodate an anticipated need to expand again within three years: West Monroe expects to double its local workforce by the end of this year, and double it again by the end of 2018.

West Monroe, which has 10 offices across the United States, entered the San Francisco market through its 2015 acquisition of Etherios, a consulting firm that specialized in delivering cloud-based customer relationship management (CRM) solutions built on the Salesforce platform. With the move, West Monroe Partners remains in close proximity to its largest strategic partner –  Salesforce—as well as other key customers in the heart of San Francisco’s vibrant tech, mergers and acquisitions, and financial services community.

“While our position as a Salesforce Platinum Consulting Partner continues to drive a good portion of our work locally, our office has diversified and added talent in other core service areas, such as mergers and acquisitions,” said Will Wu, a director in the firm’s Customer Experience practice who leads the San Francisco office. “Collaboration among practices is essential to delivering differentiated client service, and the new office provides ample space for our rapidly expanding team to work together and foster close relationships.  

In San Francisco, 100 First Street features a rooftop garden and proximity to the Transbay Transit Center, currently under development. It received the Building of the Year Award in 2015 and has consistently been awarded with Energy Star certification for its energy efficiency. In 2009, the U.S. Green Building Council awarded the building LEED Gold Certification.

West Monroe previously occupied space at 50 Fremont Street.

“Strategic growth and expansion in Northern California is vital to our long-term national strategy and key to increasing our presence on the West Coast,” said Tom Bolger, the firm’s senior managing director of strategic growth. “San Francisco is an important market for several core industries that West Monroe serves, including banking, private equity, healthcare, and energy. At the same time, we look forward to tapping into the area’s exceptional talent pool to advance our mission of developing the next generation of leaders.”

West Monroe’s growth strategy includes building its leadership team in the Bay Area. In November 2016, John Stiffler, a senior director, transferred from Chicago to San Francisco to lead and build the firm’s West Coast Mergers & Acquisitions practice.

“While West Monroe has provided transaction support to West Coast clients for years, dedicating Bay Area talent to service Bay Area clients is critical to success. As a result, we added about a dozen private equity firms to our client base in the past year,” Stiffler said. “As the San Francisco team grows, we look forward to providing even more local expertise from a range of our practices.” 

West Monroe Partners, known for a distinctive people-first culture, has earned more than 20 awards in the past year alone, including: 
• Consulting Magazine’s “Best Firms to Work For” 
• Great Place to Work & Fortune’s “Best Small and Medium Workplaces”
• Consulting Magazine’s “Excellence in Social and Community Investment”
• The Talent Board’s “Candidate Experience Award”

title: West Monroeâ€™s Tom Hulsebosch Named One of ConsultingÂ® Magazineâ€™s Top 25 Consultants of 2015

global_field.meta_title: West Monroeâ€™s Tom Hulsebosch Named One of ConsultingÂ® Magazineâ€™s Top 25 Consultants of 2015
global_field.meta_description: Track Record for Practice Development, Smart-grid Innovation Earns 25-Year Industry Veteran Recognition for â€œExcellence in Energyâ€

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a full-service business and technology consultancy, today announced that Consulting® magazine has named Tom Hulsebosch, managing director of the firm’s Energy & Utilities and Sustainability practices, one of its Top 25 Consultants for 2015. Hulsebosch earned the “Excellence in Energy” award in recognition of his practice development and leadership as well as his role in smart-grid innovation.

Since joining West Monroe Partners in 2008, Hulsebosch has developed the firm’s Energy & Utilities business from the ground up into a thriving practice with 45 consultants that work with clients across North America. Under his leadership, the practice consistently has been one of West Monroe’s fastest growing, and it has earned a leadership reputation and strong credentials in smart-grid strategy and execution. Hulsebosch has personally helped more than 30 utilities embark on their smart-grid journeys.

“It’s humbling just to be nominated let alone win this award.  But to me this award—like consulting, in general—is really about the team we have put in the marketplace and the work we have done for our energy and utility clients,” said Hulsebosch. “I particularly enjoy the opportunity to work with some of the smartest, most committed, and the most talented people that I’ve encountered in my career—including both colleagues at West Monroe Partners and at our clients.”

A 25-year veteran of the utility, Internet service provider (ISP), and wireless telecommunications industries, Hulsebosch has translated his experience and vision into an array of smart-grid products and tools—including the Smart Grid Assessment Profile (S-GAP) for creating smart utility (electric, water, and gas) business cases, West Monroe SMARTTM regulatory reporting tool for federal grant winners, ConnecttheGridTM which helps utilities enroll and manage distributed generation resources like rooftop solar on their grids and WMProgram which automates key program and portfolio management processes required when running large business transformation programs.

Hulsebosch also serves on West Monroe’s Board of Managers and is the executive sponsor of its Sustainability team that helps West Monroe’s clients achieve triple bottom goals (social, environmental, and financial). Hulsebosch is a founding member of the Center for Smart Grid Applications Research and Technology (CSMART) at the Illinois Institute of Technology. CSMART was formed in partnership with ComEd, Silver Spring Networks and West Monroe Partners to research, test, and analyze the latest smart grid technology innovations in a real-world environment.

Each year, Consulting® magazine publishes a list of the Top 25 Consultants to recognize top professionals in the industry. Hulsebosch and the other recipients are featured in the May issue of Consulting® magazine and will receive their awards at a gala dinner at The Pierre Hotel in New York City on June 18.

title: West Monroeâ€™s work with Barclaycard US leads to a 2016 CX Innovation Award
name: West Monroeâ€™s work with Barclaycard US leads to a 2016 CX Innovation Award

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroeâ€™s work with Barclaycard US leads to a 2016 CX Innovation Award

global_field.meta_title: West Monroeâ€™s work with Barclaycard US leads to a 2016 CX Innovation Award
global_field.meta_description: West Monroe Partners, a full-service business and technology consultancy, today announced that a project with Barclaycard US was awarded a 2016 CX Innovation Award at the Customer Experience Professionals Associationâ€™s (CXPA) annual Insight Exchange event.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
The CX Innovation Awards, now in its fifth year, recognize companies that demonstrate innovative techniques to improve customer experience and business results. A panel of expert judges selected Barclaycard as one of only five winners for 2016. 

West Monroe’s partnership with Barclaycard on their “Customer Journey Operation Model” led to the prestigious award. Barclaycard’s innovation focuses on the often overlooked yet critical component of organizational design. The CX team, in collaboration with the CEO created a governance model centered on key customer journeys, and assigned owners, who have end-to-end accountability and are empowered to make decisions for their journeys, including resource allocations. Though it is early in the implementation, benefits include transparency in project investment, alignment across channels and functions, and more focus on the customer.

“West Monroe Partners is honored to have worked with Barclaycard on this project. It’s something that is truly cutting-edge in financial services and our team is proud to have worked with Barclaycard on such an innovative customer journey operation model. We are excited to see how this approach will continue to help Barclaycard remain one of the top in the industry,” said Kyle Hutchins, senior director and national lead of customer experience at West Monroe Partners. 

"Each year the remarkable winning innovations set the bar higher, and then the next year's entries reach and surpass those high levels, as these creative and sophisticated initiatives demonstrate," said Tabitha Dunn, Vice President, Customer Experience, Concur Technologies and co-lead for the 2016 Insight Exchange. "The teams who developed this year's remarkable winning innovations, benefiting their companies and their customers, are also benefiting the whole CX field and moving the industry forward."

Watch the video discussing the project and to hear directly from Sylvia Veitia and Gil Mermelstein, managing director at West Monroe.

View the full listing of the 2016 CX Innovation Award winners.

About the CXPA

The Customer Experience Professionals Association is the premier global non-profit organization dedicated to the advancement and cultivation of the Customer Experience profession. The CXPA increases the impact and visibility of Customer Experience professionals, facilitates effective member-to-member sharing, and establishes respected standards. Founded in April 2011, the CXPA has more than 80 Corporate Members and 4,000 customer experience professionals in its community. For more information, visit www.cxpa.org.

title: West Monroeâ€™s Yves Leclerc Named to Loyolaâ€™s Supply and Value Chain Center
name: West Monroeâ€™s Yves Leclerc Named to Loyolaâ€™s Supply and Value Chain Center

summary_info.summary_title: West Monroeâ€™s Yves Leclerc Named to Loyolaâ€™s Supply and Value Chain Center

global_field.meta_title: West Monroeâ€™s Yves Leclerc Named to Loyolaâ€™s Supply and Value Chain Center
global_field.meta_description: Leclerc committed to improving global supply chains

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a North American business and technology firm, today announced that Yves Leclerc, a managing director and leader of the firm’s supply chain practice, has been named to the advisory board of the Loyola Quinlan School of Business Supply and Value Chain Center.

The Supply and Value Chain Center (SVCC) led by John Caltagirone of the Quinlan School of Business at Loyola University Chicago is dedicated to the development of leading-edge strategies and practical solutions to problems encountered by the business community relative to the management of the end-to-end supply chain.

“I am honored to be part of this distinguished group working to improve global supply chain management and sustainability,” said Yves Leclerc, managing director at West Monroe Partners. “This group is the perfect forum to develop both innovations in the supply chain as well as develop future leaders interested in making an impact on the global and local economy.”

To serve the needs of the growing Chicago business community and beyond, the SVCC provides the common platform where industry leaders and academics can exchange ideas and advance knowledge in Global Supply Chain Management. The center takes a pragmatic approach towards advancing the understanding and practice of supply chain management: demand forecasting and management; strategic sourcing and procurement; manufacturing and operations; inventory management; distribution; and transportation management. The center builds on this knowledge to penetrate emerging areas of importance such as sustainability, risk management, demand driven supply networks, outsourcing, and reshoring.

title: Will McNamara Joins West Monroe
name: Will McNamara Joins West Monroe

summary_info.summary_title: Will McNamara Joins West Monroe

global_field.meta_title: Will McNamara Joins West Monroe
global_field.meta_description: McNamara will Launch West Monroe's New Regulatory Support & Key Stakeholder Relations Service offering.

richtext.rich_text_editor:
West Monroe Partners, a North American management and technology consulting firm, today announced that Will McNamara, PMP, has recently joined the firm’s Chicago office as a Senior Manager in the Energy & Utilities practice.

Mr. McNamara is a regulatory and legislative affairs expert with over 15 years of energy industry policy-making, project management, expert testimony, and stakeholder-relations experience. Mr. McNamara has unique expertise in developing Smart Grid / AMI policy and managing business plans and regulatory filings that have enabled utility clients to achieve regulatory and community support for their project initiatives.

Mr. McNamara comes to West Monroe from KEMA, Inc., where he served as a Senior Principal Consultant. In that role Mr. McNamara assisted utility clients such as Duke Energy, Consolidated Edison, Los Angeles District Water & Power, San Diego Gas & Electric, the Southern California Public Power Authority, and the Snohomish Public Utility District in managing their diverse AMI / Smart Grid deployments. Prior to KEMA, Mr. McNamara served as Regulatory and Legislative Policy Manager for Sempra Energy, where he developed the corporate policy response to energy-related matters before the California Public Utilities Commission, the California Legislature and the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission. In addition to being a certified Project Management Professional (PMP), Mr. McNamara is also a published author in the energy sector, having written an analytical account of the California energy crisis.

West Monroe Partner’s new Regulatory Support & Key Stakeholder Relations service offering expands the firm’s existing suite of management and technology services for utility clients. West Monroe has been active in the regulatory space through the preparation of AMI / Smart Grid business cases for utility clients and their key stakeholders, including public utility commissions, utility advisory boards, and city councils. The maturing of the AMI / Smart Grid industry is driving needs within utilities for regulatory and key stakeholder services, including operational & performance benchmarking analysis; regulatory compliance assistance; expert testimony in regulatory proceedings; mobilizing community and key stakeholder support for AMI / Smart Grid utility projects; internal management alignment within client organizations; and expanded services associated with federal and state grant opportunities for utilities, an area in which West Monroe is already well established. 

“Will McNamara adds a significant regulatory, community-relations, and key stakeholder management capability to West Monroe’s Energy & Utilities practice, as well as substantial hands-on experience guiding utility clients through the many regulatory and public-relations challenges that are becoming such a prominent consideration for Smart Grid deployments,” said Tom Hulsebosch, managing director of West Monroe Partner’s E&U practice. “We believe that our Regulatory and Key Stakeholder service offering will be valuable to public power, cooperative, and investor owned utilities alike. We are seeing a significantly higher engagement from all of the utility stakeholders, which if not managed properly can negatively impact a utility’s AMI/Smart Grid program.”

“I am thrilled to join West Monroe’s already-thriving E&U practice and contribute to the firm’s very compelling capabilities,” said McNamara. “My current perspective is what I refer to as the ‘second wave’ of utility AMI/ Smart Grid deployment, utilities across the U.S. facing increased regulatory and public challenges. This is a particular concern among smaller and mid-sized utilities that are still formulating their initial deployment strategies. One benefit we have is to learn from the experiences of the utilities that are further down the deployment path. I believe performance benchmarking, as one example, will become a very important and strategic tool in the regulatory environment going forward.”

Read more about West Monroe Partner’s work within the utility industry. If you would like additional information on West Monroe’s new practice area, please contact Tom Hulsebosch.

About West Monroe

West Monroe is a North American, full-service business and technology consulting firm focused on guiding organizations through projects that fundamentally transform their business. With the experience to create the most ambitious visions as well as the skills to implement the smallest details of our client’s most critical projects, West Monroe is a proven provider of growth and efficiency to large enterprises, as well as more nimble middle-market organizations. Our more than 300 consulting professionals drive better business results by harnessing our collective experience across a range of industries, serving clients out of offices across the US and Canada.

title: Workforce Magazine Ranks West Monroe as No. 31 on 2017 Workforce 100 List
name: Workforce Magazine Ranks West Monroe as No. 31 on 2017 Workforce 100 List

summary_info.summary_title: Workforce Magazine Ranks West Monroe as No. 31 on 2017 Workforce 100 List

global_field.meta_title: Workforce Magazine Ranks West Monroe as No. 31 on 2017 Workforce 100 List

richtext.rich_text_editor:
May 24, 2017 — West Monroe Partners, a business and technology consulting firm, today announced as a prestigious honoree of the 2017 Workforce 100 presented by Workforce magazine, a Human Capital Media publication. Now in its fourth year, Workforce 100 designates companies as the best in HR management through statistical analysis conducted by Human Capital Media Advisory Group. West Monroe ranked No. 31 in its first time on the list.

The Workforce 100 chart indicates the rank order and scores of the 100 companies that performed best in seven core areas: workplace culture; employee benefits; diversity and inclusion; employee development/ talent management; HR innovation/management; leadership development; recruiting and talent acquisition. The working assumption is that high performance in these categories would provide a reasonable proxy for overall HR excellence.

West Monroe’s Chief People Officer Susan M. Stelter is pictured on the cover of the magazine and featured in the cover story about first-time companies on the list. In the article, she highlighted West Monroe’s people-first culture. “It is an honor to be ranked No. 31 out of the top 100 companies for best-in-class people practices,” Stelter said. “This is a testament to the passion and engagement of our 850-plus employee owners who make the firm a great place to work every day.”

West Monroe’s unique people practices include a 1+1+1 program where the firm donates 1% of its time, 1% of its talent, and 1% of its treasure to the greater good. Employees earn paid time off for each hour they volunteer through this program. The firm also supports employees’ philanthropic and humanitarian interests with an extended three- to six-month compensated leave through the Fischer Fellowship Program.

To find out which companies are the best for HR management, Workforce editors, along with researchers from the Human Capital Media Advisory Group, the magazine’s research arm, created a statistical formula to sift through publicly available information to separate the best from the rest. The result of that analysis is the Workforce 100 list.

“We’re pleased this awards program continues to grow in popularity, but also in its ability to report organizations’ performance with greater accuracy,” said Rick Bell, Workforce magazine’s editorial director. “Our rankings are compiled with tangible data backed by extensive research, and it continues to prove valuable in setting industry benchmarks.”

Workforce 100 honorees were announced on April 21, 2017 and West Monroe is profiled in the May/June issue of Workforce magazine.
